string.original: Spent resources are gone permanently, so make sure you have enough additional resources to get by before you pull the trigger.
Gather {total} Email Hacking Devices to track down seller.
We found the seller! It happens to be another one of our own allies: {playerB,name}!
string.variation: We found the seller! It happens to be another one of our own allies: {playerB,fem}!
We found the seller! It happens to be another one of our own allies: {playerB,masc}!

string.original: Send a diplomatic team to meet with {playerB,name} and ask for our secret blueprints back!
string.variation: Send a diplomatic team to meet with {playerB,fem} and ask for our secret blueprints back!
Send a diplomatic team to meet with {playerB,masc} and ask for our secret blueprints back!

string.original: Gather Red Hearts by helping out on your neighbors' islands.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to earn {playerB,name}'s trust.
string.variation: Collect {total} Red Hearts to earn {playerB,fem}'s trust.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to earn {playerB,masc}'s trust.

string.original: Gather {total} Diplomatic Visas to meet with their ambassadors.
Harvest {total} Pineapple as a diplomatic gift.
I can't believe this. {playerB,name} refuses to meet with us! They must be hiding something.
string.variation: I can't believe this. {playerB,fem} refuses to meet with us! They must be hiding something.
I can't believe this. {playerB,masc} refuses to meet with us! They must be hiding something.

string.original: {playerB,name} refuses to meet with us. We're going to have to get our plans back the hard way!
string.variation: {playerB,fem} refuses to meet with us. We're going to have to get our plans back the hard way!
{playerB,masc} refuses to meet with us. We're going to have to get our plans back the hard way!

string.original: Find the Ambush Strike Team in the Joint Strike HQ building.
Collect {total} Mastery Tokens as a show of strength.
Build an Ambush Strike Team in case of retaliation.
Collect {total} Rappel Ropes to enter their Executive Mansion.
{playerB,name} had no choice! They owe money to that crook, BF Dealio, and he's set up a blockade!
string.variation: {playerB,fem} had no choice! They owe money to that crook, BF Dealio, and he's set up a blockade!
{playerB,masc} had no choice! They owe money to that crook, BF Dealio, and he's set up a blockade!

string.original: {playerB,name} owes BF Dealio from a shady deal gone bad. Let's see if we can convince Dealio to back off.
string.variation: {playerB,fem} owes BF Dealio from a shady deal gone bad. Let's see if we can convince Dealio to back off.
{playerB,masc} owes BF Dealio from a shady deal gone bad. Let's see if we can convince Dealio to back off.

string.original: Ask your friends to send you Armored Transports to carry the payoff.
Send {total} Wood to pay off {playerB,name}'s debt.
string.variation: Send {total} Wood to pay off {playerB,fem}'s debt.
Send {total} Wood to pay off {playerB,masc}'s debt.

string.original: Send {total} Coins to pay off {playerB,name}'s debt.
string.variation: Send {total} Coins to pay off {playerB,fem}'s debt.
Send {total} Coins to pay off {playerB,masc}'s debt.

string.original: Collect {total} Armored Transports to deliver the payoff.
Argh! Dealio is refusing to lift the blockade on {playerB,name}. What a jerk.
string.variation: Argh! Dealio is refusing to lift the blockade on {playerB,fem}. What a jerk.
Argh! Dealio is refusing to lift the blockade on {playerB,masc}. What a jerk.

string.original: BF Dealio won't back off. Let's rally our allies together and relieve him of his stubbornness.
Upgrade your units to make battles easier.
Gather {total} Joint Strike Maps for the mission.
We did it! We broke through the blockade, and the blueprints have been recovered!
Jimmy Eelberg, a.k.a. "The Eel", is en route to the North Pole to recover a new superconductive element from a meteorite, usable for weapon research!

The {crewableDeco} provides a {decoBonusNum}% bonus on housing ({crewedDecoBonusNum}% when crewed) and {staffBonusNum} staff visits to government buildings ({crewedStaffBonusNum} when crewed). You can repeat missions up to {timesAmount} times.
You earned Empire Points! Buy yourself something nice.
You got the Ice Palace for a building bonus!
You have {num} Coins. You need {total}. Go collect more!
You have {num} Wood. You need {total}. Go collect more!
Stop the Eel from beating you to the North Pole and earn EP or the Ice Palace!
I've got a good lead for you. The Eel is taking a team to the North Pole to scoop up a superconductive meteorite. That material would be useful.
We need to prepare for a frigid journey. It won't be easy, but you'll get a KFX Fighter for your efforts.
You can ask your friends to send you items.
Pay {total} Coins to obtain North Pole passports.
Beat the Eel's rear guard to get information from them.
Now it's time to make a choice...take the high road, or the low road?
We need to train, adapt our jets and work with our allies before moving forward.
Enter Survival Mode by clicking on the Survival Mode HQ.
Build {total} Fighters for arctic air fighting.
Gather {total} Snow Shovels, in case you need to shovel snow.
Survive {total} waves in Survival Mode for training.
We're lookin' good. We should be ready to rock and roll.
The Eel has several ships stationed in Burr Bay. We need to blast our way through.
Tend Neighbors' Ore Mines to collect {nrare3}. Their portrait will tell you if they have it or not.
Gather {total} Frozen Sensors for detecting enemy movement.
Fight Eel forces in Burr Bay.
Collect {total} {nrare3} to smelt custom cold-weather ammo.
That could've been worse. It only gets tougher from here on out.
Mr. Eel is trying to slow us down. He's got ground troops in Tundratown. We need to keep moving!
You can collect different ore types from different Neighbors.
Collect {total} Fruitcakes to use as spare tires.
Nice one. You're a regular Admiral Byrd. Wait, he was the South Pole guy, right? Whatever.
We get through North Chillyville and we're home free. So, win this. Or the Eel wins. That's all.
Click on the Battle Blitz button to go head to head with other players.
Assemble a team of {total} Rescue Dogs to find frozen troops.
Win {total} Battle Blitz Battles: show no weakness!
Fight Eel forces in the skies above North Chillyville.
We're almost there. I'm glad, because parts of my body are frozen to other parts of my body. Not good.
Stop the Eel, get the reward. Set up lights for the flight home, and bring Seabolt a gift while you're at it.
Ask friends to send you the parts you need.
Collect {total} Polar Monkeys for Dr. Seabolt - for Science!
Collect {total} sets of Emergency Runway Lights.
Defeat the Eel in the battle of Frigid Bountyland.
Well done! Now kick back and enjoy the ride home.
The North Pole isn't just around the corner. Keeping dry will help us stay warm along the way.
Ask your friends to send you the things you need to make this mission a success.
Donate {total} Wood to the Eskimo relief fund.
Warm up your jets with an air skirmish.
Okay. That's done. On to the next thing.
Mittens will come in handy too. GET IT?
Purchase an Expansion in the Expansion tab of the Build menu.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers to give your soldiers a kick.
Get an expansion to make room for the Ice Palace.
We've got supplies. We're going in on foot, so preparation is key.
Staying warm is key, and you don't want anything to freeze off.
Power-Ups can be built in the Power-Up Factory.
Amass {total} Bun Warmers to protect your troops' rear flanks.
Engage in {total} fights with other players to keep your edge.
Build {total} Air Strike II Power-Ups to keep your men busy.
We'll be able to sneak by undetected, unless The Eel sees us. Then, not so much.
The Eel's rear flank patrol won't be able to resist this fruitcake. It's from two years ago.
Collect Red Hearts by helping out on your Neighbors' islands.
Acquire {total} Moose Horn Helmets for camouflage.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to show you're friendly.
Build {total} Field Repair II Power-Ups in case something breaks down.
We're close now. I just wish it weren't so c-c-cold. I need a crowbar to go to the bathroom.
The meteorite is close. We'll dress up like penguins to slip past the guards, then signal for the supply drop!
Build an Ambush Strike Team in the Strike Team HQ.
Obtain {total} Penguin Disguises to slip by the Eel's men.
Collect {total} Snowcats for a quick escape.
Build an Ambush Strike Team in case the Eel retaliates.
We did it! Let's get back to the island, where it's sunny and I don't have my coffee served on a stick.
The Titan parts recovered from the invasion have led us to what appears to be a Mighty Titan Facility. Be careful. It's likely well defended.
The parts you'll gain from completing these missions will eventually be used to reverse engineer and assemble your own Titan!
You have {num} Wood. You need {total}. Go collect more!
You have {num} Oil. You need {total}. Go collect more!
Click the beacon to fight off the latest wave of Titans! Get exclusive parts that will be used to reverse-engineer the TITAN.
I've been inspecting the Titan parts recovered from the invasion. There's a tracking device hidden on it which is linked to a secret base.
I've been inspecting the Titan parts recovered from the invasion. There's a tracking device hidden on it which is linked to a secret base.
These units will help you defeat more titans.
Launch this Acid Blast to weaken the Titan.
All the Titans have been stopped - for now. You personally defeated {num} Titans, and the entire world thanks you!
The army of 1,000,000 Titans was vanquished, no thanks to you. Too busy, were you? Fortunately, your allies stepped up!
Use everything you can: Power-Ups, Upgrades, and Experimental Units. It will take every trick in the book to bring down a Titan.
There are {num} Titans left. Defeat more and repel the invasion!
We are closing in on the location, but the place seems to be camouflaged.
Ask your friends to send you the parts you need.
Have {total} GPS Tracking Devices to triangulate signals.
Have {total} Laser SatCom Systems to listen to activity.
The entire facility has a cloaking field. Fascinating!
The cloaking field is gone, but we're still not inside. There's a front wall we need to get past.
Click on the Build Ladders button when you have enough Wood to build the ladders.
Gather Grappling Hooks to climb over.
The courtyard is really quiet. Definitely too quiet.
Go to your Neighbors' islands to harvest their crops.
Gather Mine Detectors to locate mines.
Harvest Neighbor crops {total} times to clear vegetation.
What an unwelcoming front courtyard that was!
The only way in appears to be through the trash chute.
Click on the Burn Oil button when you've gathered enough to burn away the garbage clogging the trash chute.
Collect {total} Gas Masks to survive in the tunnels.
We're finally in! And we're one step closer to destroying this place.
First things first: We have to dismantle the Assembly Line. Be careful, this place is crawling with Titans.
Power-Up can be built in the Power-Up Factory.
Gather {total} Demolitions Experts to set the charges.
Build an Evasion II Power-Up to avoid detection.
That should put a halt to the production line.
Raid the Engineering Bay for spare Titan Parts. We could research these.
Collect {nrare3} by tending your Neighbors' Ore Mines, or purchasing it in their Markets.
We'd better start cooking up more Acid Blast Power-Ups. Something tells me we're going to need them.
The Titan Testing Facility should be all that's left of this place. Collect more scraps for my research!
Any kind of Soldier can help search the facility.
Collect Reverse Injection Modulators from the scraps.
Place Soldiers to help search the facility.
That's it! Now we just have to escape and trigger the explosives. Wait, what's that sound...
A Titan is standing in our escape path. We have to hurry and get clear of the explosives.
Use Power-Ups to help in your fight with the Final Guardian Titan.
Collect Inert Containers to transport Acid Power-Ups.
Collect Shipping Containers to transport spare Titan parts.
The Mighty Titan Facility is destroyed and another invasion has been averted!
There's a civil war in Mercadia. We need to restore order, but which side will we help - the government or the rebels?
The missions are repeatable and can be completed up to 10 times. The Mystery Crate will contain either 3, 5, 25 or 50 EP.
There's a civil war in Mercadia - will you join the people or the government? Earn exclusive units or EP mystery crates worth up to 50 EP!
There's a citizen's revolt in Mercadia! Which side will you choose to help - the people or the government? Either side will reward you handsomely!
You have {num} Wood. You need {total}. Go collect more!
You have {num} Oil. You need {total}. Go collect more!
We have to get to Mercadia and review the situation there.
Find Watch Towers in the Decorations tab of the Build menu.
Place {total} Watch Towers to gain some local stability.
Gather {total} Newspapers to read up on events.
Tend {total} Neighbor Houses to gauge public opinion.
The anger here runs deep. There's no peaceful resolution this time. We're going to have to take a side.
The people's villages are on fire! They need our help.
The wood you send will be gone permanently from your inventory.
Gather {total} Fire Extinguishers to put out fires.
Fight against Looters to preserve property values.
Send {total} Wood to help rebuild burned houses.
Nice work. The fires are out, but there's more to do.
Military crackdowns have caused many injuries among the protesters. Let's give them a hand.
You can build Power-Ups in the Power-Up Factory.
Gather {total} First Aid Kits to distribute to the people.
Build a Field Repairs I Power-Up.
Build {total} Tire Factories to keep ambulances running.
Good job! The rebellion is regaining its momentum now!
There are still some wealthy citizens who are sitting on the sidelines. Let's get their support!
Get Red Hearts by helping out on your Neighbors' islands.
Gather {total} Bottles of Wine to meet with the wealthy.
Harvest {total} Eggplant to make Eggplant Parmigiana.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to show our moral standing.
We now have the upper class's support! This will make a difference!
We need to take over the media center to halt the oppressor's propaganda.
Deploy Strike Teams to repel invasions.
Gather Battering Rams to break into the media center.
Fight the guards protecting the media center.
The media center is ours! There's one last step: The Executive Mansion!
The ruthless leaders are hiding in the Executive Mansion. Let's get in there!
Use upgraded units and Power-Ups to get through the toughest battles.
Gather {total} Molotov Cocktails to flush out the government.
Gather {total} Flare Guns to signal the final assualt.
We did it! Their leaders are cowering in the basement. Justice will be served!
The rebel mobs are out of control. The leaders are hiding in the villages. We'll have to burn them out.
Build Power-Ups in the Power-Up Factory.
Gather Molotov Cocktails to burn their meeting places.
Use {total} Accuracy I Power-Ups to avoid collateral damage.
They can't hide in the villages any more, but they're still at large. Stay vigilant.
The landowners are frightened. We need to protect their neighborhoods before the rebels get to them.
Have your friends speed up your Lumbermills to harvest wood sooner.
Gather {total} Barbed Wire to create a perimeter.
Gather {total} Wood to build riot barriers.
Have an Air Depot with {total} units inside.
Nice job. The wealthy are satisfied with our protection.
We just got word the rebels are going to set fire to the oil fields. We can't let this happen!
Have your friends speed up your Oil Wells to gather from them sooner.
Export {total} Oil to prevent fires from spreading.
Gather {total} Bear Traps to stop any trespassers.
Fend off the rebel raiding party.
That should keep them away. These revolutionaries are relentless though.
The rebels are spreading their propaganda through the internet. We need to pull the plug on this immediately.
Press the Battle Blitz button to go fight in Battle Blitz.
Fight {total} Battle Blitz combats to scare off supporters.
Gather {total} Wire Cutters to cut off the internet.
We've cut off the soure of the rebels' propaganda.
The hooligans have amassed in front of the Parliament building. This is their final push.
Ask your friends to send you the items you need.
Gather {total} Riot Gear to confront the crowds.
Hopefully this should keep the peace for a while.
Collect Weapons Crates from battling enemies. Turn them in with other parts to B.F. Dealio and get a Platinum Unit, randomly selected from a Mystery Crate!
Three levels of difficulty: harder levels give you better rewards in your Mystery Crate. You have an equal chance to win each unit in each crate.
Complete to win ONE of these amazing prizes!
You earned a Bronze Mystery Crate! Try your luck again, or go for a harder challenge - and better prize pool!
You earned a Silver Mystery Crate! Try your luck again, or go for a harder challenge - and better prize pool!
You earned a Gold Mystery Crate! Try your luck again for a chance at a different reward!
You have {num} Weapons Crates. You need {total}. Go get some more by crushing more enemies!
Turn in Weapons Crates for a randomly selected Platinum Unit!
Hey, I've got a deal for you. Help me get a couple of things for my chateau, and I'll let you trade in Weapons Crates for a Platinum Unit!
I can't impress clients with plain old plumbing. Help me get some platinum and Weapon Crates in here, and I'll return the favor.
Beat the toughest units to get the most Weapons Crates.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to show your love of B.F. Dealio.
Collect {total} Weapons Crates by fighting battles.
Sweet. Anyone who relieves themself here will think "This guy's got CLASS." That's right, baby. I'm drippin' with it.
You scratch my back... and then I'll have my masseuse give me a rub down. Now go get those Weapon Crates!
Beat the toughest units to get the most Weapons Crates.
Collect {total} Hot Tubs, one for each guest room.
Get {total} Tanning Booths, one for each floor.
Collect {total} Weapons Crates by fighting battles.
I don't use tanning booths. I spend so much money on custom moisturizers, why damage my milky complexion?
I need a couple of items for my super-classy dinner events, plus more Weapons Crates, of course.
Beat the toughest units to get the most Weapons Crates.
Collect {total} Platinum Salad Tongs for tossing guests' salads.
Collect {total} Weapons Crates by fighting battles.
I'm gonna be featured on that TV show, "Celebrity Arms Dealer Homes." Pineapples class up the joint.
We just got word about a new cabal preparing to unleash a contaminated version of Element Z to the world. Find this rogue refinery and destroy it!
You earn the Black Ops Rocket Artillery each time you complete all quests. Upon reaching level 55, you will have the unlock as well! Complete again to earn more units.
Nice job, rookie. But I'd feel safer if we knew more about this Alchemy organization...
You have {num} Ore. You need {total}. Go collect more!
Click to start a Black Ops mission - It's the only way to earn exclusive Black Ops Units.
Click to start a Black Ops mission - It's the only way to earn exclusive Black Ops Units.
We just got word about a cabal preparing to distribute a contaminated version of Element Z. Find this refinery and get a special Black Ops unit.
Intel on the secret plant came from one of our mercs, Ace, but he's gone into hiding. Find him!
Press the Battle Blitz button to find opponents to fight.
Gather {total} Recon Pilots to search for Ace.
Collect {total} Bloodhounds to track Ace down.
Win {total} Battle Blitz fights to reach Ace's inner sanctum.
We caught up with Ace, but he's not talking until we help him out first...
Seems Ace owes a bit of money, and if we want him to scratch our back, we gotta scratch his.
Once you have enough {nrare3}, hit the "Pay Bookies" button to pay off Ace's debt.
Pay off Ace's bookies by sending {total} {nrare3}.
Defeat the thugs trying to collect on Ace's debts.
Ace says his file contains the location of the Rogue Z plant, but he can't decipher it. It's encrypted!
The file we received from Ace needs to be decrypted. We'll have to do some digging to decipher this message.
Repel enemy invasions on your own island or on your neighbors' islands.
Collect {total} Foreign Language CDs from your allies.
Speed Up {total} neighbor Barracks to enlist military intelligence.
Repel {total} PvP invasions to protect your researchers.
Eureka! The message reveals that a group calling itself "Alchemy" has built an Element Z plant on a hidden island. Go find 'em!
I don't care who these punks are. Find them and destroy them!
Get Red Hearts by helping out your neighbors on their islands.
Collect {total} Thermal Images to find the plant's location.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to finesse information about "Alchemy".
Use an EMP I Power-Up {total} times to knock out electronic countermeasures.
This plant is empty! But someone paid these rebels a lot of money to throw us off the track. But why?
Let's search the plant. There's gotta be clues to where the real plant might be!
Use Military Decorations to get discount bonuses.
Collect {total} Night Vision Binoculars to look for booby traps.
Build {total} Units with a Military discount greater than 10%.
Defeat the enemy forces lying in wait.
The chemicals in this Rogue Z plant can only be found in one place: the mysterious island of Arcana!
I don't like being led around by the nose like that. It's time to take this rogue Element Z plant out. Permanently!
Get Mastery Tokens by defeating Villains on their home islands.
Collect {total} Handcuffs to take the Alchemy operatives into custody.
Gather {total} Tranquilizer Darts to take out the Rogue Z guards.
Collect {total} Mastery Tokens as we defeat Alchemy's minions.
Well done! We intercepted the Rogue Z before it made its way into military supply lines.
{playerA,name} seems to have gone missing. What could have happened to them?
string.variation: {playerA,fem} seems to have gone missing. What could have happened to them?
{playerA,masc} seems to have gone missing. What could have happened to them?

string.original: Complete the mission to build {theUnitName} at level {levelNum} along with one free {unitName}.
You have {num} Ore. You need {total}. Go collect more!
{playerA,name} is missing! We need to find out what happened!
string.variation: {playerA,fem} is missing! We need to find out what happened!
{playerA,masc} is missing! We need to find out what happened!

string.original: {playerA,name} is missing! We need to find out what happened!
string.variation: {playerA,fem} is missing! We need to find out what happened!
{playerA,masc} is missing! We need to find out what happened!

string.original: You earned an unlock for this unit along with one free unit!
I suspect foul play. Let's learn what we can about our friend's whereabouts.
Power-Ups and Ally Powers don't count toward your damage task.
We've found a distress signal! We need to track down its location.
{playerA,name} is sending a distress signal. We need to triangulate its location.
string.variation: {playerA,fem} is sending a distress signal. We need to triangulate its location.
{playerA,masc} is sending a distress signal. We need to triangulate its location.

string.original: Repel Player Invasions on your own island or on your friends' islands.
Collect {total} Spectrum Analyzers to locate the signal.
Repel {total} Player Invasions to protect the search teams.
We've found it. The signal is coming from {playerB,name}'s island. Why there?
string.variation: We've found it. The signal is coming from {playerB,fem}'s island. Why there?
We've found it. The signal is coming from {playerB,masc}'s island. Why there?

string.original: {playerA,name}'s signal is coming from {playerB,name}'s island. What could be happening?
string.variation: {playerA,fem}'s signal is coming from {playerB,fem}'s island. What could be happening?
{playerA,fem}'s signal is coming from {playerB,masc}'s island. What could be happening?
{playerA,masc}'s signal is coming from {playerB,fem}'s island. What could be happening?
{playerA,masc}'s signal is coming from {playerB,masc}'s island. What could be happening?

string.original: Any Soldier unit will help us to look for {playerA,name}.
string.variation: Any Soldier unit will help us to look for {playerA,fem}.
Any Soldier unit will help us to look for {playerA,masc}.

string.original: Use {total} Air Strike II Power-Ups to show we mean business.
{playerB,name} informed us that {playerA,name} met with the local ambassadors, but disappeared shortly after.
string.variation: {playerB,fem} informed us that {playerA,fem} met with the local ambassadors, but disappeared shortly after.
{playerB,fem} informed us that {playerA,masc} met with the local ambassadors, but disappeared shortly after.
{playerB,masc} informed us that {playerA,fem} met with the local ambassadors, but disappeared shortly after.
{playerB,masc} informed us that {playerA,masc} met with the local ambassadors, but disappeared shortly after.

string.original: {playerB,name} is claiming ignorance. Perhaps the locals might know what happened to our friend.
string.variation: {playerB,fem} is claiming ignorance. Perhaps the locals might know what happened to our friend.
{playerB,masc} is claiming ignorance. Perhaps the locals might know what happened to our friend.

string.original: Use upgraded units to make your battles easier.
Collect {total} Coffee Mugs to give as presents.
Defeat the pirates harassing the locals.
Beau LeChomp kidnapped {playerA,name} and is heading to the Raven's island by ship!
string.variation: Beau LeChomp kidnapped {playerA,fem} and is heading to the Raven's island by ship!
Beau LeChomp kidnapped {playerA,masc} and is heading to the Raven's island by ship!

string.original: Beau LeChomp trapped {playerA,name} on his ship heading to the Raven's base on Skull Island!
string.variation: Beau LeChomp trapped {playerA,fem} on his ship heading to the Raven's base on Skull Island!
Beau LeChomp trapped {playerA,masc} on his ship heading to the Raven's base on Skull Island!

string.original: Get Mastery Tokens by defeating campaign villains.
Collect {total} Nitrous Tanks to speed up our fleet.
Speed Up {total} Neighbor Shipyards to get them to help.
Beau LeChomp's ship is in our sights. Let's free {playerA,name} and sink LeChomp!
string.variation: Beau LeChomp's ship is in our sights. Let's free {playerA,fem} and sink LeChomp!
Beau LeChomp's ship is in our sights. Let's free {playerA,masc} and sink LeChomp!

string.original: LeChomp's ship is in our sights. Let's send in a rescue team and sink The Guillotine!
You can build Strike Teams in the Strike Teams HQ.
Collect {total} Smoke Grenades to sneak up on LeChomp.
Build an Ambush Strike Team to protect our flank.
It's a trap! {playerA,name} was just the bait. LeChomp has trapped us instead!
string.variation: It's a trap! {playerA,fem} was just the bait. LeChomp has trapped us instead!
It's a trap! {playerA,masc} was just the bait. LeChomp has trapped us instead!

string.original: {playerA,name} is free, but LeChomp now has our forces captured!
string.variation: {playerA,fem} is free, but LeChomp now has our forces captured!
{playerA,masc} is free, but LeChomp now has our forces captured!

string.original: Get Red Hearts by helping out around your Neighbors' islands.
Collect {total} Carrier Pigeons to get a message to our men.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to keep spirits up.
We're free! Now it's payback time.
Time for payback. Let's send this gator-lover back to his swamp for good.
Use Power-Ups in battle to help defeat strong opponents.
Collect {total} Detonators to light up LeChomp's forces.
Collect {total} Joint Strike Maps to coordinate an attack.
Nice job! That should send him back to the swamp for a while.
Alchemy has returned with a sinister plot. {playerA,name} was passing on more details, but was cut off. What is Alchemy hiding?
string.variation: Alchemy has returned with a sinister plot. {playerA,fem} was passing on more details, but was cut off. What is Alchemy hiding?
Alchemy has returned with a sinister plot. {playerA,masc} was passing on more details, but was cut off. What is Alchemy hiding?

string.original: Put a stop to Alchemy's plans to earn the Defused Element Z Bomb decoration, or the Elite Hypersonic Bomber. Maximum of 10 completions.
You earned an Elite Hypersonic Bomber and 5 EP!
You earned the Defused Element Z Bomb decoration and 5 EP. Display it proudly!
Alchemy has reared its ugly head again with a new plot. Click here to put a stop to their nefarious plans.
Alchemy has reared its ugly head again with a new plot. Click here to put a stop to their nefarious plans.
{playerA,name} was sending us vital information about Alchemy's latest plot, but the transmission was cut off. We need to find {playerA,name} before Alchemy does!
string.variation: {playerA,fem} was sending us vital information about Alchemy's latest plot, but the transmission was cut off. We need to find {playerA,fem} before Alchemy does!
{playerA,fem} was sending us vital information about Alchemy's latest plot, but the transmission was cut off. We need to find {playerA,masc} before Alchemy does!
{playerA,masc} was sending us vital information about Alchemy's latest plot, but the transmission was cut off. We need to find {playerA,fem} before Alchemy does!
{playerA,masc} was sending us vital information about Alchemy's latest plot, but the transmission was cut off. We need to find {playerA,masc} before Alchemy does!

string.original: You have {num} . You need {total}. Go collect more!
You have {num}. You need {total}. Go collect more!
Alchemy desperately wants to keep us from finding {playerA,name} and the intelligence they have. What could be so important?
string.variation: Alchemy desperately wants to keep us from finding {playerA,fem} and the intelligence they have. What could be so important?
Alchemy desperately wants to keep us from finding {playerA,masc} and the intelligence they have. What could be so important?

string.original: Air Delivered Seismic Intrusion Detectors can pick up {playerA,name}'s location when they move.
string.variation: Air Delivered Seismic Intrusion Detectors can pick up {playerA,fem}'s location when they move.
Air Delivered Seismic Intrusion Detectors can pick up {playerA,masc}'s location when they move.

string.original: Collect from {total} neighbor houses to look for {playerA,name}.
string.variation: Collect from {total} neighbor houses to look for {playerA,fem}.
Collect from {total} neighbor houses to look for {playerA,masc}.

string.original: Defeat the Alchemy army trying to find {playerA,name} before we do.
string.variation: Defeat the Alchemy army trying to find {playerA,fem} before we do.
Defeat the Alchemy army trying to find {playerA,masc} before we do.

string.original: {playerA,name} has been rescued, but the news isn't all good. Alchemy has created Dirty Z Bombs and is targeting Port Sylvan and us.
string.variation: {playerA,fem} has been rescued, but the news isn't all good. Alchemy has created Dirty Z Bombs and is targeting Port Sylvan and us.
{playerA,masc} has been rescued, but the news isn't all good. Alchemy has created Dirty Z Bombs and is targeting Port Sylvan and us.

string.original: We can't risk one of those Dirty Z Bombs reaching us. Get our defenses up at once!
Any kind of Battleship can be built, but build ships that will be useful to you.
Collect {total} Search Lights to watch for enemy aircraft.
Build {total} Battleships to patrol the water.
Use {total} Hunker Down II Power-Ups to bolster defenses.
Port Sylvan is asking for help, but there's nothing we can do until we've secured our own borders.
One of our Battleships reports an unlicensed merchant ship off the coast. Go take a look!
Visit the War Room to enter Survival Mode.
Collect {total} Bullpup Guns to board suspect ship.
Build {total} Gunboats to trail the suspect ship.
Survive {total} waves in Survival Mode to get through the ship's defenses.
We've got one of the bombs, though we're getting reports that one just went off in Port Sylvan.
Intelligence reports a Dirty Z Bomb is being smuggled in on a train. We can't get a message to them, so you'll have to stop that train.
Ambush Strike Teams can be built in the Strike Teams HQ building.
Build an Ambush Strike Team to board the train.
Collect {total} Wood to build a barrier to slow down the train.
Win {total} PvP Invasions to prevent counter attacks.
We've stopped the train, however a bomb in Port Sylvan was detonated a few minutes ago.
We were so focused on our own border, Alchemy was able to detonate a Dirty Z Bomb in Port Sylvan. We have to help evacuate the survivors.
Get Red Hearts by helping out your neighbors around their islands.
Collect {total} Emergency Tents to house survivors.
Harvest {total} Wheat to help feed survivors.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to provide relief.
Some of the survivors are talking about an Alchemy fleet seen retreating just after the bomb went off.
With the survivors out of the danger zone, we can focus on tracking down that Alchemy fleet and getting even.
Use Power-Ups and upgraded units to make your battles easier.
Collect {total} Bombing Runs to take out the fleet's escort.
Collect {total} Blood Bags to treat the wounded.
While the loss of Port Sylvan is terrible, at least we were able to make those responsible pay for what they've done. As for Alchemy, I can only guess when we'll be hearing from them again...
The Port Sylvan Port Authority has detected an unscheduled delivery docking later today. Head over there and check it out.
Damage to any Gunboat will help, but Power-Ups and Ally attacks will not.
Collect {total} Radiation Monitoring Labs to search for bombs.
Speed Up {total} neighbor Shipyards to check schedules.
Inflict {total} Damage to Gunboats to take out the ship's escort.
Quick action, Commander! We have the ship on radar and we're closing in.
We have the ship in our sights. Fight your way on board and search for the Dirty Z Bomb.
Ask your friends to send RPGs to help board the ship.
Get {total} RPGs to raid the ship.
Train {total} Soldiers to create a boarding force.
We've found a bomb, Commander. Now we need to deactivate it before Alchemy gets word we've stopped their ship and recovered the bomb.
We've found a bomb aboard the ship. We'll need to disarm it, fast!
{nrare4} can be mined from neighbor Ore Mines, purchased in neighbor Markets or recovered from critical hits.
Collect {total} Bomb Disposal Suits to protect your men.
Collect {total} {nrare4} to bypass the bomb's circuitry.
Collect {total} Mastery Tokens to improve our technique.
Nice work, Commander. The bomb has been deactivated. Now, what to do with it?
We've captured the bomb, but we need to prevent Alchemy from detonating it remotely.
Click on the Battle Blitz button to initiate attacks.
Scramble {total} EA-6B Prowler patrols to jam detonation signals.
Use {total} EMP II Power-Ups to scramble the bomb's circuitry.
Win {total} Rounds in Battle Blitz to destroy signal relays.
The bomb has been defused. Now it's time to deliver this back to Alchemy.
It's time to show these Alchemy fanatics we mean business. Smuggle the bombs back to the perpetrators of this attack.
Ask your friends to send you the items you need to complete quest tasks. Be nice and send them parts, too.
Collect {total} Suitcase Bombs to send back to Alchemy.
Collect {total} Ammo Boxes to arm our Spec Ops soldiers delivering the bombs.
Defeat the Alchemy forces responsible for this attack.
Excellent work, Commander. We've defeated this cell, but what else is Alchemy up to? What is their end game?
One of your allies might be behind the most recent Titan incursion: {playerA,name}. You need to find out if there's a traitor working with you!
string.variation: One of your allies might be behind the most recent Titan incursion: {playerA,fem}. You need to find out if there's a traitor working with you!
One of your allies might be behind the most recent Titan incursion: {playerA,masc}. You need to find out if there's a traitor working with you!

string.original: The Titans can be damaged by power-ups.
You have {num} Coins. You need {total}. Go collect more!
The Titans will keep coming until we find a way to jam their probe!
What?! Now MY island is under attack from these Titans. I think one of your allies may be behind it all!
What?! Now MY island is under attack from these Titans. I think one of your allies may be behind it all!
The Titans are now hitting my island. And we found something interesting...dog tags. Last time I checked, Titans don't wear 'em. Investigate this.
Use Power-Ups to help in battles, especially against the Titans, which are very strong.
Collect {total} Enemy Dog Tags as evidence.
Yup, these definitely are human dog tags. That means someone else hit my island when the Titans did. Coincidence?
We found another piece of evidence: a memory chip from a defeated Titan. See if you can find some from your island, and we can compare them.
It will cost a lot to get the Memory Chips analyzed. Make sure you have enough additional coins to keep you going.
Pay {total} Coins to have Memory Chips analyzed.
Defeat the Titan trying to prevent us from finding Memory Chips.
The memory chips match. With one important difference. There's data that refers to {playerA,name} on ours, not on yours. Interesting.
string.variation: The memory chips match. With one important difference. There's data that refers to {playerA,fem} on ours, not on yours. Interesting.
The memory chips match. With one important difference. There's data that refers to {playerA,masc} on ours, not on yours. Interesting.

string.original: You need to get fingerprints from {playerA,name} from a variety of sources so we can make sure the prints we found are genuine. Get to it.
string.variation: You need to get fingerprints from {playerA,fem} from a variety of sources so we can make sure the prints we found are genuine. Get to it.
You need to get fingerprints from {playerA,masc} from a variety of sources so we can make sure the prints we found are genuine. Get to it.

string.original: Mastery Tokens can be obtained from defeating Campaign Villains.
Defeat the Titan trying to stop us from collecting evidence.
My lab boys tell me that it's a 97% positive match. Things aren't looking good for your ally, Commander.
We have an eye witness. We believe in due process, so we're going to have a line-up. Help find some people to show to the witness.
You can collect coins from your island or your neighbors' islands.
Collect {total} Coins to help protect the witness.
Defeat the Titan trying to find the witness.
{playerA,name} was positively identified. It's not looking good.
string.variation: {playerA,fem} was positively identified. It's not looking good.
{playerA,masc} was positively identified. It's not looking good.

string.original: I know you're busy fighting off your own Titans, but if {playerA,name} is really behind this somehow, we need to do something about it.
string.variation: I know you're busy fighting off your own Titans, but if {playerA,fem} is really behind this somehow, we need to do something about it.
I know you're busy fighting off your own Titans, but if {playerA,masc} is really behind this somehow, we need to do something about it.

string.original: Plant some crops of your own to help your neighbors with their own goals.
Speed Up {total} neighbor crops to search for evidence.
Defeat the Titan trying to slow our investigation.
This Titan part is from a cockpit. It's a recording device, with orders! Apparently, {playerA,name} was being set up! They want us fighting each other. Inconceivable!
string.variation: This Titan part is from a cockpit. It's a recording device, with orders! Apparently, {playerA,fem} was being set up! They want us fighting each other. Inconceivable!
This Titan part is from a cockpit. It's a recording device, with orders! Apparently, {playerA,masc} was being set up! They want us fighting each other. Inconceivable!

string.original: A Drink with Jam and Bread
Those parts you collected are going to be useful to develop a prototype jamming device. If we jam the Titan homing signal, they won't be able to call reinforcements.
Engineers just love Red Onions. Especially on pizza.
Harvest {total} Red Onions to feed our engineers.
Defeat the Titan trying to stop our progress.
Sweet Jeepers McCriminy! The prototype jammer seems to work! The signal is much too low, so we'll have to boost it before we can use it. Get to work.
There IS a spy on your base...someone disguised as {playerA,name}! They're using a personal HeliVac to escape, but there are decoys everywhere! Round them all up!
string.variation: There IS a spy on your base...someone disguised as {playerA,fem}! They're using a personal HeliVac to escape, but there are decoys everywhere! Round them all up!
There IS a spy on your base...someone disguised as {playerA,masc}! They're using a personal HeliVac to escape, but there are decoys everywhere! Round them all up!

string.original: Any kind of Airship will help to knock down the spy.
Defeat the Titan trying to help the spy escape.
We identified the spy. So far we haven't been able to extract any information. Disguises, decoys, pitting us against each other...someone doesn't like one of us, that's for sure.
Our scientists are sending the latest specifications on a Parabolic Jammer. That'll stop the Titan homing beacon, and we can rest easy for a while.
You can search old Campaign battles to find Air vs. Ground encounters to help out.
Use Airships to destroy {total} Ground Units.
Defeat the Titan trying to stop our Jammers.
It worked! The invasion is over. I guess I owe {playerA,name} an apology. You too, Commander. You're a good ally. I'm always ready to stand by your side.
string.variation: It worked! The invasion is over. I guess I owe {playerA,fem} an apology. You too, Commander. You're a good ally. I'm always ready to stand by your side.
It worked! The invasion is over. I guess I owe {playerA,masc} an apology. You too, Commander. You're a good ally. I'm always ready to stand by your side.

string.original: Ezikiel Grunt is set on destroying our island with a huge missile. We can't blow it up, or the radiation will kill us all. We've got to disarm it, and fast!
Deactivate the missiles on the remote-controlled sub and earn a Narwhal or up to {num} nukes!
You can progress down both branches simultaneously. Earn an ultra-powerful sub or a Nuke Mystery Crate - you have the greatest chance of winning {num} Nukes.
Stop the remote-controlled missile-launching sub and earn a Narwhal or up to {num} nukes! And now, you can progress down both branches simultaneously!
You safely disarmed the missiles! Well done!
The missile threat has been neutralized! Well done!
Stop the missile before it launches and takes out our island!
Stop the missile before it launches and takes out our island!
Ezekiel Grunt has sent a remote-controlled missile launch platform, which surfaced near our island. We can't blow it up or the island will be contaminated. We'll have to disarm it.
You have {num} . You need {total}. Go collect more!
Remove the access hatch to be able to reach the part of the missile that goes BOOM.
Any enemy Naval unit will help us out.
Collect {total} Electric Screwdrivers to open the hatch.
Use Accuracy II Power-Up to steady your hand.
Good job. You removed those screws like a pro.
Now, all you have to do is cut the red wire.
You can pillage your neighbors after you have invaded their islands.
Collect {total} Wirecutters to cut the wire.
Good. This is easy, isn't it?
Now...cut the blue wire. Or was it green?
Purchase your expansion, or get friends to help you out.
Green, blue, whatever. You had a 50-50 chance.
Cut the blue wire. I think it's blue. Maybe it's green. No, almost certainly blue.
Use Power-Ups and Allies when fighting tough enemies.
Defeat the enemy trying to prevent us from disarming the bomb.
Blue, green, whatever. You had a 50-50 chance.
At this point, I feel obligated to tell you that I'm color blind. Anyway, cut the yellow wire.
Collect Black Hearts from invading allies.
Nothing phases you, does it? One more wire to go.
Cut the black wire. Just...be careful. On the bright side, if you mess this up, you'll never know.
Help your friends out on their islands and you may just get some energy for being nice.
Deal {total} Damage to enemy Air Force units.
BAM! Just kidding. Nice job taking out that missile. Steady hands you've got there.
First, you'll have to sabotage the propulsion system. Get some four-leaf clovers for luck.
Police barriers will help keep bystanders at a safe distance.
Harvest {total} Wood to build police barriers.
Okay. You did it. Don't get cocky. We're not out of the woods yet.
We need to deactivate the guidance system next. We need something big to whack it with. How about a giant monkey wrench?
Purchase your expansion, or get friends to help you out.
Great! And you did it all without the help of a giant monkey to swing the wrench!
De-stabilize the warhead. You'll need to be careful on this one. Steady your nerves with a lot of coffee.
Go to your neighbors' islands and look for Oil Rigs that haven't completed yet and give them a boost.
Defeat the enemy units attacking our bomb disposal squad.
I respect your ability to stay calm. Really, you should be freaking out. I am.
Remove the detonator by grabbing it with magnets. It can still blow up, but it's a step in the right direction.
Get Red Hearts by helping out around your neighbors' islands.
Collect {total} Magnets to help disarm the bomb.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to reassure our people.
Deal {total} Damage to enemy Army units.
You are a brave one, Commander. I would've thought someone else would have handled this bomb disposal for you.
Last step. Jam the remote-launch system. We need something to pour on the circuits. How about liquid cheese? It's viscous AND tasty!
Repel invasions on your own island or on your neighbors' islands.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers to make nachos after.
Repel {total} invasions to keep the bomb stable.
Do you want to get in on a plan to steal money from the Dark Alliance?
I may be the enemy, but any opportunity to hinder the Dark Alliance must be worth taking...
You've earned your reward! You can repeat these missions to earn more rewards!
Click on the Gold Tank to investigate!
I know where the Raven is storing the Dark Alliance funds. That money is mine! I can't go after it myself, but help me get it back and I'll cut you in!
Before we go any further, I need to know I can trust you.
Ask your friends to send you what you need.
Gather {total} Lawyers to draw up a contract
Harvest {total} Cabbage Crops to feed the Lawyers
I hope you picked those Lawyers carefully! You never know when they'll turn on you.
Nobody will believe that you could do a job like this on your own. You need to change your spotless reputation!
Use Power-Ups to help you win battles.
Gather {total} Search Warrants for your empire
Let's take on the Raven's most powerful units!
Impressive! Have you ever considered joining the Dark Alliance?
I've had my boys whip up an exact replica of the bank for you to practice your heist in.
Not bad. We might just pull this off after all!
You've made it this far. It's time for you to get your maps out and find this bank.
Earn Black Hearts by invading your friends.
Gather {total} Informants to help with the search
Survive up to wave {total} in Survival Mode
Excellent! I knew you'd put the pieces together.
Von Helman is on to me! You need to get rid of him!
Use Air Strikes against Army Units.
Gather Guerilla Fighters to help you move stealthily
Use {total} Air Strike I power-ups in battle
Good job! He'll think twice about sticking his pimpled nose in my business.
THIS IS IT! Get in there and get my... I mean our money!
Any kind of land unit can be built, but build units that will be useful to you.
I DID IT! I GOT THE MONEY!
Hah! You didn't think I'd part with my inheritance that easily, did you?
Build more farms to harvest more crops.
Double crossing the double crosser, are you? I'm on to you!
Argh, I can't get rid of you! Well, you're not getting the gold without a fight!
Use Power Ups against stronger units.
Survive up to wave {total} in Survival Mode
You may have won this battle, but this isn't the last you'll hear of me. Enjoy your petty cash!
Tread carefully around this one. The Eel is known to be ruthless and we want Steele back alive!
We don't stand a chance against the Dark Alliance without Steele. No pressure.
Steele's been kidnapped by the Eel! Don't let him slip through your fingers.
Commander, we have a problem - the Eel is back! He has captured Steele and is holding him for ransom. We have to find him.
We should up our security. The Eel managed to get to Steele's Empire. He could just as easily get into ours.
Any kind of land unit can be built, but build units that will be useful to you.
Build {total} Land Units on your Empire.
The Eel will have a hard time invading us. Now, let's concentrate our efforts on finding Steele!
The Eel has contacted us with his terms. Let's set up a meeting to negotiate the terms of the exchange.
Earn Black Hearts by invading neighbours.
The Eel might think we're ready to play his game, but we've got our own rules. Game on!
The Eel thinks we're about to drop off Steele's ransom. I say we leave him something a little more explosive.
Battle stronger units for higher damage.
Well, that didn't quite go off as we planned. Commander? Commander??
The Eel isn't about to let Steele go easily. Tear gas might create the diversion you need to get to Steele.
Power-Ups and Experimental Units will help you survive longer.
Survive {total} waves in Survival Mode to hone your skills.
Phew, I almost thought you were captured in the melee. Commander? Commander, do you copy?
We don't have much time, this signal is weak. If you can send us your location, we'll get you out.
Ask your friends to send you what you need.
Collect {total} Satellite Images of the Eel's lair.
It's good to have you back, Commander, but we have a problem. The Eel has invaded again!
While you were his prisoner, the Eel invaded Steele's Empire. We must deploy forces to expel him.
Battle stronger units for higher damage.
Collect {total} people for an Evacuation Team.
You did well, Commander. Steele is safe and not likely to forget the debt he owes you.
My sources tell me the Eel is holding Steele on an island. Let's initiate search patrols via the sea.
Pick the Navy theatre in combat.
That was easier than I thought it would be. Don't get complacent though, Steele's still in danger.
We can't risk moving too fast. I suggest you set up surveillance around the Eel's lair and lay low for a bit.
Build more farms to harvest faster.
Harvest {total} Red Onions to draw attention away from you.
Hone your skills in combat to prepare to face the Eel.
Excellent! Now that we know our way around the Eel's lair, we can rescue Steele!
Our surveillance reports show that the Eel has his minions guarding Steele's cell. Take 'em out, Commander!
Gather {total} Energy Drinks to keep your strength up.
Deal {total} damage in combat to scare Eel's minions.
Those minions never stood a chance. However, the Eel is on to us and he won't be so easy.
The Eel has minions guarding Steele's cell. If we can get them to turn against him, Steele will be ours!
Choose the location of your invasion based on the resources you need.
Gather {total} Incriminating Photos of the Eel.
Collect rent from neighbors' houses {total} times.
You've exposed the skeletons in the Eel's closet. He's not going to be happy...
The Eel's a formidable foe, but he's likely to slip through your fingers if you're not careful. He must be stopped.
Ask your friends to send you what you need.
You did well, Commander. Steele is safe and not likely to forget the debt he owes you.
Be sure we're not the only ones after this Titan. Stay alert; we could be attacked at any time.
If the Titan ends up in the hands of the Dark Alliance, we're all goners.
There's a rogue Titan on the loose, retrieve it before anyone else does!
Commander, we have a problem on our hands, a Titan-sized problem. The Titan on the loose is up for grabs. Anyone could take it, even the Dark Alliance. We need to move.
You earned one SpecOps Griffin Tank!
It is too silent. Something's wrong. Keep watch and defend yourself.
The Titans are looking for their fallen comrade. You are in their way.
Collect {total} Electro-Magnetic Sensors to detect incoming attacks.
Place {total} Navy Units to protect your empire.
Battle the Titan. Told you they'd come for us.
Our defenses are sufficient. We're practically impenetrable.
We can't sit around any longer, let's head out and investigate any areas of suspicious activity. We're bound to find something.
Your neighbors might not forgive you but hey, you're saving the world, not making friends.
Collect {total} Z-Tectors to detect unusual amounts of Element Z radiation.
Pillage your neighbors {total} times to get information out of them.
Battle the Titan, he's looking for his Titan brother.
Well done, you're not Captain Popular, but you're tough and the empires need you. Keep going.
We need intel from an ally. I know just the person but their identity can never be revealed. Expect some mail soon.
Whatever you do, protect your source, you'll need them later.
Battle the Titan. It's like an all you can eat Titan buffet out here.
Alright, we've got a location. Prepare to attack!
I can almost taste victory. We're almost there, Commander. After this attack we'll have seized custody of the rogue Titan.
Your Special Reaction teams are experts under pressure, they're crucial.
Battle the Titan, wow they're persistent little robots aren't they?
Wow, talk about anti-climaxes. Looks like we got false intel - there was nothing to attack. Alright boys, pack up, we need a new plan.
Shoulda known the dirty rat would be involved. Dirk Mollman tampered with our intel. It's time to retaliate.
You can deal with Dirk later. This Titan however, might not appreciate being left unattended.
Collect {total} High Intensity Blow Torches to damage Dirk's precious drill.
Place {total} military units to take on Dirk Mollman.
Battle the Titan. Trust Dirk to run at the first sight of a Titan.
Dirk has led us straight to Von Helman. He has the damaged Titan and he's working on restoring it. This is not good news.
Von Helman has our ally and he wants me and all my expertise in exchange. Well he's not getting anything. Let's get our ally back.
If Von Helman gets Sea Bolt, he'll restore that Titan and use it against everyone.
Harvest {total} wheat crops to feed your sailors.
Well done, Commander. Looks like Von Helman's little bargain offer didn't work. Let's take him down now.
We're going to try and take down Von Helman, if for nothing else other than the fact that he's extremely annoying. But we're still facing threats from Titan attacks. Stay alert!
Von Helman needs to be taken down but a looming Titan attack is our priority.
Place {total} Submarines. We'll need to go in quietly.
Use {total} Air strike II Power-ups to prepare for any Titan attack.
Battle the Titan. They're getting predictable, these Titans.
Von Helman better watch his back, we'll get him sooner or later. But now his Titan is left unattended and you are its first target.
It's too late to run. Helman's unattended Titan has spotted you. It doesn't look pleased. What's your next move?
Hell hath no fury like a Titan scorned.
Harvest {total} Oil to keep those units running.
Place {total} Navy Units to take on the Titan.
Fight that Titan and try not to lose.
Phew! Honestly, Commander, I didn't think you'd make it out of that one alive. You deserve a medal. A whole bunch of medals.
A group of political activists have moved into an abandoned coastal fortress and now declare themselves a sovereign nation. Let's hear them out.
You can progress down both paths at once. If you take the bottom path, you can win 3 or 5 Nuke Is, 3 Nuke IIs, or 3 Nuke IIIs.
You can progress down both paths simultaneously. If you take the bottom path, you can win either 3 or 5 Nuke Is, 3 Nuke IIs, or 3 Nuke IIIs as part of a Mystery Crate.
A separatist group has emerged in your empire. Find out more about them.
A group of separatists are demanding a sovereign state of their own. Are they really only just activists, however? We need to investigate.
You have {num} Wood. You need {total}. Go collect more!.
You have {num} Oil. You need {total}. Go collect more!
The first step is to visit the activists in their own territory. Let's put on some Khaki and head to the camps.
You need to be able to step in if things get heated. Place Land Units you think will help.
Harvest {total} Pineapples to feed the activists.
Place {total} Land Units to prepare for civil unrest.
We're dressed in our Khaki finery and ready to make our first appearance in the camps.
The activists are organizing a music festival for the awareness of their cause. Let's show our support.
These 'music festivals' can get pretty wild. Be prepared to intervene at any time.
Collect {total} Camping Tents for the upcoming music festival for awareness.
Gather {total} Oil to ensure the show runs smoothly.
Deal {total} damage to Navy Units to defend your activists.
Well, that was actually a lot of fun... I think. I don't remember much, honestly.
Our favorite activists have some more demands. It's been over a week since most of them have showered. I think some soap is in order.
Phew, a week of no showering really does have an impact on the environment.
Collect {total} Bars of Soap to help the activists clean up.
Pillage {total} Neighbors to win the trust of your activists.
Speed up {total} Neighbors' farms to gather resources.
Now that they're clean, let's see what else we can help them with. Hopefully, soon we might actually get down to some real business.
It seems the activists want to focus on grooming themselves before we get to the serious business. They are insisting on haircuts.
An invasion during this crucial time is dangerous. Repel invasions using strike teams or battles.
Station {total} On-Site Barbers to tackle some pressing grooming issues.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to prove your good will to the activists.
Repel {total} invasions to protect your empire.
Now that we've got everyone cleaned up and groomed to perfection, what say we begin talks?
Well, that went surprisingly well. We now have a micro-nation ally in a neighbor. This will be good for our defenses. Congratulations, Commander.
An offering on their first day of being an independent nation will be much appreciated.
Collect {total} Miniature Flags for the Independence Day celebration.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers to prepare for the celebrations!
Gather {total} {nrare1} to present to the new nation.
Once again, congratulations, Commander. This is a day to remember. We also have to remember that our new nation is very vulnerable. We should keep an eye out for possible attacks.
Now that the celebrations have come to an end, we're facing serious threat of attack or invasion. We need to station more coast guards to keep an eye out.
This is your first challenge as an ally to a new nation. Do not fail them.
Gather {total} coast guard radios to help keep an eye out.
Deal {total} damage using Air Units to send a clear message.
Use {total} Field Repair II to better your defenses.
Commander, you've done your new allies proud. This looks like the beginning of a long and peaceful relationship.
Commander, we've got some activists pushing for a separate state. We think they might be a division of a larger terrorist group. We'll need to search them.
Tread carefully around these 'activists', they might be dangerous.
Collect {total} Federal Licenses; we need to conduct searches legally.
Place {total} Air Units to prepare for battle.
Collect rent from {total} dwellings to pay for back up supplies.
You handled that well, Commander. I don't think they suspect we're onto them. There's something definitely fishy about them. Let's dig deeper.

The public is not pleased with our hostile treatment of the terrorists. They still believe they are innocent activists. Don't worry, this is nothing a good PR Agent and some moving propaganda can't take care of.
All publicity is good publicity, they say. We'll just have to wait and see if that's true.
Hire {total} PR specialists to help the government turn this bad public sentiment around.
Build {total} Field Repairs II to prepare for possible unrest.
Place {total} land units just in case things go wrong.
I think our public is turning around, but I imagine our Terrorists are getting antsy. We need to figure out their next move and get two steps ahead of them.
We've got some solid intel that suggests we're under serious threat of being attacked by our 'activists'. We're bringing down that fortress first thing in the morning.
Losing this battle could mean colonization of your empire by the terrorist organization.
Acquire {total} military grade catapults to bring down that fortress.
Win {total} fights in Battle Blitz to strengthen your offense.
Phew, that was close. We've weakened them but we're not rid of them yet. Let's see if they retreat.
The public needs to be warned. Our neighboring empires should also withdraw any sort of support that reaches this organization. What better way to communicate with the masses than the media.
Stay alert, your terrorists will make a move any second now.
Commission {total} Propaganda Posters to warn the masses.
Speed up {total} neighbors' shipyards to make sure they're on your side.
Destroy {total} submarines to send a message to the terrorists.
They've been warned. If they so much as move a muscle, we will have the authority to launch a full scale attack, the likes of which they've never seen.
Okay, we've got the heads up to go ahead and attack. Let's make this one for the history books, shall we?
Mastery Tokens are good for your rep too.
Ask for {total} Disciplinary Rulers to teach them a lesson.
Earn {total} Mastery Tokens to gain military strength.
Well, that's that then. Just one more invasion averted. On to the next order of business.
This is a Phenomenon! A Titan unlike any other one we've seen before. We need to find out what it is!
Watch out, if this bot is as important as we think, the Titans will be after us!
You have {num} Coins. You need {total}. Go collect more!
A Titan Minibot could be the key to understanding Titan mechanics; this is the opportunity of a lifetime!
I'm not sure where this Minibot came from but it looks like a delivery from the skies. I think we can salvage it so let's get to work and figure this thing out.
The first thing we need to do is very carefully transport it into one of our top secret research labs. No one and I mean no one can find out about our Minibot.
The Minibot could be alien technology. Protect it with your life!
Get {total} State-of-the-Art Excavators to extract the Minibot from its burning crater.
Build {total} Ambush Strike Teams to fight invasions.
Battle the Titan to protect the Minibot.
Despite that Titan attack, it looks like we're all set to begin our research. Now, we just need some researchers.
Commander, we have a problem. The Titans are coming back again. We've got to pack this operation up, take the Minibot and run!
Your discretion is of the utmost importance. Keep your head down and fight hard.
Collect {total} radiation-proof containers to transport the Minibot safely.
Survive up to {total} waves in Suvival Mode without exposing the Minibot.
Phew! Crisis averted. Or so we thought, something's wrong with the bot though, fix it quick!
Something happened to the Minibot during transportation. It's malfunctioning and I think we're losing it. We can't lose it! Not now, we're so close!
The Titans are getting desperate; we cannot lose the bot now!
Hire {total} ET Conspiracy Theorists to figure this Minibot out!
Gain {total} level in World Dominance to keep the Dark Alliance at bay.
I must say Commander I don't know how much longer we can keep these Titans at bay. But there's definitely no stopping now.
Now that we've finally settled down, we can begin our research. Leave it to me to hire the best research personnel in the industry.
When it comes to the greater cause, pillage you must and pillage you will.
Get {total} Z-proof Lab Coats to begin research on the Minibot.
Pillage {total} times to get resources they won't give to you.
Battle the Titan. They just don't give up, do they?
We're making good progress. It's slow, but it's progress. This Minibot is truly a phenomenon. Let's call it a day and begin bright and early tomorrow.
I have to admit Commander, I didn't see this one. All our research personnel have fled the premises with the Minibot. You really can't trust anyone these days.
Next time, remember to insert trackers on everyone you hire.
Collect {total} Sniffer Dogs to find the Minibot.
Speed up {total} neighbors' farms to search for the runaways.
These guys are good at their job but they really don't know anything about hiding. That's good for us, we have our bot. Now let's figure out how to deal with our personnel.
Our top priority right now is making sure our criminal researchers never leak information about the Minibot. We need to keep them isolated for as long as is necessary.
Win in World Dominance and grow in battle.
Win {total} World Domination fights to build your offense.
I can't say I'm pleased with our situation but for the time being, it's under control. I have a feeling the Board of Titan Research is going to step in any minute now.
The Board of Titan Research sees us unfit to carry on our operation. They want to seize the Minibot.
Hidden Mystery Units can be acquired by expanding your Empire.
Hire {total} Titan Custody Lawyers. It's our last chance.
Acquire {total} Hidden Mystery Units to back you up.
Battle the Titan. They seem relentless, whether or not we have the bot.
That went exactly as I thought it would. We lost the bot. That's okay, we'll just lay low and figure out a plan. Till then, I think I've gathered enough information to keep me occupied for a while.
I've received intel that the Titans know where we are and they're coming to get their bot back. I doubt they'd believe us if we told them we don't have it.
It looks like the Titans really want this bot back. Whatever that bot is, we need to find it again.
Get {total} Z-radiation suits to protect you during the attack.
Deal {total} damage to sea units. Kill all preemptive attacks.
Those Titans are connected to the bot in some way. We should keep an eye on them and see where it leads them.
Alchemy has somehow acquired the means to produce frighteningly uncanny counterfeit currency which could permanently damage our economy. We can't deal with this aggressively. We've got to be smarter.
You can progress down both paths simultaneously. Both paths will reward you with extremely powerful units.
Alchemy, an extremely dangerous terrorist organization is in the midst of creating millions worth of counterfeit currency. We have to stop them.
It seems Alchemy has grown tired of their inactivity and are planning to destroy our economy with counterfeit currency. They've threatened to retaliate if pursued, so we've got to be careful.

Since we can't take them head on, we'll need to obtain more information. What we need is an inside guy. Someone to keep the intel coming because let's face it, we know pretty much nothing at this point.
Pick the perfect guy. Alchemy is experienced enough to notice an imposter.
Ask for {total} Board Game Money Bills. We can play with fake money too.
Harvest {total} Oil to keep the show running.
Earn {total} Red Hearts to maintain your credibility.
Step one, complete. Our inside guy is stationed and his first message has just been decoded. Our initial intel was indeed correct and we're on the right track.

Our guy has informed us that Alchemy is operating out of an abandoned warehouse in a location that is being withheld from him. We need to bug the entire place to get a better read on their whereabouts.
The tinier the bugs, the better. They need to be invisible but effective.
Collect {total} Microphone Bugs to get a constant audio stream of intel.
Fight {total} World Domination Fights to get some information out of the DA.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers to put some fire in this tantrum.
Step two has been executed perfectly. Our bugs our functioning well. Our audio isn't telling us much for now but stay tuned, something is bound to come up.
Commander! We've got a lockdown on their location, I say we take them by surprise and do a full-fledged raid.
Eliminate the terrorists but get our inside guy out safely.
Collect {total} Bulletproof Shields to defend our ground troops during the raid.
Earn {total} Black Hearts to execute a flawless raid.
Well, that wasn't Alchemy. I think that was just a traditional scuff over trespassing. It looks like Alchemy has packed up and left and we've got not read on our audio bugs. We've been found out.
There's a big pile of what could be counterfeited coins lying in the center of the warehouse... I think they're trying to send us a message.
There's something sinister about that gold, maybe we shouldn't go near it. But it's just so... shiny.
Collect {total} Stretchers to take our injured home.
Speed Up {total} Neighbors' Barracks to get aid from them.
Deal Damage to {total} Air Units to protect your ground level camp site.
Commander! Are you alright? I knew we shouldn't have gone anywhere near that pile of gold but I didn't expect it to explode so furiously. Any closer and you would not have survived that.
Zero to Serious in No Time
They've really done it now. We've trying playing by their rules but now we need to do things the old fashion way, with pure, unadulterated military might and strategy.
The more unheard of the tech, the better.
Collect {total} Obscure Military Tech to track down Alchemy.
Repel {total} Invasions from Neighbors to keep your operation safe.
Add {total} more space to your Army Depot for new units and tech.
If this approach doesn't work, then I'm afraid we've run out of options. Worry not, Commander, I have full faith in our military capability. We'll track them down and stop them.
This time, I'm sure of the location. And they have no idea we're coming. Ready when you are, Commander. Let's bring these guys down.
Give them something to remember, Commander.
Get {total} totally secure Police Vans to keep our terrorists from getting out.
Pillage your neighbors {total} times to gather supplies for the mission.
Deploy {total} grunt soldiers to prepare for battle.
Bravo, Commander. That was quite a show, if I may say so themselves. We've saved our economy and our nation from the menace of Alchemy. At least until another organization pops up, let's celebrate!
We've got coordinates. They're on a private island south of us. Let's go in and take them out. Our intel suggests they have no idea we're onto them.
Air raids are best for surprise attacks.
Win {total} battles in Battle Blitz to gain strength.
Well, that was easy! Almost... too easy. We've got them in our custody ready for questioning. I have a feeling this is only the beginning.
Let us begin the interrogation process. We need to find out everything, why, what, how, when, where etc.
Remember, there are ways to get around a lie detector test so watch them carefully.
Hire {total} Lie Detectors to help with the interrogation.
Build {total} Accuracy I Power-ups from the Power-Up Factory.
I should have known their capture was too easy. These people aren't part of Alchemy - they're just decoys. Alchemy is still out there and they're so much ahead of us. We must find them.
Our worst fears are confirmed, someone has just reported a fake bill in the city. We need to get our analysts on this ASAP and trace the origin of the bill.
Keep an eye and ear out for more fake bills. This could be the beginning of the end for our economy.
Hire {total} Forensic Analysts to trace the origin of the fake bill.
Place {total} Carriers to set out on command.
Win {total} World Dominance Fights using Land Fleets to extract intel from the DA.
Alchemy was right here this whole time, right under our noses! Turns out the decoys were just a ruse to allow them to enter our nation while our defenses were low!
Commander, I know we rarely go this far but this time, it's necessary. We're going to have to torture information about Alchemy out of our decoy terrorist.
Let's just say the Red Onion has many uses. This one is particularly nasty.
Collect {total} Modern Torture Devices to use on the decoys.
Deal {total} damage to Sea Units to prevent any more attacks.
Harvest {total} Red Onion - a secret recipe in modern torture.
That was long and painful but they've caved. We have a location and we're not going to have to go very far. Alchemy has been right here this whole time.
Suit up, Commander, we're going in. This could get ugly but we promise to make it worth your while.
Make sure you put on your masks. You don't want to feel the effects of those gas grenades.
Ask for {total} Knock Out Gas Grenades to help with the ambush.
Earn {total} Mastery Tokens in order to strengthen your ambush strategy.
We've got the real Alchemy in our custody, let's show them a 'good' time, shall we Commander? Also, we should destroy that huge stash of counterfeit bills once and for all.
Titans normally only attack areas of significance. Dr. G Owari isn't even aware of the existence of Titans. We need to get to the bottom of this.
We'll need to deal with this gently. Owari might be a little offended that no one's told her about Titans yet.
This is strange, even for a Titan. Why would they go after Owari? We've got a mystery on our hands.
Commander, some kind of alien object has attacked my lab and reduced it to a crumbling pile of debris. You owe me an explanation!
First of all, I want my lab back. Then, I expect to be given a complete lowdown on all this Titan business. How could no one have told me?
Be smart about your land units. Choose units that are most effective against Titans.
Hire {total} Architects to build Dr. Owari a state-of-the-art research lab.
Place {total} Land units to prepare for more Titan attacks.
Here comes another Titan. Battle it.
My beautiful new lab has survived that Titan attack, looks like it really is Titan proof. Now let's get back to work. We need to identify the Titan attacking us.

What do you mean I am not a part of this investigation? My lab was destroyed and I'm going to find out why if it's the last thing I do. I can give you a device that will help, but only if you include me.
Make sure Owari is unharmed. This device she's building could be your only chance.
Collect {total} Kevlar Lab Coats to stay safe while building the tracking device.
Pillage {total} times to gather essential supplies.
Fight the Titan to keep Owari safe while she works.
That was a piece of cake - I have the device. Let's take it out for a ride, shall we?
I'm sorry Commander, I don't know what went wrong. The Scanner specifically shows Titan activity east of where we are but we're being attacked from the west. Give me some time, I'm going to fix this.
Collect {total} Babel Phish to decode Titan signals.
Build {total} Accuracy II Power-Ups to help defeat the attacking Titans.
Wow, I gotta say Commander, I'm good. Dr. Seabolt, you can take a look at my work if you like, you might find it helpful in some way.
Commander, the device shows some Titan activity moving very quickly... towards Steele's empire. You need to get out there and intercept that attack.
Let's hope the tension between Seabolt and Owari doesn't escalate while you're away.
Get {total} Hologram images of the Titans to get a clear idea of what you're dealing with.
Place {total} Sea Units to intercept the Titan attack on Steele's Empire.
Well done, Commander. Now, come back. If I have to spend one more day alone with Seabolt I might just lose my brilliant mind. You need to tell him he's not the only Titan expert around.
Commander, I have a hunch about something but I can't tell you anything more until I analyze the Titan parts you brought back from Steele's empire. I need some time alone. That means no Seabolt.
Seabolt is sulking like a puppy, not being allowed to work with Owari. Maybe an intervention is in order.
Collect {total} Lead-Lined Canisters to transport hazardous materials.
Harvest {total} wood to help rebuild damaged areas while Owari works.
Okay, my time in the lab tells me that the Titan that attacked Steele and the one that attacked my lab are the same. So what does that mean about the Titans attacking from the West?

Commander, you won't believe it. I can't believe it. There are two sects of Titans and they are at war! They didn't attack me on purpose. I was just caught in the crossfire. This war could obliterate the planet. We must stop this.
Warring Titans, who'd have thought? Use your best units to destroy them.
Collect {total} Spectrum Analyzers to find those hidden Titan frequencies.
Place {total} Fighters to monitor the Titans from overhead.
Battle the Titan, it doesn't matter which side this Titan is on. They're both dangerous.
Okay, now that we know what we're dealing with, let's figure out a way to stop them. Seabolt, I could use your help on this one if you're willing. What say?
I've got it! I mean... er, we've got it, Seabolt and I. If we want to destroy the whole faction of Titans, we need to target the communication hub, the mother ship, so to speak.
If this works, we know exactly how to destroy the other Titan faction. Fingers crossed.
Install {total} Transmission Shields to block all your transmissions from the Titans.
Collect {total} {rare} to help build powerful units.
Battle the Titan and make it count. We don't have much longer, the war is heating up.
It worked! It worked! I am such a genius. Okay, you too Seabolt. Those Titans are helpless without their Mother Ship. Look at them run. Now let's get the other side too.
This mission should be a breeze, but with Titans, there's always a hiccup. So stay alert, hit the right Titan and we can all go home in one piece.
Owari's a feisty one. Seabolt's having a hard time sharing the spotlight. Luckily, his lady scientist crush is making this all easier for him.
Get {total} 'I'm Awesome' Badges for Owari to rub it in Seabolt's face with full effect.
Harvest {total} red onions to give Seabolt an excuse for his jealous tears.
Battle the Titan. For the last time.

We have ended a war and restored peace among the Titans, for now. That is probably the strangest thing I have ever said in my life. Now that we're through, Titans are a little too easy for me. I'm bored. Was good working with you, Seabolt.

Nastos is one of the most hostile places in the world. Their government is corrupt through and through, everybody owns a weapon and safety is a luxury no one can afford. We need a well thought through plan.
You can progress down both paths at once. The bottom path will earn you the SpecOps Condor Bomber and the top path, the SpecOps Vulture Copter.
An influx of refugees has brought the world's attention to an oppressed nation, ridden with war. A nation called Nastos.

Commander, refugees from our neighbor nation, Nastos, are flooding in by the thousands. Our coasts are covered in refugee camps. Nastos is sinking deeper into a violent civil war every day. All these people have fled from the violence and instability.
