Commander, these people are in serious need of medical attention, food and water. Let's get a team out there to deal with that while we figure out how to approach this situation.
The refugees will give you an insight into the real situation in Nastos.
Ask for {total} Glucose IV Bags for the extremely malnourished.
Win {total} Fights in Battle Blitz to prepare for future unrest.
Collect {total} {rare} to manufacture supplies for the refugees.
For now, we've got enough food, water, power and medical care, but I'm not sure how much longer we can sustain it, but it's a start and a good one too.

With refugee numbers growing constantly, we can't sustain our resources for much longer. It's time to ask for help, we know that our neighbor nations are also facing the same problem as us. Maybe we can work something out.
We need to tighten security along our coasts, the rebels are everywhere.
Ask for {total} units of Medical Supplies to care for the refugees.
Place {total} Sea Units to defend your nation.
Speed up {total} neighbors' farms to gather more supplies.
It seems some of the rebels have fled Nastos as well and are stirring trouble in the camps. We need to increase security at our check posts and get more aggressive. It's time to go to Nastos.
Okay Commander, round up your best team, we're going straight into the Heart of Hostility. I guarantee we'll make it out alive but I'm not sure what will happen after this.
The fewer the casualties, the better your conversation with the government of Nastos.
Hire {total} Armed Body Guards, your best agents. These guys will take a bullet for you.
Repel {total} Invasions to keep your people and the refugees safe while you're away.

What can I say, I'm just glad we're alive. We've gotten far more than I expected. The Government of Nastos is actually considering cooperation, even though it must have something to do with trade sanctions.
I suggest we invite the leader of Nastos for a brief visit to discuss his state of affairs and what we could do to improve them. Let's keep it public, polite and most of all, safe.
A gift to Nastos. The press will have a field day with that. Worry not, it had to be done.
Organize {total} Press Passes for the invited media representatives.
Survive {total} Waves in Survival Mode. If you thought battles were bad, wait till you meet the press.
Harvest {total} Oil to gift to Nastos in exchange for their cooperation.
All the arrangements have been made, Commander. Now we just have to wait for the Nastosian delegates to arrive. Remember, be nice.

Commander, we have underestimated our security requirement. The refugees are furious that we're welcoming the government they have been treated so unfairly by and they're attacking relentlessly; we need to contain this situation.
If you can deal with the Dark Alliance, the refugees will be no trouble at all.
Organize {total} Bullet Proof Vehicles to keep the delegates safe.
Collect {total} Coins to pay for more security.
Okay. We've made progress. Now that we've got a cooperating Nastos, let's make a difference in the world.

We've made ourselves very clear through this detailed treaty. All Nastos has to do is sign on the dotted line. And if they don't want to, well... tough. We're not bullies, but we know how to get what we want.
The Global Alliance will ensure that this treaty is followed stringently.
Gather {total} members of the Global Alliance to be witnesses to the signing.
Pillage your neighbors {total} times to gather supplies for the celebrations.
Deploy {total} tanks to prepare for rebel attacks.
There, all done. Now Nastos can rebuild itself and become home to all the displaced refugees again.
Commander, I say we've got no choice but to go in. Let's take our best teams past their defenses with as small a number of casualties as we can manage.
Hire {total} Sharp Shooters to hit the spot.
Deal {total} damage to Land Units to get past Nastos' defenses.
Revive {total} crops from your neighbors' farms to earn some support.
So far, so good. Let's lay low and head to the prisoner camps before dawn. If you think you've seen it all, wait till you see these camps. It's the depths of hell on earth.
Our next move is to infiltrate the prison camps and rescue as many people as we can. Remember, if someone is too far gone, leave them and move on. This is war. Stay down and move fast.
These prison camps are cruel, sad places. Get in and get out without getting hurt.
Collect {total} units of Night Camouflage to help keep you off the radar.
Repel {total} invasions on your island to protect your people and the refugees.
Harvest {total} Oil to use on your mission.
I commend your resolve, Commander. That was no easy mission. Now we've got a big group of newly freed Nastosians and even more motivation to finish this mission. Let's keep moving.
The next step is to intercept their weapons routes and cut off their supply to weapons, permanently. They'll be handicapped and the rest will be a breeze.
The rebels will be most vulnerable without their weapons. Strike then.
Get {total} Spiked Roadblocks to intercept the supply vehicles.
Harvest {total} Pineapples. When combined with the right ingredient, it makes a deadly explosive.
Win {total} World Dominance Fights using Air Units to gather more ammo.
Mission accomplished, the rebels now have no incoming ammo. They'll be weakened enough in no time at all and that's when we'll take them down.

Let's take the rebels by surprise and raid their camps from the air. We will drop down when there is close to no activity and confiscate all ammo. Then we must bring the rebels in for questioning and find out how to stop this war once and for all.
Don't leave any ammo behind, clean the place out!
Collect {total} Rope Ladders to climb down from your Air Units.
Deal {total} damage to Sea Units to prevent any more attacks.
Collect {total} Coins. Stealth missions are expensive business.
We're almost there, Commander. Now we just have to hit them where it hurts and we can all go home.
We're going to launch aggressive attacks on both parties' headquarters. We'll take the necessary people in to be tried as criminals of war. This country can finally live in peace again.
Make it count, you're this close to succeeding.
Gather {total} members of the Global Alliance Tribunal to try the convicted individuals.
Deploy {total} Carriers to prepare to go home.
Congratulations, Commander. You have rescued a troubled, war-ridden nature from the depths of violence and misery. Now Nastos can rebuild itself and return to its former glory.

A top secret conference for only the most distinguished heads of military, politics and science is about to reveal a formula which unlocks a synthetic duplication of Element Z. Only certain people will be given access to this formula, we are among them.
Imagine an unlimited supply of Element Z in the hands of the Dark Alliance. They definitely won' be getting any.
A secret conference within a secret facility, atop a secret mountain. What's the big secret everyone wants a piece of?
Dr. G. Owari, Dr. Seabolt, myself and you, Commander, have all been invited to a secret conference in the mountains. This sounds like the perfect recipe for disaster.
Commander, this attack is much worse than I could have anticipated. Heads of state, geniuses and military leaders are on the floor bleeding. We have to do something.
Put your resources to good use, build units that will help you defeat the Dark Alliance.
Collect {total} Holographic Notepads. They'll keep you connected.
Collect {total} {rare} to help power what's left of the facility.
Fight the Dark Alliance, they're trying to take the formula!
We've survived the first wave, but remember this is a full-fledged attack. They're going to keep coming back until they destroy every one of us.
Avoid getting hit and look for the titanium case that holds the formula. That's what they're after. It is absolutely crucial that we keep it out of their hands.
Don't refuse help but keep your eye on the goal, the titanium case. It could be anywhere.
Collect {total} Oxygen Masks to help the injured.
Deal {total} damage with tanks to fend off attacks from the DA.
Speed up {total} neighbors' barracks to gain support.
No luck still but we've managed to get a few people home. Keep looking, there hasn't been an attack since the last one, which means Von Hellman is still here somewhere.
There he is! I see him, Von Hellman, and you're right. He's going straight for the titanium case. Hurry, we can get to him if we run. Wait, who are you? What do you think you're do -
Build enough strike teams to last you a while.
Collect {total} Resuscitation Kits to wake everyone up.
Survive {total} waves in Survival Mode to strengthen your resistance.
Build {total} strike teams to repel invasions while you're away.

I can't believe what just happened... We all got knocked out. I think it was Von Hellman's assistant, that scrawny fellow. I didn't think he had it in him. Now they're gone. What are we going to do, Commander?
Commander, Owari hasn't regained consciousness. She has a really nasty wound to her leg and Seabolt refuses to leave her side. We can't move on.
You're most vulnerable at this time. Win as many Battle Blitz fights as you can to stay strong.
Get {total} Emergency Surgery Kits to operate on Owari.
Win {total} Battle Blitz fights to survive the constant attacks.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers. It'll help Owari regain consciousness.
The surgery was a success, Commander. That crash course in emergency situations really paid off. We have to get Owari to a safe location and keep looking for Von Hellman.

Everyone's gone, Commander. We need to scale these mountains and find Von Hellman before it's too late. Also, let's try and stay alive, these attacks just aren't stopping. We've been seriously lucky so far.
If you can start a fire, roasted corn on the cob will be your best friend.
Collect {total} Military Grade Snow Boots to trek in these conditions.
Harvest {total} Corn to survive up in the cold.
Destroy {total} Fighters and keep the Dark Alliance away.
Still no sign of Hellman. Everyone's getting really tired Commander. Maybe we should stop for the night.
Alright, I think this is a good place to set up camp. Let's stay warm, eat something and pick up where we left off in the morning.
It's been two days of constant bomb dropping and gunfire. We're in a warzone and the Dark Alliance is not backing down.
Collect {total} Electric Blankets to stay warm.
Win {total} World Domination Fights and destroy the Dark Alliance.
We've survived the night. Which is a big deal, considering these conditions. Let's keep moving and hope that this is the last day we'll have to spend out here.
Commander, we've found a cave with some human footprints. Von Hellman could be in here. There are also drops of blood on the snow... I think he's hurt. Let's talk to him and get the formula back.
This attack is of a larger scale than we've ever seen. You never know which of your neighbors could be involved.
Collect {total} Industrial Torches to find your way through the cave.
Deploy {total} Bombers to take on the Dark Alliance armies.
Pillage your neighbors' {total} times for information on the Dark Alliance.
Von Hellman was attacked by his assistant, the scrawny one. He's taken off with the formula. Now we have to set out again.

Commander, we can't stay here, that last explosive has set off a series of avalanches and we're in the danger zone. Call in the team, we're leaving and we're taking Hellman with us. If his assistant is still out here, I doubt he'll survive this.
Remember, you can fight your invaders or use strike teams.
Call in {total} Search and Rescue teams to look for Hellman's assistant.
Repel {total} invasions on your Empire. Make those perpetrators pay.
Deal {total} damage to Air Units so you can make a safe escape.

The Search and Rescue teams said they found nothing. The entire landscape has changed after the avalanche and the original land has been buried under at least a hundred feet of snow. Oh well, it's for the best. That formula was bad news.

The Graves Girls are rich, spoiled twin sisters with a penchant for explosives and psychopathic violence. They're fighting over a boy, who happens to be Steele. Gina has kidnapped Steele, leaving Tina in a crazy, violent frenzy, threatening to destroy us all!
You can progress down both paths at once. The top path will earn you the Loggerhead and the bottom, the Spec Ops Devilfish Patrol Boat.
The Graves Girls shared Steele for a happy few days. Now they're taking sibling rivalry to the next level. Let's just say it involves explosives and death threats.

Those spoiled brats really get on my nerves, Commander. I think you should let me handle this one. The sisters kidnapped Steele but Gina couldn't share her toy anymore so she took him and ran. Tina is outraged and her large scale hissy fit is putting us all in danger.
You earned 5x Spec Ops Devilfish Patrol Boat!

Gina is holding Steele in an unknown location. If we're lucky, Steele might still have some of his communication equipment on him. Let's hope Gina hasn't been too 'thorough' with him. We might be able to send him a highly encrypted message.
Use your best units in battle, the Graves Girls are not ones for a shabby show.
Hire Code Experts to decode Steele's encrypted messages.
Harvest {total} Oil to prepare a fleet for battle, if the time comes.
It looks like Tina is onto us. She sent a fleet of her minions as a warning. We need to watch out for her from now on.

It looks like Tina finally ran out of patience. She lasted a good 24 hours, which is impressive by her standards. Her warning signal was a devastating attack on Steele's Empire. We need to get in there and provide aid.
Tina is definitely the cleverer of the sisters. Not to mention crazier too.
Gather {total} Paramedics Teams to help the injured on Steele's Empire.
Fight more of Tina's minions. Clever girl, she knew we were coming.
Okay, it looks like things are under control on Steele's territory. Let's go and figure out what to do with the troublesome twosome.

Our next step is to get a hold of Tina's location and prepare a team to take her in before she blows anything else up. I've gotta say, Commander, when I was a teenager I was pretty testy myself, but minions and bombs? Never. Kids these days.
Our only advantage is the element of surprise, so keep this information to yourself.
Assemble {total} Special Ops Ground Teams for the big shebang.
Win {total} fights in World Domination. Cake, compared to Tina Grave.
Harvest {total} wheat. Nourishment will keep you going.
Great, we know where she is. But there's one thing we don't know and that is just how tough her defenses are. We don't want to go in there unprepared. We need Steele to get us some intel.

Steele's not going to like this one bit but he just has to take one for the team. He needs to charm... yes, charm Gina Grave into telling him about her sister's security preferences. If we know what to expect, we might actually get out of there alive.
Don't be stingy with your units; this is a Grave girl after all.
Gather roses, Steele needs to impress his little lady.
Win {total} battles in Battle Blitz. Another practice session for later.
Deploy {total} carriers to transport your best units for battle.

Looks like we really did catch her off guard, she wasn't prepared for a fight; well not prepared enough at least. Now that we have her in our custody, things will get significantly easy from here on out.

Now that we've got Tina in our custody, what do you say we organize a little sibling sit-down with the girls? Gina is bound to respond if she sees a message from Tina. Let's get our best forgers in to replicate Tina's handwriting. The girl is too stubborn to do it herself.
Repel invasions using strike teams or battles.
Hire Forgers to write a message to Gina, from Tina.
Repel {total} invasions from neighbors while you're away.
Deal {total} damage to helicopters, the vermin of the sky they are.
The message has been signed, sealed and delivered. Now all we have to do is wait for Gina to respond... and she will respond. Teenage girls are so predictable.

We've strapped Gina down with explosives. One wrong move and we push the button. Yeah, I know she's young but she's blown up more empires than I've pulled out doll heads. Once the girls are together, our teams surround them and take them in.
Strike teams are quick, easy and lethal. Build as many as you can.
Order twin-compartment double-armored vans. It's no pumpkin carriage!
Build {total} strike teams to fend off invaders while you're gone.
Destroy {total} tanks to intimidate your attackers.
The girls are finally reunited... in prison and we've got Steele back. Now, lets get him to his first therapy session ASAP. The poor man is traumatized.

Commander, I suggest we strike a deal with Gina Grave, the sister who currently has Steele. She will give us her sister Tina's location, in exchange for us aborting all rescue missions meant for Steele.
Gina's location is just the icing on the cake, if we can manage it. Tina is who we're after.
Collect Phone Tapping Technology to get a hold of Gina's location too.
Fight Tina's minions. She's getting testy, we better get a move on.
Collect {total} {rare} to power your units. You'll be needing a lot of them.
Okay, so Gina Grave turned out to be a lot smarter than we thought. We couldn't track her location but she has agreed on our deal. We now know where Tina is, let's go get her.
The arrogance of these sisters never fails to astound me. Tina Grave has been 'hiding' on this gorgeous beach, sipping a fruity little drink this whole time. I really want to get my hands on her now.
Let's hope Tina has something potent in that drink of hers. It'll keep her off guard.
Get Foreign Airspace Permission Documents. We're going in from above.
Win {total} fights in Battle Blitz. It'll help blow off some steam.
Deploy {total} Land Units. It takes a lot muscle to bring down a Graves Girl.
Mission accomplished, we've got a very angry, tantrum-throwing Graves Girl on our hands. Let's rope in the other one too and rescue Steele from what most men wouldn't call a prison at all.

Gina Grave has just blown up the entire East Wing of our prison facility! All the cells are unlocked and the alarms are deafening. In the madness they've left Steele behind but I'm sure they'll be back for him.
Get {total} Back-Up Prison Security to deal with any unplanned chaos.
Pillage {total} times. Hanging out with the Graves girls has made us a little mean.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers to add a little heat to this mission.

I suppose she felt a pang of sisterly guilt and the only way she could get Tina out of there was to take us by surprise and turn the whole place upside down. Now we have to start from scratch. At least we have Steele.
Steele is packed with explosives. They're beeping and they'll go off any minute now. We have to get a bomb squad in here stat!
The Dark Alliance attacks when you're most vulnerable. Win in World Domination and keep them at bay.
Assemble Bomb Squads to diffuse the explosives on Steele before it's too late.
Win {total} fights in World Domination. Keep the Dark Alliance far, far away.
Build {total} of any Power-Up to keep your Empire strong.
Phew, that was a world class Bomb Squad, they deserve medals. Steele is safe but the Graves Girls are still missing, they have to pay for what they've done. Steele might be able to help up get them.
We need Steele to tell us everything he knows about the Graves Girls' hide outs. Between the two of them, we have a lot of options. Let's get to it.
Power-Ups increase your shot at winning in battle. Winning means more resources and of course, honor.
Collect Disposable Cellphones to get in touch and track the Graves Girls' location.
Destroy {total} submarines. They belong to the Graves' minions, for sure.
Use {total} Power-Ups in battle. Make a statement the Graves Girls can't ignore.
The Graves' Sisters aren't that difficult to track when they're being spontaneous. We've got them both and they're in for a pretty bitter treat at our newly refurbished prison facility.

A group of intelligence agents at the core of our intelligence headquarters have been working together without our knowledge. They've taken things too far, however by infiltrating Crestonia's intelligence agencies and now we've got to explain ourselves.
A cold war is the last thing we need right now, find these agents and set things right.
Rogue intelligence agents are on an unsanctioned mission that has sparked political tension so great, we could have a war on our hands.
Commander, we have a group of rogue agents that have infiltrated intelligence agencies across our neighboring empire - Crestonia. They are outraged. We must speak to them.
Call in your agency's top brass to let them know that you're on a ruthless hunt for the rogue agents. We don't know how high this deception goes, but we're determined to end any war before it begins.
Man hunts are expensive and taxing but a hunt for a group of government trained agents? Good luck.
Collect {total} Surveillance Cameras, you need eyes and ears everywhere.
Collect {total} coins to fund this man hunt.
Collect {total} red hearts. They'll help you come out of this PR disaster alive.
Alright, Commander, the search is on. It's only a matter of time before we get something.

We've received a mysterious phone call from a man using a voice changer to prevent identification. He claims to know all - he wants to name names and point fingers at the men behind the plot. But who is he and how can we trust him?
There's no shame in bowing down in apology. We're completely at fault.
Collect {total} Pens and Notepads to write down what he says before he hangs up.
Collect {total} oil to present to Crestonia as an apology gesture.
Destroy {total} units to prevent attacks from independent Crestonian militia.
Commander you're not going to like it. But the list of names our mystery man gave us, your closest aide is on there too. Sometimes looks really can be deceiving.
Peace talks with Crestonia are in order, commander - far, far away from the prying eyes of the press, in a secret location.
Sometimes you have to be mean to get what you want. Pillage away.
Collect {total} Precision Binoculars to keep an eye out for trouble.
Pillage {total} times to get information on the rogue agents.
Fight an attack from a group of mercenaries sanctioned by the rogue agents.

Our secret location was discovered apparently. An assassination attempt at the head of the Crestonian government blows all our chances of peace out of the water. We'll have to use every trick in a politician's book to fix this hot mess.
Security got a look at the sniper and they're after him. Unfortunately, we're are now unprotected and it looks like your very own aide decided to stay behind. You'll have to make a decision and fast.
War is a difficult thing, but when you have to go against your best friend, it's unbearable.
Get {total} Automatic Pistols to protect yourself.
Earn {total} Black Hearts. You'll need it to take down your best friend.
Destroy {total} Bombers to protect your empire from Crestonian attacks.
I don't think he knows we saw him Commander. We should have him followed, he might lead us to the rest of them.
Security has returned, empty handed I'm afraid. Let's get them to follow the suspect. Let's hope he leads them somewhere worthwhile.
Pineapples may seem absurd, but it's the oldest trick in the book.
Collect {total} Bandages to cover the wounds on the agent that was hit.
Harvest {total} Pineapples to place spy cams in. We need to tape the chase.
Fight {total} World Domination Battles to build your military strength.

The suspect led us straight to the sniper! They were meeting at a local cafe. Unfortunately they spotted us and fired. We have a man down but he'll make it. In the confusion, both your aide, our suspect and the sniper managed to get away.

Commander, we've received a call from our mystery man again. He wants to meet you... alone. If you take anyone with you he won't show up. I think you should go, all of his intel has been correct so far.
In the eyes of the public, we're not looking so good. A couple of good deeds will really help us out.
Collect {total} Mobile Phones to keep in touch.
Fight {total} battles in Battle Blitz to prepare for battle with Crestonia.
Revive {total} Neighbor Crops to win support.

Commander, believe me, I'm as shocked as you are. I can't believe our mystery man was the Chief of Intelligence the whole time. He used to work with the rogue agents but when they took things too far, he backed out. He's the only thing between us and them now.

The Chief now wants protection in exchange for information. He's going to spill the beans and reveal everything, names, plots, places and spies. This will stop the war clouds that have already begun to rain fire on your empire.
The Chief means well but we'll have to discuss the terms of this agreement in greater detail later on.
Collect {total} Portable Recorders to get his confession on tape.
Earn {total} Mastery Tokens to build up your rep.
Place {total} Bombers to protect the chief.
Now we can finally stop the war clouds that have already begun to rain fire on our empire. We'll have those rogue agents behind bars before they know it.
All the rogue agents are rounded up and are already feeling at home in prison, where they belong. Let's call for an immediate ceasefire and travel to Crestonia to call a truce.
This isn't happily ever after, but it's a start.
Arrange for {total} Prison Uniforms for our newest inmates.
Gain {total} levels in World Domination to become more powerful.
Earn {total} Black Hearts to make sure nobody tries to mess with you again.

Let's work on rebuilding the parts of our nation that were damaged during the Crestonian attacks. While we're at it, we really need to kiss and make up with Crestonia. An enemy neighbor is a complete nightmare and we want to sleep sweet at night.

The plans for the Neutralizer are incomplete. There's a vital piece that must be made from a rare ore, only found on the island of Gamor. Getting to Gamor is no easy task. There are hostile nations on the way; they will shoot first and ask questions later.
You can progress down both paths at once. The top path will earn you the SpecOps Coyote Artillery and the bottom, the SpecOps Commando.
The Eel is ruthless when he's on a mission. He's in a nuclear kind of mood this time and he's working with an evil dictator to blow half the world into bits.

I don't know how he did it but he hacked into my system. Even I can't hack into my system. He's got the plans for the Nuclear Neutralizer and he knows where to get that very rare ore. That's the only thing keeping him from blowing up the world.
Using sophisticated digitized tracking methods, maybe we can get a hold on The Eel's location.
This will be a difficult journey. Red hearts and the support of your allies are very important right now.
Get {total} Hacker Tracker Worms to help find the location of Eel's operations.
Earn {total} Red Hearts to get back up from your neighbors if necessary.
Harvest {total} Corn to feed your men on the dangerous journey ahead.
Unfortunately, he's given us the slip but leaves his laptop behind. We can only assume that he has the stolen plans on a device - a device that we'll have to find and destroy.

The Eel has a head start. We must catch up and fast. Where will he go next? Why of course! The Airport! He'll head straight to the dictatorship to gather resources for this journey to Gamor. We must stop him before he can leave.
Even the bugs in Gamor are hostile.
Collect {total} Federal Agent Badges to instantly get through airport security.
Harvest {total} Strawberries. They soothe insect bites from a species native to Gamor.
We couldn't stop the plane before it took off. The smarter thing to do is to head to The Eel's next destination - the dictatorship.
The Eel is a slimy, clever villain, that's for sure. He's planted a bomb at the airport and called in a warning. Our agents must abandon their pursuit, find and diffuse the bomb before it goes off.
The Eel won't stop at just one distraction, he never does.
Gather {total} Protective Bomb Suits to stay safe while diffusing the bomb.
Phew! We diffused that bomb just in time to fend off an attack from a very rowdy, rabid looking set of troops. They're from Gamor we think. Expect more of them when we're there.

It's time to send in the troops. Let's be smart about it. We can't march into enemy territory without serious repercussions. We'll have to go guerrilla. Get your agents into the dictatorship on fake passports and half the battle is won.
The guerilla troops are everywhere, stay alert.
Obtain {total} fake passports to enter Gamor smoothly.
Fight guerilla troops that think you are special forces from the government of Gamor.
Earn {total} Black Hearts. You'll need 'em in a place like Gamor.
Mission accomplished! Your agents are now in the dictatorship. They managed to find where The Eel is holed up and surrounded his hideout.

I've had enough! Let's send a surveillance aircraft to do a reconnaissance of enemy territory. Quick, Commander, the plane is spotted and the dictator's forces are about to launch an attack on us. We need to get out of there!
Repel invasions using strike teams or battles.
Get {total} Parachutes to drop from the air into enemy territory.
Fight {total} World Domination Fights to grow strong and powerful.
Deploy {total} Grunt Soldiers to deal with the bloodshed.

Phew, our best man escaped by the teeth of his skin. He's managed to gather quite a bit of information too. With this we're more than prepared to conduct a stealthy night drop of troops into the heart of the dictatorship where they can trace The Eel.
Our troops manage to surround The Eel's hideout without being detected. The plan is to storm the building and take the villain by surprise. It's dangerous but it should work.
The guerillas are persistent and ruthless - they must never find out about our mission.
Acquire {total} Civilian Outfits to blend in with the crowd after the mission.
Deal {total} damage to Artillery Units to defend yourselves.
We've got the Eel and while we're here, we might as well pick up the Ore for the neutralizer. I love happy endings.

Call in your military advisor. There's no time to waste. You tell him to prepare the troops to go into action if the dictator does not surrender The Eel and the stolen plans. You will take him by force, if necessary.
The men always fight better after a good breakfast of energy bars and strawberries.
Collect {total} Energy Bars as part of your army rations.
Collect {total} {rare} to build more powerful units for bloody battle.
Harvest {total} Total Strawberries, also part of the army rations.
Preparations have been made, Commander. Let's do this.
This isn't just a threat to your empire. It's a threat to the world. So you call on your allies and ask them to join forces with you to defeat the common enemy.
In Gamor, a reputation for violence will get you far.
Get {total} Desert Canteens in case we get stranded in the sun.
Earn {total} Black Hearts. They're all the rage near Gamor.

Your troops are growing. Unfortunately, we've received reports that The Eel has left the dictatorship and is heading towards Gamor in a heavily protected convoy. They are now in the middle of the desert.
The plan is to send out our air bombers to attack the convoy. This should work, in theory at least.
Who doesn't love a good hostile takeover?
Get {total} Trojan Horses to remind you of age-old battle trickery.
Earn {total} Mastery Tokens. If you can take on the Dark Alliance, you can take on the Eel.
Win {total} battles in Battle Blitz to gain power and resources.

That did not go according to plan at all. The dictatorship's air force also arrived on the scene. The air was filled with gunfire. You manage to shoot down a couple of their planes. We checked the convoy, it was a decoy. The Eel isn't there.
You don't have time to lose, Commander. Instead of pursuing the convoy, we should send troops directly to Gamor.
Mystery Units are obtained by expanding your empire.
Obtain {total} Aircrew Headsets for easy transmission.
Acquire {total} Mystery Units to expand your empire and therefore, your power.
We got through most foreign airspace smoothly but one hostile nation sent their heavy guns after us. We barely made it but we did. Thank goodness.
We've reached Gamor and it seems we're early to this party. Send half the troops to look for the rare ore and the other half wait to Ambush The Eel and his party.
We're almost there, let's stick it through.
Collect {total} Pickaxes to look for the Ore.
Win {total} fights in World Domination to free other lands from the hands of dirty villains.
Deploy {total} Grunt Soldiers for the much awaited ambush.
Your victory is hard won, but at the end of the battle, you have defeated The Eel and confiscated the CD with the plans. Your troops also manage to find the ore. Well done, Commander!

Commander, it has come to my attention that an entire fleet of your best carriers, that's about 50 of them, have mysteriously disappeared off the coast of an unknown empire. I'm good with the seas... and I fly things. You need me.
The mysterious disappearance of an entire fleet of your carriers has the government worried. Work with Flygirl to figure out what is going on.
I heard you've got a problem with missing carriers in uncharted waters. Well, I'm your girl. I've heard some pretty crazy things about pirates and all sorts of things. Let me help you.

Commander, we need a plan. I'm assuming you want to be in on it? Cause if you don't, I can go myself right now and sort this mess out. A meeting? That's what I thought. Call in your people, I'll be waiting.
Build your best units, you're going to need them for this mission.
Hire {total} Ocean Rescue Workers to search the seas for your missing carriers.
Clear {total} trees from your island to gather wood for supplies.
Collect {total} {rare} to build more units for the search.
Looks like everything is in place to start a search unlike any search we've ever conducted before. Let's do it.
Captain, is the search fleet ready for deployment? Send them out and hope for the best. Let's monitor them from above.
Who knows how long your fleet will be gone. Let's hope their supplies don't run out.
Collect {total} Search Lights to see far into the distance.
Collect {total} Oil to power your fleet.
Collect {total} Coins to give to your men on their search mission.
I should have seen this coming, Commander. The second fleet has gone missing too. They entered a winding canal that laced hundreds of small islands and before I knew it they were gone.
Commander I think we should get a little closer... on the ground. Just you and I and a few of your men. Tonight's the night.
Use your new Acid Blasts against those wretched Titans.
Revive {total} Neighbors Crops to collect food for the mission.
Fight an attack from a group of advanced Titans.

What are those things? Titans? I've never seen anything like them on this side of the world. Or any side of the world really. They're holding all our carriers hostage and now they've got us too. What do we do?
I think we're being taken to speak to someone. I've seen some of your men and carriers on the way. They don't look like they've been hurt... too much.
Good old Titans. You know the drill - fight them with your best units.
Get {total} Pocket Knives to protect yourself.
Harvest {total} Wheat to feed your hungry men.

I don't know who this man is but he looks extremely dodgy. He's been controlling these Titans for weeks. He makes his money on ransoms and he wants us to pay one too for the safe return of your men. Are you going to do it?

We're allowed to go home in order to organize the ransom but if I'm thinking what you're thinking, I say we devise a plan to deceive this mysterious man. He's not getting any of our money. We're under constant supervision however so we've got to be careful.
The Titans have been ordered to keep attacking. Our bad guy wants us to know he still controls us.
Collect {total} Messenger Pigeons to deliver messages discreetly.
Build {total} Power-Ups to take on more Titan Attacks.
Fight the never ending Titan attacks.

All your people are aware that there is a top secret plan in the making. The corridors are silent with anticipation. Luckily for us, our escorts aren't the brightest bulbs around so they don't have a clue how bad they're about to have it.
Our biggest challenge now is to organize one top secret meeting. It has to be quick. In and out. You got any bright ideas, Commander?
How about sleeping pills? For your escorts... It's an age old trick. Never fails.
Collect {total} Protective Body Suits. It's all part of the great plan.
Use {total} Field Repair I Power Ups in battles t to fend off attacks.

Phew! Those sleeping pills had them out like lights. Now that our plan is in place we need to suit up and head out. Remember, we're still pretending that we're going along with this whole ransom thing.

We have our fleet of highly advanced attack submarines waiting just a couple of miles off the shore. As soon as you send the signal, we'll have men flooding the shores in no time. It'll be loud, bloody and messy but it'll be a surprise and that's our only advantage.
Our top priority is to evacuate and rescue all our men. But we should also get our hands on our no-name mystery man.
Build {total} Strike Teams to instantly destroy your attackers.
Fight the Titans. We're almost there, Commander.
The attack is underway Commander. All the bombs, explosions, gunfire, screams... I love it! Send the signal and I'll have my air fleet in there in no time.

All right it looks like we've got everyone out of there safe and sound. We've even got our hands on the mystery man. The agents are calling him Pirate for now. We're working on trying to turn his Titan toys off. Until then, keep fighting them.
As soon as Pirate agrees to stop playing with his toys, we'll get some information out of him.
Arrange for {total} Peacekeeper Uniforms for the forces we're stationing on the affected coastlines.
Deploy {total} carriers to provide suppliers to our new Peacekeeping force.
Fight the Titans - one last time.
Okay, that looks like the last of the Titan attacks for now. Now that they're no longer under control, they've fled.

This is a national emergency that must remain under wraps. Only a handful of government officials know what we're truly dealing with. To the rest of the team, it's a very important painting that must be found.
You can progress down both paths at once. The top path will earn you the Secret Service Vulture Copter and the bottom, the Secret Service Rhino AFV.
A mysterious painting has been stolen from your largest, most fortified museum. This is no ordinary piece of art. A secret hidden within it puts the entire government at risk.

Commander, I never thought this day would come but it has. The piece has been stolen from the Stellencolt Museum. You know what we have hiding in there, if that ever gets out we might have to watch as the government collapses before us.
You earned 5x Secret Service Vulture Copter!
You earned 5x Secret Service Rhino AFV!

The first step is to contain the situation. We'll need to close off the museum till we get a better understanding of a group of newbies managed to get past our most advanced custom created security system.
Back up resources never did anybody any hard. Go get that ore.
Get {total} Crime Scene Tape to keep the public out.
Gather {total} {rare} to produce ammo in case things get ugly.
Deploy {total} Tanks to surround and protect the area surrounding the Stellencolt.
The press is having a field day with this but the situation is still manageable. Now, onto step 2: find the bothers and make them pay.

We need to get our investigation team into the museum and fast. I will go brief an elite team on the situation. We must be very careful, however. We need to make sure nobody but our own people can get into the museum at all times.
A group from a foreign empire is a high possibility. Fight your way through Battle Blitz to send a message.
Get {total} ID Badges to keep tabs on who is working in the Museum at all times.
Collect coins from {total} Houses to fund the investigation.
Win {total} Battle Blitz Battles to make sure no foreign empire is responsible for this.
Commander, the investigation doesn't show us much. Whoever this group is, they're good. They were in and out without so much as a scratch or a boot mark on the floor. We have to dig a little deeper.

I've assembled a group of Art Thievery Experts to consult with us on this. Yes, there is such a thing as an Art Thievery Expert, Commander. Now stay awake! They might be able to give us something extremely useful.
He who helps his neighbor receives help twice fold.
Gather {total} Art Thievery Specialists to consult with you.
Harvest {total} {nrare2} to build more units. If things get ugly, you'll need them.
Speed up {total} Neighbors' Barracks. You'll need their help if this gets out of hand.

Okay, this is what we've got. The group might or might not have known about the government's purpose for the painting but either way, they would have seen the document. Their main concern right now, however is to sell that piece for some big bucks.
Commander, intel has a lead on a possible location of the group. We should watch them through the night to find out how dangerous they are.
Our hopeful buyers should be able to give us something. If not, we'll arrest them for something else.
Obtain {total} Stake Out Vans to watch the group through the night.
Follow some of the potential buyers and threaten them violently to find out more.
Deploy {x} Gunboats to arrest any buyer movement through the waters.
The group looks armed and dangerous, we need to tread carefully. I think we need to dress an agent up as a buyer and send him in the strike a deal.

Our guy is ready to go, Commander. He knows the plan. He's got to go in, make a deal and wait while they procure the piece for him. Moments before the handover, he'll give us a signal and that's when we storm in.
Pillaging isn't nice but we gotta do what we gotta do sometimes.
Get {total} Two-Way bugs to make sure your agent is connected to you at all times.
Add {total} Space in the Army Depot for your new toys.
Pillage {total} times from Neighbors to get information out of them.

Well that was a smooth mission! I've made sure the piece isn't damaged at all. Our agent's breath signals were perfect! Remind me to speak to someone about a promotion. Now that we've got the group in our custody, what shall we do with them?
We've got all our interrogation rooms set up and stocked for an entire night of long hard interrogation. We're going to get all the answers out of them and we're going to do it tonight.
Don't have too much fun, interrogation gets addictive.
Harvest {total} Wood. It comes in handy if you prefer traditional methods of torture.
Deploy {total} grunt soldiers to maintain the calm and peace in the empire.
Win {total} World Dominance Fights. Your thieves will start talking faster.

Okay Commander, we managed to get all of them talking as different points in the night. They all memorized the digit on the back of the painting but none of them know what it's for. They can spend all their jail time figuring it out.

The public must not know about theft. We need to hire spokespersons to tell the public that there was a security breach and the museum is closed today for maintenance. We have one day to replace that painting and reopen the museum.
Distraction is your best method right now.
Hire {total} Spokespersons to inform the public of the goings on.
Harvest {total} Chili Peppers to make it seem like nothing is going on.
Deal {total} Damage in battle to divert public attention away from the museum.
Alright the public is taken care of and the museum is closed for the day. We need to get that piece replaced immediately.
I've brought in our best candidates; they're all excited to be getting paid to forge an original. Let's hope it's motivation enough.
Their time starts now, let's hope Art School has taught these kids a thing or two.
Hire {total} Art Forgers to create a perfect replica of the stolen piece.
Harvest {total} Oil to keep your Empire running, unperturbed.
Earn {total} Red Hearts to ensure people trust you.
Not bad at all, out of 10 top class forgers, we've managed to get 2 exact replicas. Let's hang it up!

Now that the piece is back up in the museum and the public isn't even aware that it was stolen, our little group of thieves is going to get antsy. Buyers won't believe that they have the original piece. Let's set up a fully tracked set of phone lines.
Why don't you get some popcorn and pop in a movie while you're at it?
Get {total} Crossword Puzzles to do while you wait.
Repel {total} Invasions on neighbors' empires to stay on top of things.
Complete {total} Waves in Survival Mode. The things you can do with all this free time.
Alright, the phone lines are almost up and running. Pass me a crossword puzzle, will you?
The phone lines have been tried and tested, everything is working well. Let's have everybody on standby and wait for the call.
Just be patient, they will call. They always do.
Hire {total} Phone Operators to handle the tapped-into phone lines.
Harvest {total} Pineapples. It makes for a good waiting snack.
Build {total} Experimental Shipyard Units to stay on your guard.
I hate to say this, Commander - actually I'm glad to be saying this - I told you so. Criminals are getting so predictable these days. Alright, suit up, we've got a ransom payment to fake.
Our agents are mid-mission as we speak. So far, so good. All they have to do is go in, pay the ransom, storm the location and get the piece back completely undamaged.
We're almost there, let's stick it through.
Collect {total} Donuts for a little police celebration.
Earn {total} Black Hearts. Reputation is everything.
Use {total} Power-Ups in Battle. That'll scare them.

Commander, we've brought in the group. They are a small division of a foreign group. Unfortunately their laws insist that they be tried as criminals within their own country. I'm sure they'll be found guilty without a doubt.
Prepare your forces for future battles!
Click on the Barracks, then select Cadet Soldiers.
The Cadets in training will be ready soon!
Prepare your forces for battle - Play now to earn free gift!
Our population will grow when you build more housing.
Small Island Huts are in the Housing tab of the Build menu.
Build two additional Small Island Huts
Build a home for the new Parliament and raise your population capacity.
The Parliament building is in the Government tab of the Build Menu.
The Parliament building is in the Government tab of the Build Menu. Send staff invites to friends and click Finish when all positions are filled!
Construct a new Parliament Building to raise our population capacity
Finish the Parliament Building to raise our population capacity
Government buildings raise our population capacity, allowing us to build more houses!
An army marches on its stomach!
Farms are in the Industry tab of the Build Menu. Click on Farms to plant crops.
Earn Coins by harvesting your crops when they're ready.
Click on the Farm to harvest the Corn. Crops must be ready before you can harvest them.
Harvesting crops is a great way to earn Coins!
Assemble your Cadet Soldiers outside the barracks!
When the Cadet Soldiers have completed their training, click on the Barracks to deploy them.
Deploy Cadet Soldiers On The Island
Your Cadet Soldiers are armed and ready for action!
Scout for enemy troops using camera tools.
Click on Full Screen and Zoom buttons in the upper right.
Zoom Out to see your outer islands
Click on Steele's portrait below and select Visit, then click on one of Steele's buildings.
Click on one of Steele's buildings
You and Steele will make good allies.
Meet the Neighbors and Tend Govt
Click on Neighbor's portrait below and select Visit, then click on one of Neighbor's Government buildings.
Click on one of government buildings
Head back to your island when done.
Click on the tactical map to return home.
It feels good to be home again.
Pan the camera to explore your coastline.
Hold down the mouse button to pan the camera.
Use panning to explore your island!
You'll need more forces to repel the Dark Alliance!
Click on the Barracks and select the Cannon Artillery.
Place the Cannon when ready to use it in battle!
Deploy your Cannon Artillery to the island.
When finished, click on the Barracks to place the Cannons.
Cannon Artillery can help against enemy tanks!
Deploy your Cannon Artillery - Play now to earn free gift!
Collect rent from houses to earn coins.
Click on houses to collect rent.
Come back often to collect from houses!
Plant and harvest Watermelons for more coins.
Click on the Farm to plant Watermelons.
We'll need Wood to build the empire.
You can find the Lumber Mill in the Industry tab of the Build Menu.
Wood is used to construct buildings!
Clear groups of trees to get Wood. You need Wood for new buildings.
Click on trees to clear them.
That Wood will come in handy when rebuilding your empire!
Raise population to gain access to new buildings.
Build houses to grow our population.
Build and Work an Oil Well
Build an Oil Well and start collecting Oil.
You can find the Oil Well in the Industry tab of the Build Menu.
Oil's going to be a vital part of building up your forces!
Build a Shipyard to confront Captain Krunsch's blockade.
You can find the Shipyard in the Military tab of the Build Menu.
Krunsch is cowering in fear of your new Navy!
Prepare your new naval armada for battle!
The Ironclad Gunboat is great at taking out Carriers.
Deploy the Ironclad Gunboat on the water
Send your new Navy into combat!
The World Embassy is now in your inventory!
Place the World Embassy to prevent attacks from other players.
Place the World Embassy and click on it to activate it.
Our World Embassy is now ready to be staffed!
Flag is now in your inventory!
Flag is now in your inventory!
Click on the Battle Map button to start the campaign.
Chase Captain Krunsch from the outskirts of Cape Pleasant.
Click on the Battle Map button to start the campaign.
Complete the Cape Pleasant I Campaign
It's time to continue our liberation of Cape Pleasant.
Click on the Battle Map button to continue the campaign.
Complete Stage II of Cape Pleasant Campaign
Defeat Captain Krunsch and liberate Cape Pleasant!
Captain Krunsch has taken Cape Pleasant and is plundering its Ore reserves! We have to stop him!
Defeat Captain Krunsch - Play now to earn free gift!
Go back and fight on a previous battlefield.
Vintage Fighters escaped our counterattack. Finish them off!
Replay Battle 3 of Cape Plesant Conflict
Build an Ore Mine from the Industry tab.
You can find the Ore Mine in the Industry tab of the Build Menu.
Use Ore to build more advanced units!
Build a Hangar and an aircraft
Air units can be purchased in the Hangar.
Construct aircraft to help in future battles.
Add a Neighbor to your list of allies.
Add a neighbor by clicking on Invite Friend below or Invite Friends above.
Kai Tana has commandeered Mercadia Isle's military bases. We'll be next if we don't put a stop to this now.
Kai Tana has been chased from the area.
Kai Tana has commandeered Mercadia Isle's military bases. We'll be next if we don't put a stop to this now.
Kai Tana has been chased from the area.
Kai Tana has commandeered Mercadia Isle's military bases. We'll be next if we don't put a stop to this now.
The Mercadians have regained control with your help.
Purchase an Expansion for you island.
Use Liberty Bonds to buy an expansion for more room to build.
Soon we'll have our empire restored to its full glory!
Build a Market and use it to sell {rare}.
Put {total} {rare} for sale on the Market in one transaction
You've learned the basics of commerce.
Jada Bombs is ransacking Reef Haven's oil reserves for The Dark Alliance. We have to stop her!
Jada Bombs has been chased from the area.
