Find Cottages under the Housing Tab of the Build Menu.
The dignitaries will love their quarters while they're here!
With the tropical storms coming, we should have some hardier housing.
These new houses will hold up nicely!
Visitors love to stay in our island huts near the beach.
Build some Large Island Huts to encourage people to visit.
Nobody can resist staying in a Large Island Hut!
As the fighting intensifies, we're seeing a lot of refugees.
Families are growing and we need more room.
Large Bungalows make the perfect home.
Another wave of refugees is inbound. We need to house them.
Find Large Cottages under the Housing Tab of the Build Menu.
We're all ready for the refugees, and just in time!
Get the Defense Tower built in a critical area.
The Defense Tower protects adjacent buildings, but still allows us to attack our Neighbors.
It's smaller than it looked in the blueprints.
Let's get this baby turned on!
The Defense Tower will need more Energy Drinks to keep the guards awake.
Hear that? That's the sound of safety. I'll sleep like a baby.
Time to strike, while our own buildings bask in safety. Can buildings bask? Ours do.
The Defense Tower allows you to attack another player while still maintaining immunity for a section of your island.
With Your Defense Tower Active, Attack Another Player
We are rubber, they are glue. Whatever they attack bounces off us, as long as it's close to the Defense Tower, and the guards are awake, too.
We need more Energy Drinks to keep the Defense Tower active.
Ask your friends to send you Zipp Energy Drinks. Don't tell them that you still plan to pillage their islands. They'll find out soon enough.
This Zipp is good stuff. I haven't slept in eight weeks, but I've reorganized my closet 168 times!
Get the Defense Tower II built in a critical area.
The Defense Tower II protects adjacent buildings, but still allows us to attack others.
With great Defense Tower II comes great responsiblity II.
Build the Defense Tower II and use Zipp Energy Drinks to activate it, by keeping the guards awake.
Now quickly, go attack somebody while your Defense Tower II is activated!
Place Dragon Statues in honor of our friends from Cape Pleasant.
Dragon Statues can be found in the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
The Dragon Statues are a symbol of our new alliance.
Thanks to the people of Cape Pleasant, we can now build Dragon Boats.
Dragon Boats can be found in the Shipyard.
The enemy will tremble in fear when they see these Dragon Boats coming for them!
It's time to prepare the island for Independence Week.
Trumpet flowers can be purchased from the Decorations tab of the Build menu.
This will be a celebration to remember!
The island is having an Air Show as part of the celebration.
Aircraft can be found in the Hangar. Defeat Kai Tana and Jada Bombs to unlock the Ripper and the Honey Badger.
This air show is going to be amazing!
It's time to honor the soldiers who led us from oppression.
The Army Exercise Yard and Soldier Statue can be found under the Decorations tab of the Build menu.
The ceremony for our vetarans was very well received.
We are going to have a flyover during the Independence Week parade.
The F-35 Lightning II Fighter can be purchased in the Hangar II.
Have {total} F-35 Lightning II Fighters Deployed
Do {total} Damage in Combat using the F-35 Lightning II Fighter
The flyover rocked the parade and the enemy alike!
French Cottages can be found under the Housing tab in the Build menu.
We're ready to house our guests for the joint maneuvers!
Let's get some of our allies' Bastille Tanks into production.
The Bastille Tank can be found in the Barracks.
Let's see if our allies' tanks are a force majeure, or a faux pas.
Evaluate how our allies' Bastille Tanks perform in combat.
Pick the Bastille Tank on the unit selection screen before combat.
Do {total} Damage with the Bastille Tank
Not bad. These people design a mean tank, that's for sure.
Construct an Army Target Range so our troops can train together.
The Army Target Range can be found in the Decorations tab of the Build menu.
Our troops are ready to work together in a Tour de Force.
Now that we've trained together, let's see how we fight together.
Don't forget you can upgrade your troops in the Army Research Lab.
Time to say "au revoir" to our enemies!
Honor the space travelers -- the non-human ones.
The Space Dog Statue can be found in the Decorations tab of the Build menu.
To our animal pioneers, we raise a paw to salute you!
Get the island ready for the return of the ship's crew.
You have a limited amount of time to complete this quest. The countdown has begun!
Everyone had a rollicking good time at the reunion party! And no one got mooned.
It's time to celebrate Sausagefest. Let's get the island ready.
The Alpine Haus can be found under the Houses tab of the Build menu.
I can't wait for the sausage to be served!
More decorations for the beer garden have arrived.
We're going to need more Wheat for our tasty brew.
I wonder what the sausage is made out of?
Time to bring in the decorative centerpiece for the beer garden.
The Bandit can be found in the Hangar II.
I always sleep better with a little sausage in me.
Gather food to feed Krunsch's stranded soldiers, and maps to get there.
Ask your friends to send you Mission Maps.
I hope we can trust this guy.
Man can't live on pineapples alone, I guess.
Do they really need Strawberries too?
Make sure our Battleships are ready to sail to Cape Pleasant.
Find Gunboats by re-playing completed maps, or attack a Neighbor.
These ships are definitely up to the task of hauling pineapples!
Krunsch's men need to get off that island, but all their boats are damaged.
Send Gifts to your friends and they may send you one back.
He was true to his word, eventually. Maybe he turned over a new leaf?
Enlist friends to help find the lost aircraft before the enemy does.
Recruit friends who have never played Empires and Allies.
Invite {total} New Friends to Play Empires and Allies
Have {total} New Friends Play Empires and Allies
We found the plane, thanks to you and your new Allies.
Recruit new friends at the diplomatic function.
Recruit friends to play Empires and Allies.
Invite {total} New Friends to Play Empires and Allies
Have {total} New Friends Play Empires and Allies
Our new allies are providing a wealth of information about the outlying areas.
Place and complete a Power-Up Factory.
If you don't place the Power-Up Factory right now, you can find it in your inventory.
Ask friends for parts for new Power Ups.
If we can keep churning out Power-Ups, winning battles will be a cool summer breeze.
Gather Red Hearts by helping out with your Neighbor's island.
Our resource push is under way!
Our troops on the front lines are hungry.
Get friends to speed up your crops to harvest them faster.
An army travels on its stomach. The dry cleaning is very expensive.
Get help for the war effort from our Neighbors.
Visit Neighbors to tend houses and collect {nrare2}.
One particular type of tank will fit the bill nicely.
The Hammerhead appears in the Barracks after defeating the Graves Girls.
The people's hearts will fill with joy when they see their donations put to such good use.
I'll need an appropriate faciltiy to build the fighter.
Ask your friends to send you IRST Units. Fighter Upgrades can be purchased in the Air Force Research Lab.
With the proper tools, man can do anything. And by 'anything', I mean...some things.
Build a squadron of the new Fighters.
Find the KF-X in the Hangar
This is a plane with a purpose! Destruction is a purpose, isn't it?
Use the KF-X for Air Combat
Test out the new Fighters against enemy aircraft.
You can replay campaign battles you've already beaten.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Air Units with the KF-X
Destroy {total} Enemy Aircraft with the KF-X
Successful air test! Surprising. I mean...of course it was successful!
Use the KF-X for Sea Combat
Test out the KF-X against enemy ships.
Look to fight units the KF-X is strong against.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Naval Units with the KF-X
Destroy {total} Enemy Naval Craft with the KF-X
Successful sea test! This thing potentiates awesomeness!
Use the KF-X for Ground Defense
The final test involves enemy ground units.
You can retreat from battle at any time without sacrificing any additional units.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Ground Units with the KF-X
Destroy {total} Enemy Ground Units with the KF-X
Ow! I hurt my arm. It must have happened while patting myself on my back for building such an exemplary jet.
Find allies to investigate recent activity.
Invite your friends to play. Allies make playing easier and more fun.
Invite {total} New Friends to Play Empires and Allies
Now we have enough eyes to start looking into this.
Use your new network to trade intelligence on recent activity.
Ask your friends to send you Covert Ops Intel and Decoder Rings. Be nice and return the favor.
From the intel we gathered, it looks like I was right. Something's up.
Intel points to an experimental fighter at an abandoned airstrip. Let's grab it.
Upgrade Soldiers at the Army Research Lab.
We got the plane, Commander. Let's get it back home.
Put the Yellow Mustang on the island for Dr. Seabolt to examine.
Find the Yellow Mustang in your Inventory.
Dr. Seabolt seems all fired up about this plane for some reason.
This plane is unstable! We need to move it out of here. NOW!
Move the plane away from our people.
That was close, Commander. Something about the power source just doesn't add up.
We'll need some forces to keep an eye on the island.
Upgrade Gunboats in the Naval Research Lab.
We'll try to build a copy of the plane while we wait for whoever built that thing.
Try your hand at building the Yellow Mustang.
The Yellow Mustang can be found in the Hangar.
That should be enough for Seabolt's experiments.
Invade other players where their Yellow Mustangs sit, Commander, and power-ups would make this fight easier.
Use The Yellow Mustang to Destroy An Enemy Yellow Mustang
Dr. Seabolt won't say what's so darn special about this plane.
Find the Control Tower and Helipad in the Decorations tab of the Build menu.
Now their helicopters will have somewhere to land. It sure beats hovering all the time.
Prepare a smorgasbord of delicious food.
Have your neighbors speed up your crops to harvest them sooner.
Harvest {total} Chili Pepper Fields From Neighbors
Just like daddy used to make...spicy tomato soup. Be sure not to get any in your eye!
Gather supplies to equip the Special Ops forces.
Ask your friends to send you supplies.
Spec Ops will be here soon. Maybe they can tell us what "Spec Ops" means.
Build a force to rescue the Spec Ops soldiers.
Any ship of each class will do.
That right there is a beefy flotilla. Mmm, anyone else feel like having Mexican take-out?
Ask friends to send Ship Wheels
The rescue operation can continue. Turns out the Spec Ops guys are in a straight line from here, so we didn't need the ships' wheels after all.
Use Navy To Carve Up Enemy Like a Turkey
Use an upgraded Navy to remove resistance.
Naval Upgrades can be found in the Navy Research Lab
Inflict {total} Damage with Upgraded Naval Units
Destroy {total} Units with Upgraded Naval Units
I haven't seen a thrashing like that since my daughters stopped sharing a bedroom.
Build Chinooks to fly out the Spec Ops soldiers.
Find Chinooks in the Hangar II.
The Spec Ops team has been rescued! Guess they aren't the only ones up to spec.
Look for evidence of Element Z.
I knew it. Something big is going on.
Enlist help to find evidence of Element Z.
Recruit friends who have never played Empires and Allies.
Have {total} New Friends Play Empires and Allies
Hey, look at what our friends found. To the victor goes...this thing.
Ask friends to help capture defecting scientists.
Ask your friends to help you round up Defecting Scientists.
Nice work, Commander. We're already assembling the intelligence they provided. Those nerds love their slideshows.
Prepare forces to storm the island and capture the research facility.
Upgrade your units to make them more effective in combat.
A force like this would have made General Custer proud! Oh wait, bad example.
Fight your way to the research facility.
You can retreat from battle to avoid losing any more units. But only cowards retreat.
Use Upgraded Army Units to Destroy {total} Enemy Units
Use Upgraded Army Units to Inflict {total} Damage
The world will never forget. Like the Battle of...you know. That big, important one.
Collect Bomb Disposal Robots to clear the facility.
Ask friends to send you Bomb Disposal Robots
Those robots were great at finding booby traps. Much better than the long sticks we used to use.
Nothing says home like a bowl of hearty onion soup.
Don't forget a little something for our Bomb Disposal Robots. Robots gotta eat, too.
Check out the hardware our bomb disposal robots found. They've earned that oil.
Attack an opponent in Battle Blitz.
Click on the Battle Blitz Button to bring up your Battle Bar.
Attack an Opponent in Battle Blitz
We didn't start this fight, but we shall finish it!
Attack an Opponent in Battle Blitz.
Click on the Battle Blitz Button to bring up your Battle Bar.
Defeat {total} Opponents in Battle Blitz Attacks
You're acquiring a taste for Victory, Commander!
Defeat a horde of enemies in Battle Blitz.
Click on the Battle Blitz Button to bring up your Battle Bar.
Defeat {total} Opponents in Battle Blitz Attacks
Winning isn't everything. It's the only thing! Oh, and winning prizes is nice too.
Improved training techniques have given us a new soldier.
Find the Advanced Soldier in the Barracks III.
Those right there are some beefy young lads.
Dr. Seabolt has invented a new gunpowder formula.
Find the Advanced Rocket Artillery in the Barracks III.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units using Advanced Rocket Artillery
The tune that those shells make while whistling down on the enemy is the same one I whistle in the shower.
New armor designs have led to an improved tank.
Find the Talon Tank in the Barracks III.
With armor like this, our tanks will dominate any battlefield.
We've increased the strength of our hull materials.
Find the Advanced Gunboat in the Shipyard III.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units using Advanced Gunboats
Hull of a job you did there. Get it? You improved the hull strength! Open-mike night is this Saturday. Heck yeah, I'm ready.
We've improved our propulsion systems, which means bigger carriers.
Find the Super Dimensional Carrier in the Shipyard III.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units using Super Dimensional Carriers
It's a ship, not a boat. Navy guys like to give me a lotta flack about that.
The improved gunpowder for artillery is ready for battleship shells.
Find the Advanced Battleship in the Shipyard III.
With this new and improved gunpowder, we can practically hit the enemy from drydock.
New materials mean our Fighters are faster and sturdier than ever.
Find the Advanced Drone Fighter in the Hangar III.
Inflict {total} Damage using Advanced Drone Fighters
Pappy said playing video games was a waste of time, but he didn't have Drone Fighters in his day.
We just keep getting better at making these things.
Find the Osprey Airship in the Hangar III.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units using Osprey Airships
Don't forget to upgrade these bad boys, and make 'em even deadlier.
We're lucky Dr. Seabolt is developing all this technology for our side.
Find the Hypersonic Bomber in the Hangar III.
I'd hate to be nearby when these guys drop their load.
Howdy! I am your new fabrication engineer. Call me G. Owari. Do not make fun of my name. It's a long story.
Barracks IV allow you to make the best units.
Once we build a Level 4 Barracks (and by we, I mean you), then we can produce some high-tech firepower!
You get credit for inflicting damage in any game mode.
Inflict {total} damage with Kodiak EXO Infantry Units.
Acceptable. Your reputation is accurate. Owari out.
G. Owari here, Commander. We need a place to work that is better than the food storage locker.
The Engineering Office will raise your maximum population.
I require a better office space. You want advanced tech; I need a place to think.
Increase your population to unlock advanced structures.
Build the Engineering Office Government Structure.
Simple, yet functional. This will do. Owari out.
Fabrication engineer G. Owari at your service. I have new plans for you.
Build a Shipyard IV for the best ships.
Once we build a Shipyard IV, we can begin making some ships that will impress you, without question.
Parts can be collected by asking your friends for help.
Inflict {total} damage with Narwhal Gunboat Units.
The facility is complete. This should fill you with joy. Owari out.
I used to get made fun of a lot when I was young. Look at me now.
Satellite Tracking Centers will help you track your satellites.
This structure will allow us to increase our population, because now we can watch everyone...all the time.
The more people you have, the higher your population.
Build the Satellite Tracking Center Government Structure.
Golly. You did it. Not that I doubted you would. Owari out.
Commander, this is G. Owari. In case you forgot, I am your new fabrication engineer.
Hangar IV can be found in the build menu.
I suggest you use these Tiger Moth Fighters. They will provide valuable experience.
I suggest you use these Tiger Moth Fighters. They will provide valuable experience.
Inflict {total} damage with Tiger Moth Fighters.
You think I have a stupid name? Well, same to you. And now you have an impressive Hangar IV, so chew on that. Owari out.
Purchase Upgrades for your units in the Research Lab.
Upgrading our troops in the Army Research Lab will increase their effectiveness in combat.
These new Cadets are a force to be reckoned with!
Get our upgraded Cadets into battle.
Upgrading a unit improves all units of the same type.
Keep upgrading units to make them better!
Upcoming night operations require extra equipment.
Ask your neighbors for Night Goggles.
Our troops are ready for night missions!
Improve Artillery to make your life easier.
Army Upgrades can be found in the Army Research Lab.
Upgrading our units will help us to win this war quickly.
Upgrade Tanks to be all they can be.
Army Upgrades can be found in the Army Research Lab.
Use the Upgraded Tanks in Combat
Whether stronger, cheaper or quicker to the field, our upgraded tanks are fearsome!
We need to continue to improve our Soldiers.
Click on Ask For Parts in the Army Research Lab to ask your friends for that part.
These upgrades make our soldiers better than they were before. No offense to them.
There are many upgrades available for each of your army units.
Use Upgraded Artillery Units in Combat
Our Artillery is raining destruction from the skies! The forecast calls for PAIN!
Keep upgrading Tanks to make them powerful.
Upgrade Blueprints will be needed to upgrade all of your units.
Nothing makes me happier than that newly upgraded Tank smell!
Take your upgraded Tanks for a test battle.
You can replay previous campaign maps to accomplish tasks.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units Using Upgraded Tanks
These upgraded tanks are not to be trifled with. No trifles allowed!
It's time to bring pride to our navy.
Naval upgrades will turn our navy into an unstoppable floating force.
When it was time to sink or swim, you swam! Or was it swum?
Our Gunboats need more gun and less boat.
Complete Naval Upgrades in the Naval Research Lab.
The Dark Alliance will respect our upgraded Navy's authority!
Purchase Naval Upgrades in the Naval Research Lab.
This is way better than a board with a nail in it!
Our Battleships are showing their age.
Purchase Naval Upgrades in the Naval Research Lab.
It's like a whole new Battleship! Now we're ready for anything.
Let's test out these upgraded Battleships.
Pick Battleships during the combat setup screen.
All the holes have been plugged, no leaks found. To battle!
We should keep upgrading our Navy.
Ask friends for items you need to complete upgrades.
The Dark Alliance didn't know what they were getting into with these babies!
Ask friends for items you need to complete upgrades.
I sure hope these new and improved Carriers will float.
Time for these Carriers to earn their keep!
Select Carriers in the combat setup screen.
Upgraded Carriers are, like, the bomb!
Purchase Naval Upgrades in the Naval Research Lab.
These Battleships are workin' it like a 24-hour deli.
You can never have enough firepower!
Upgrades make our units even deadlier.
Build an Air Force Research Lab
With research, our units become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.
Purchase Air Force Upgrades in the Air Force Research Lab.
Looks like you felt the need...the need for speed.
Upgrade any of our Fighter aircraft.
They were tough before, but now they're downright terrifying.
Improve an Airship with an Upgrade.
Complete an Upgrade for any Airship.
These upgraded Airships are more powerful than a blimp full of angry explosive monkeys!
Improve one of our Bombers with an Upgrade.
Bomber Upgrades can be found in the Air Force Research Lab.
Keep upgrading our Bombers, and we'll be one step (and one bomb) ahead of our enemy!
Add another upgrade to a Fighter, or upgrade a new Fighter.
Seeing these Fighters in action has broken the sound barrier...of my heart.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units with Upgraded Airships
We've bamboozled the enemy with the power of our upgraded units. BAM. Boozled.
Ask your friends for items you need to unlock Upgrades.
You've brought a new impact to the phrase, "You da bomb."
Send items to your friends and they may send something back.
Research and development -- it's not just for nerds anymore.
Use your upgraded Fighters to destroy the enemy.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units Using Upgraded Fighters
This Fighter squadron will KO just about anyone. Pow, right in the kisser!
Get your Airships ready for war.
You can purchase upgrades for all your air units in the Air Force Research Lab.
It brings tears to my eyes to watch our Airships in action. Both eyes, unlike some people.
Get your Bombers ready for a bombing spree.
You can upgrade any of your units using the appropriate Research Lab.
These Bombers will not only hurt them, they'll crush their self-esteem.
Time for an extended test run with our improved bombers.
Go back to past islands to re-play battles.
Destroy {total} Enemy Units Using Upgraded Bombers
Seeing these Bombers in action has made an old Sergeant happy. Me, I mean.
Get the Power-up Factory built in a critical area.
The Power-up Factory is now available! Here's your chance to unlock the ability to build power-ups whenever you want!
Build the new Experimental Hangar to get access to new units.
The Experimental Hangar can be found in the Military tab of the Build menu.
Complete Construction of the Experimental Hangar
All systems are operational, and we're ready to proceed!
Test the new Experimental Blackbird aircraft.
Find a Blackbird in your inventory.
I presume that the Blackbird performed to your expectations? What about my expectations? Hmmm?
Collect Element Z to power Experimental Units.
Ask your friends to send you Element Z.
Keep a supply of Element Z on-hand to power Experimental Units, Commander.
Test out our new experimental units in combat.
Click on the purple Special Ability button in combat.
If you see these units violating your airspace, you'll soil your pajamas, I assure you.
Test out our new experimental units in combat.
Click on the purple Special Ability button in combat.
Use the Blackbird's Special Ability {total} Times
Use the Starfire's Special Ability {total} Times
If I were emotionally capable of a hearty guffaw, I'd be doing just that.
Collect more Element Z to power Experimental Units.
Ask your friends to send you more Element Z.
Keep searching for new supplies of Element Z, or my research will be negatively impacted and I'll never get published.
Get More Information at Steele's Island
Dr. Seabolt is harnessing the power of a new element.
Click on the Hospital Ship found anchored near Steele's Island.
Commander, this new technology could fundamentally change the nature of combat. A new era dawns!
Build the new Experimental Shipyard to get access to new units.
The Experimental Shipyard can be found in the Military tab of the Build menu.
Complete Construction of the Experimental Shipyard
Systems are online and ready to build!
Test the new Experimental Hospital Ship.
Find a Hospital Ship in your inventory.
Use the Hospital Ship's Special Ability
See? SEE? They said I was MAD, I tell you! But who's mad now? Not me.
Collect Element Z to power Experimental Units.
Ask your friends to send you Element Z.
Element Z is vital to my Experimental Units! Keep a steady supply of the Z flowing in.
Test out our new experimental units in combat.
Click on the purple Special Ability button in combat.
Element Z has changed the world! Now behold our grandeur!
Test out our new experimental units in combat.
Click on the purple Special Ability button in combat.
Heal Friendly Units {total} Times with Hospital Ship
Use the Sea Shadow's Special Ability {total} Times
These special abilities open up a world of possibilites, don't you think? I do. Did you ask me? You don't have to.
Collect more Element Z to power Experimental Units.
Ask your friends to send you more Element Z.
Have I told you how important Element Z is to Experimental Units? No? Let me mention it now, then. It's crucial!!!
Build the new Experimental Barracks to get access to new units.
The Experimental Barracks can be found in the Military tab of the Build menu.
Complete Construction of the Experimental Barracks
Get some experience using the new Experimental unit.
Make sure you have some Element Z if you plan on using Special Abilities.
Use the M-163 Vulcan's Special Ability
This will come in handy in a pinch, when enemies get on your nerves. Vulcan! Nerve! Pinch! Get it?
Collect Element Z to power Experimental Units.
Ask your friends to send you Element Z.
When my Elementzeometer reads full, I am in my happy place.
Find the Experimental Army units in the Experimental Barracks.
These units shall be monuments to my genius. Actually, they should be bigger.
Test out our new experimental Army units in combat.
Click on the purple Special Ability button in combat.
Use the M-163 Vulcan's Special Ability {total} Times in Combat
Use the Tactical ATV's Special Ability {total} Times in Combat
You know, sometimes I amaze even myself.
We have the data Dr. Seabolt needs to continue. I guess.
Gather the materials Dr. Seabolt needs to further his research.
Ask your friends to send you Oscilloscopes.
Now we can start building Dr. Seabolt's godless laser experiment. I got a bad feeling about this.
Let's get Dr. Seabolt's research started right.
Purchase an Expansion under the Expansion tab of the Build menu.
He sure as heck needs a lot of room for a miniaturization project. He best not do a bigification beam.
Dr. Seabolt is making progress, but needs better equipement.
Ask your friends to send Microscopes. Be a pal and send them one, too.
When I was a boy, we didn't have them fancy microscopes. We just squinted real hard.
Dr. Seabolt gets so involved in his work, he forgets to eat.
Select Strawberries from the Farms to plant.
That Dr. Seabolt sure does love his strawberry waffles. Probably wants me to cut his food and feed it to him, too.
Dr. Seabolt wants to test the Sea Shadow under combat conditions.
Build the Sea Shadow from the Experimental Shipyard.
Inflict {total} Damage with the Sea Shadow
Use the Sea Shadow's Special Ability {total} Times
That crazy fool scientist apparently found whatever it was he was looking for.
Collect materials for Dr. Seabolt's experiment.
Ask your friends to send Liquid Nitrogen Tanks.
That's a lot of materials. What's he up to?
Dr. Seabolt's experiment blew up in his face. He's in bad shape.
The Hospital Ship can be found in the Experimental Shipyard.
Seabolt's experiment blew up in his face, but he's now stabilized thanks to your quick action.
Dr. Seabolt is on the mend, but could use some cheering up.
Ask your friends to send Bunsen Burners
Doc Seabolt is feeling better. Maybe he'll be more careful next time. Dang fool.
Dr. Seabolt wants to test for side effects from Element Z when used in combat.
Ask your friends to send High Speed Cameras.
Once you go Blackbird, you never go backbird.
Test out the effects of the Blackbird's special ability.
Make sure you have enough Element Z to use your special abilities.
