Seabolt's locked himself in his lab, like a rat, crunching numbers. He'll be up in there for a good long time.
Gather the supplies to make the World's Largest Burrito.
Harvest Farms on your Neighbor's islands.
Mmm, giant burrito. Too bad we didn't also make the World's Largest Bowl of Guacamole.
Collect tools to help maintain our vehicles.
Ask your friends to send you Precision Tool Kits.
These new toolkits will keep our advanced vehicles runnin' like a hyperactive hamster on a wheel.
Find out what others are doing to maintain their Army vehicles.
Visit Neighbors and Steele to find Army buildings.
Hmmm, interesting. You learn something new every day.
Find out what others are doing to maintain their Navy vehicles.
Visit Neighbors and Steele to find Navy buildings.
The eggheads told me this is paying off.
Find out what others are doing to maintain their Air Force vehicles.
Visit Neighbors and Steele to find Air Force buildings.
Have an Air Force Research Lab
We got it figured out. Totally makes sense to me.
This is how you maintain an advance fighting force.
Ask your friends to send you Duct Tape.
An army without duct tape is like a latrine without a magazine.
We're going to need to move the red lion monkeys out of harm's way.
Ask your neighbors to speed up your crops in order to harvest them sooner.
That's enough to feed an army of...well...monkeys. Hungry ones.
These little guys are not gonna come quietly.
Ask your friends to send you Tranquilizer Darts.
That should be enough, Commander. Time to round up the little poop-flingers.
Clear a path to the monkeys' habitat.
You can go back to fight old campaign battles you've already completed.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Air Units
Clear out the enemy units that are getting the monkeys riled up.
Using Power-Ups and Special Abilities won't count toward damage and kills.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Land Units
We've removed the last obstacle to reach the monkey habitat.
Collect Red Lion Monkeys in order to take them to their new habitat.
Ask your friends to help you round up the monkeys.
That was more fun than a barrel of...pickles.
Collect more food to feed the monkeys until the local flora can bounce back.
Be a pal and tend to your neighbors' crops. They might just return the favor.
The monkeys are safely living in their new habitat. Unfortunately, they all picked up a pack-a-day smoking habit from the ship's crew.
Place the Survival Mode HQ, and then activate Survival Mode.
If the Survival Mode HQ isn't on your map, check your inventory.
Begin Survival Mode and see how many rounds you can last!
Survive as many waves as you can!
Use Power-Ups and Experimental Units to survive longer.
A valiant effort, Commander. But...can you do better?
Collect materials to let Kai Tana know we mean business.
Tend neighbor houses to collect coins.
Gather {total} Coins from Tending Neighbor Buildings
That should be enough to let Kai Tana know we're serious.
Add to our navy and show our might to Kai Tana.
Use Power-Ups and Allies in battle.
Kai Tana must recognize the power of our navy.
Keep up the fight to show Kai Tana the worthiness of our military.
Attack your neighbors to collect Black Hearts.
Do you think Kai Tana is just running us in circles for no reason?
Kai Tana wants us to handle the supplies.
Look at your neighbors' portraits to see what kind of Ore they have.
We'll need some parts to get the Yamato running.
Ask your friends to send you Deck Turrets.
We have all the parts we need to complete the Yamato.
We need some pretty heavy duty things to get the Yamato running.
Have {total} Friends Volunteer to Help Pilot the Yamato
Look what else we found sitting in the shipyard.
Commander! We've found something fascinating in the previous administration's secret files. Interested?
Collect {total} secret files to learn the origins of the unit
Get {total} decoder rings from friends to decipher the files
Produce {total} wood to burn the secret files after reading
Exemplary work, Commander! With you on the case, I'm certain we'll get to the bottom of this mystery in record time!
Seabolt's putting you in the spy game, eh? Allies like Cy-Bark and me will help you stay alive.
Collect {total} {rare} to power Cy-Bark, Riptide's canine comrade
Acquire {total} defecting scientists to help enhance Cy-Bark
Pump {total} oil to keep Cy-Bark friction free
The spy game is all about keeping your friends close and your enemies closer. Luckily, Cy-Bark seems to like you!
Good job cracking those files! Too bad they're incomplete. However, they mentioned a miniature data drive...
Acquire {total} mini data drives for more info
Place {total} infantry troops to guard the data
Defend the data drives against Nurse Malady
Good job keeping that naughty nurse away from our drives. If anybody's certain to be carrying a virus, it's her.
The data files have plans for an Elite aircraft that is the most powerful of its kind. Where to find the blueprints?
Request {total} blueprints from friends to build the Elite unit
Battle Kung Fucius to steal the rest of the blueprints.
Earn {total} Energy from neighbor visits to read the blueprints
You've found all but one set of blueprints. We must discover where the last set is hidden. Hope you didn't have dinner plans tonight.
The last set of blueprints has been located on a nearby island. If you can get me the proper map, my crew can get us there.
Acquire {total} maps to guide Salty to the island.
Place a flotilla of {total} battleships to accompany Salty
Defeat The Eel's forces that are blocking your way
The Eel is slippery, but you've got quite the Kung Fu grip. Always fun to slap the seafood a little, right?
With the blueprint set complete, we can build the Elite unit! But are you ready to pilot it?
Get {total} helicopter training manuals to learn how to fly it
Harvest {total} corn for ethanol helicopter fuel
Win {total} Battle Blitz battles to sharpen your piloting skills
Nice stick work, Commander! Keep the rotors spinning and the good guys winning!
Fight for Your Right to Pilot
The Elite unit needs an advanced polymer windshield developed by Dr. Von Helman. Care to create it?
Get {total} gallons of advanced polymer to build the windshield
Take the windshield wipers from Von Helman's copters
Add {total} new allies to help you attach the wipers
Why does Von Helman create super-intelligent monkey henchmen? Is it some kind of payroll tax-dodge?
This Elite unit is gonna be sweet! Just finish the engine and you'll be racing through the sky!
Ask your friends for {total} air inlets
Visit allies and collect {total} coins to fund your efforts
Collect {total} flight suits to protect yourself in the air
Congratulations Commander! Soon we'll be flying high!
Look for clues as to the mysterious goings on around the island.
Look for clues on your neighbors' and Steele's islands.
Harvest Coins from Neighbor Houses {total} Times
We've done a lot of looking, but not a lot of finding. Even Mr. Jenkins, the groundskeeper, found nothing.
Find Keys to the Conundrum Contraption to get help. They must be somewhere.
Search Farms and ask your friends to send you Van Keys.
We have the keys and those meddling kids are ready to help!
Work your way to where the kids found the clue. It might get a little hairy.
Remember Steele is one of your neighbors and can always use your help.
Speed Up Neighbors' Ore Mines {total} Times
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Army Units
It can't be ghosts. Can it? Am I right? What's that noise?
Prepare some food for the hungry kids.
Ask your friends to speed up your crops so you can harvest them sooner.
The kids are back on the case! Such hearty appetites!
Follow up on another clue found at the old sawmill.
Your neighbors' Lumber Mills are a great place to look.
Harvest from Neighbors' Lumber Mills {total} Times
Speed Up Neighbors' Lumber Mills {total} Times
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Army Units
It's haunted. There's no other possible explanation. Or...is there? Is that a rubber mask?
The kids won't tell us what's going on until we give them Dooby Snacks.
What the heck is a Dooby Snack?
It was old Mr. Jenkins all along! And he would've gotten away with it, too...
It's time for the Squash Festival: the squashiest time of the year! Prepare the fairgrounds.
Ask your friends to send oil pumps for the delivery trucks.
We're ready to put together the fairgrounds.
An enemy army is using the fairgrounds as a staging area.
Re-play old battles to complete quest requirements.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Naval Units
The fairgrounds have been cleared of enemies, let's just hope there isn't any unexploded ordnance left in the field.
Get the squash to the festival...no matter the cost!
Ask your friends to send you Grady Squash.
Many events have shaped the course of human history. This year's Squash Festival may, in fact, top that list.
Search for hidden weapons on nearby islands.
Ask your friends to turn in Weapons Crates.
Collect Tax from Neighbor Houses {total} Times
Speed Up Neighbor Barracks Buildings {total} Times
We've been able to confiscate some contraband weapons, Commander.
Defend our weapons inspectors from retaliatory enemy attacks.
Go back to old campaign battles to deal damage and destroy units.
Inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Naval Units Using Upgraded Aircraft
Use Evasion I Power-Up {total} Times in Combat
Destroy {total} Enemy Air Units Using Upgraded Naval Units
The weapons inspectors are safe and sound, and ready to file a report.
Prepare a celebration for finding the contraband weapons.
Ask your friends for Festive Banners.
Create a safe environment for migrating butterflies.
The butterflies will need a safe area to eat and rest, but remember Corn is very slow to whither.
If that doesn't attract the little buggers, nothing will.
Gather materials to study the butterflies.
Dr. Seabolt needs your help gathering materials to study the butterflies.
We've started to tag the butterflies. Be careful. They're delicate!
Provide food for the migrating butterflies.
Let's make sure the butterflies have enough to eat.
That should be enough nourishment to see them through their journey. Unto the wind, little winged friends. Fly well!
It's turkey time! Let's get ready for a bountiful year, full of turkeys.
Ask your friends to send you Turkey Calls.
Preparations for the turkey hunt are waddling along.
We'll need a place to put the turkeys. Turkey pens should do the trick.
Ask your friends to approve your hunting permit.
Harvest {total} Wheat to feed the turkeys
Let's make sure we have enough side dishes to go with the turkeys.
What do we want with our turkey this year? Sweet potato pie, and more turkey!
Ask your friends to send the special Ocellated Turkey.
Harvest {total} Sweet Potatoes for sweet potato pie
Now it's time to get our turkey on! Gobble gobble!
That fool Seabolt says he has some new "insights" and needs some items. Give him all the help he needs, up to a point. Nerds can be pushy. No offense.
Dr. Seabolt has some new ideas for weapons.
Build an Air Force Research Lab to house the supercomputer
Somethin' blew the fuses in my barracks. Seabolt must have his new computer up and running.
Seabolt's requesting a supply of Zipples, some cockamamie drink he invented. And he wants cookies, too.
Supply Dr. Seabolt with whatever he needs.
That should keep that crazy scientist going for weeks.
I don't want a repeat of Seabolt's last little lab accident.
Keep Dr. Seabolt from hurting himself again.
Collect {total} Red Hearts to keep Seabolt's spirits up
Defeat the angry mob outside Seabolt's lab who want the noise to stop
Seabolt's happy and researching his little heart out. Let's hope this new research pays off down the road.
Prepare for the Black Forest Jubilee
Prepare gardens for another Black Forest Jubilee
Another party is on the horizon: Black Forest Jubilee time is here! Let's get the island ready!
Gather {total} Wood to build a pavillion
We're off to a great start!
Prepare for the Black Forest Jubilee
Get the word out that the party is almost here.
It's time to let the good people of the island know that Black Forest Jubilee is just around the corner!
Get {total} friends to RSVP for the Black Forest Jubilee
The stage is set and the invitations sent. Time to party!
Prepare for the Black Forest Jubilee
Provide a memorable Black Forest Jubilee
Supplies are going faster than we thought. Get some more food and drink out there, quick!
Place {total} Army Ambulances, in case the celebration gets out of hand
I think I ate too much. I've got sausage coming out both ends.
Cross likes to use his Scout Scope during his commute to avoid traffic jams.
Let's set up these Scout Scopes so we can record the training exercises.
Get friends to send you {total} Scout Scopes.
Did you see how they were twirling their rifles while doing backflips? What a cadence!
Help Cross Track the Squad Leaders
Fun Fact: You can actually power these GPS Tracking Devices with tomatoes.
Tomatoes are my favorite target out on the shooting range.
I also tagged Mac with a GPS Device. Why is he hanging around the docks every night at midnight?
Zipp Energy Drinks have no negative side effects... but not too many positive ones either.
I'm like a diesel engine in twelfth gear when drinking Zipp Energy Drinks!
Morning already? My men are gonna be both popping and locking at the next seminar with these new moves I cooked up.
We need specially tooled motors to take our sailors for Naval Exercises.
Outboard Motors with special plating will get us out to the ships for Naval Exercises.
Get friends to send you {total} Outboard Motors.
The first round of training was a hit, Commander.
We need a few more things before getting our ships into formation for the next Naval Exercise.
Collect {total} Safety Glasses because you can never be too careful.
Collect from {total} Government structures for a rainy day.
Build and place {total} Naval Units for the next Naval Exercise.
We're all set for the last Naval Exercise. The sailors are ready. Are you?
Collect, harvest, and fight! You know the drill.
Complete the Naval Training, and it's colelaw for everyone!
I need blueprints for putting a deck on my house. And cabbage for coleslaw for the party.
Collect {total} Upgrade Blueprints so Cross can upgrade.
Harvest {total} Cabbage to make Celebratory Coleslaw for finishing training.
The sailors are trained and pumped up for action. And, full of cole slaw.
Dawn of the Rising Sun 1 of 3
Cross took over and revamped Scarlett's news show, Eye on the Island.
I have a very dedicated audience for my morning show, Cross: Fired Up.
Get friends to send you {total} Diodes to fix Cross's transceiver.
Complete the Air Force training exercise.
I'm gonna dedicate this next song to you, Commander!
Dawn of the Rising Sun 2 of 3
Remember your coding mnemonic: Blame Baby Rabbits Or Your Garden But Victory Greases Wolves! Get Some Now!
I was a contestant in a game show once and they covered me in spiders. I can still feel them crawling on me at night.
Collect {total} Resistors to repair the Spider Mech.
Build and place {total} Air Force Units.
Do {total} Damage with Air Force Units.
Rebuilding that control panel sure was mech'ing me hungry. Ohm'man, I can't resistor a good pun!
Dawn of the Rising Sun 3 of 3
Spider silk can be used to replace broken reticles in rifle scopes. Aim for the blacks of their little eight eyes!
After we're done here I'm gonna ask Kai Tana out to a local sushi restaurant. The Spider Rolls are superb!
Alright! Let's gas'ser up and take'er for a test drive. I call shotgun!
Winterfest is my favorite time of year and Crossmas is my favorite holiday of the season! My traditions help keep the troops active and in top shape.
It's like caroling door-to-door, but with flashlights and men in fatigues.
Here's the drill: we visit each home and stand in the yard waving the tactical flashlights.
Collect rent {total} times from Neighbors' dwellings.
Nothing puts people in the holiday mood like a bunch of soldiers waving flashlights!
That excursion worked up my appetite. Let's bake my grandmother Gran-Nan's famous Crossmas tiger pie! It's mighty spicy, so be sure to bring the First Aid Kit.
Fun Fact: Gran-Nan always uses rendered bacon fat as the secret ingredient!
Gran-Nan is the best cook in the world, but she never eats her own food. Hmmm.
We always kept First Aid Kits under the seats at the dinner table during our holiday meals. Ah, memories!
Winterfest always feels wrong on a tropical island. Let's bring out the magic of Winterfest
Fun Fact: Snow is colder than sand. Unless it's cold sand. Or hot snow.
Don't forget to check your tires before driving in inclement weather.
Complete the Air Force training exercise.
That should just about do it, Commander. We have decorations, pies, and big tires. I don't think I could ask for anything more on Crossmas Day.
To celebrate our new line of military vehicles, we're sponsoring a game of Thighball, the most popular sport on the island.
These sporting events always bring out the worst in our people.
Ask your friends to send you balls and invade Neighbors because WE'RE NUMBER ONE!
Fight invaders who want to hit us while we're distracted by the big game.
Everyone is getting rowdy. We sometimes get carried away by the spirit of competition.
Things are getting a little out of hand. Most people wait to win or lose a game before they start rioting.
Take on the world in Battle Blitz
The entire island is in a frenzy.
Collect {total} Elephant Mascot Costumes for the Red Team.
Harvest {total} corn to make popcorn for the fans.
I thought popcorn and giant elephant suits would calm people down. I was wrong.
Okay, it's time for the big game. I hope people are too tired to cause any more trouble after it's over.
The Tigers and Elephants are evenly matched. This is an important game!
Find Black Hearts by invading and looting your Neighbors.
Collect {total} Tiger Mascot Costumes for the Blue Team. Rawr!
Fight the crazy, drunken soldiers who are out of control!
Game over. Who won? We all did! More or less. We blew off some steam, at least.
Ya know, Boss, that ol' Seabolt isn't the only inventor. I've got the next great gadget for our Invention Exchange and the future is now!
It's really more of a 3-and-a-half-D image projection.
My Crystalline Sonic Projector will change how the world views 3D images. Just don't tell Seabolt!
Have your friends build you {total} Crystalline Sonic Projectors.
Collect {total} Red Hearts. It'll help charm the other Inventors.
Test the Projector during the Navy training exercise.
Oh, this is great! Seabolt is going to be jealous of my fame and fortunes.
Okay the Projector is merely half of the packaged invention. The second half incorporates the sweetest smells we can inhale.
Speed up Lumber Mills, Ore Mines, or Oil Wells.
The only thing sweeter than revenge is Strawberries. Though I do love the juxtaposed smell of Industry Buildings.
Now we're on a roll! With this collection of aromas, we can start the next process.
Okay let's produce a few Odorophonic Scent Players so I can hand them out to the judges. They will smell my sweet success!
We're gonna need some Energy to power these devices. Also we should probably do a little clinical testing.
Have your friends build you {total} Odorophonic Scent Players.
Test the Scent Player during the Navy training exercise.
Boss, thanks for your help and all but that darn Seabolt won again. I can't believe he wowed the judges with his Hydro-Powered Hover Skates.
Long time no see, Commander. We should do a training exercise, after taking care of a crop problem. And, have you tried my coffee?
Nobody said it would be easy.
Visit neighbors to unwither their crops.
Way to go! I think I'm wired from the coffee! I love coffee! LOVE IT!
To be combat ready, we should place units, use our Allies, and pillage a few Neighbors.
You can place your Units anywhere on your island.
Combat readiness is next to godliness.
Allies provide an extra punch in battle.
Place {total} Army Units on your island.
Nice one. You're obviously in command for good reason.
Last task. We need to do an Air Force training exercise. Then, it's pumpkin and candy to celebrate.
Pumpkins can be grown on Farms.
Don't try to fit an entire pumpkin in your mouth. Cut it into smaller pieces.
Complete the Air Force training exercise.
I knew I could count on you. They said I couldn't, but I knew they were wrong.
Few know this, but I'm a huge fan of war re-enactments. I love analyzing obscure historical battles and forcing our troops to play them out.
Collect from the Government buildings to help fund our historical re-enactment.
Training exercises can be tough, but you gain great strategic experience.
Get the troops in the mood and complete the Army training exercise.
These Replica Cutlasses sure are dull but at least they're shiny.
Seems we're short a couple of generals. No worry I'll have Mac play G.T. Macregard and Seabolt play Winfield Scottbolt. I'm sure they'll be excited.
Let's give our Neighbors a good scare and invade them in our historical outfits.
Historical re-enactments are only fun if no one gets hurt, so don't put Chili Peppers in your eyes.
Did you see them running from General Macregard? The look of horrified confusion on Seabolt's face was priceless.
Seabolt was complaining that his pants kept slipping off and that's why his troops lost. I need Replica Belts for their trousers.
We'll outfit Seabolt's troops with some Replica Belts.
Survival Mode won't be easy, but nothing worth winning is ever achieved without effort. Except the lottery.
Success! Recreating battles gives us an edge.
The Romans once roamed these islands. They left behind historical artifacts. We could learn a thing or two about strategy from them, too.
Search for stolen artifacts on nearby islands.
Ask your friends to turn in Artifacts.
We've been able to recover some antiquities, commander. Impressive.
Those Romans knew how to fight. Let's take a page from their book and set up a proper phalanx.
Using classic military maneuvers, defeat your enemies!
Go back to old campaign battles to deal damage and destroy units.
Use Navy Units to destroy {total} Enemy Units.
Who knew that Rome's empire expanded to our little island?
When the Romans would return from battle, they'd shop in the market and then drink their wine. Sounds good to me!
The fighting is done, now tend to your fields.
Ask your friends for Amphoras of Wine.
Wait a minute! Those are Greek amphoras, not Roman! Some archaeologist YOU are.
I had a lot of leftover parts, and decided to create a cornucopia of contraptions to help you conclude your conflicts.
You can't build vehicles without gears. And unwithering crops is good practice...for something.
You may think that these tasks are unrelated, but just you wait. It'll all make sense soon.
Okay. I need more gears. We need carriers to move the new units we'll be building, and pineapples are just good to have around.
I did have a lot of leftover parts, just not a lot of gears.
Build a Carrier that you can use in battle, too!
You're good at doing stuff. Has anyone ever told you that? This is why you're the Commander, Commander!
One more training exercise to go. And this time, let's use some Experimental Abilities! And get more gears.
Life Is Like a Box of Gears
You need Element Z to use Experimental Abilities.
Now I have enough parts to make something useful for you. See? How could you ever doubt me?
We have to cross enemy lines to deliver a gift to a trusted ally, as a goodwill gesture.
Have your friends send you the items you need!
To win favor with our ally, we're going to present a nice gift. Getting it there won't be easy.
Destroy {total} Army Units using Air Force Class.
Take out the opposing Air Force threat.
Darn fine fighting. Darn fine collecting, too.
Our ally loves angora wool...and cabbage. Not together, though.
What goes good with mohair? That's right...angoa yarn.
Angora rabbits never hop on one leg.
Did you think this would be easy? A good gift takes blood, sweat, and tears. But keep the receipt, just in case.
We'll also be giving some honey combs, a symbol of our sweet alliance.
There are always fights to be fought in Battle Blitz.
Our ally wants to know that we're strong, so let's win a few Battle Blitz encounters.
Honey combs should never be eaten if they're covered in bees.
Use the Army Units to stop a rogue patrol.
I knew you had it in you. You've improved relations. Our ally loves the gift. We got a nice "thank you" note, too.
All that glitters IS gold. Complete to earn a Gold Cutthroat (315), a Gold Jackal (280) and a Gold Nightmare (190).
Defeat the brigade of Golden Naval Units.
Show your strength as a soldier, and you'll earn a Platinum Black Widow (400), an Elite Army Ambulance (200) and an Elite Panther Tank (320).
Get {total} Ammo Belts from friends to prepare for battle.
Without Power-Ups, deal {total} damage to enemy units.
We need three things, Commander. 1. Neutron Reflectors. 2. Eggplants. 3. Defeat an enemy force.
Eggplant can be grown in the ground.
It's a long story, but we need you to take care of the following things. It's important.
You can defeat any enemy to complete this task.
Use Upgraded Naval Units to inflict {total} Damage to Enemy Units.
Way to go. And thanks for not asking too many questions.
Time to roll up your sleeves and get busy. There's fighting to be done.
Enter Survival Mode in the War Room.
We need to flex our muscles. And don't forget the AA batteries...they aren't included.
Friends will send you items you need if you're nice to them.
No one will mess with us for a while. We're a lean, mean, fighting machine.
You may wonder why we need artichokes. It's a key ingredient in our tank paint.
Artichokes are much tastier than you'd think.
Let's get our KSK patches to show we mean business, then blast some faces with upgraded Army Units.
You can find enemy Air Force Units in the campaign battles.
Use Upgraded Army Units to destroy {total} Enemy Air Force Units.
Just like falling off an artichoke truck, isn't it?
Commander! I like to recreate battles with my miniature toy soldier army. Everyone needs a hobby.
Collecting rent increases your total coins.
My miniature horses need miniature saddles.
Ask you friends to send you parts that you need!
That'll make sure the miniature soldiers don't get chafed on their miniature legs.
We've got tiny saddles for the re-enactment, but no tiny soldiers. We need to do something about that.
Crops can be grown at your farms.
Once we have our miniature soldiers collected, we'll be ready to start placing them...almost.
Ask your friends for parts if you need help.
Excellent. Miniature soldiers are a lot easier to move around. They eat less, too.
Our miniature soldiers need one more thing for their 1/12 scale re-enactment.
Navy training exercises will keep your troops sharp.
How are the toy soldiers going to load their toy cannons? They'll need miniature ramrods, of course.
For parts, be sure to ask your friends.
Now we're all set. Let the re-enactment begin.
Commander, I have a Top Secret mission that requires your immediate attention!
We have to send in a squad disguised as Gurkha soldiers to take out Army Units. Collect Kukri Blades to make the disguise look convincing.
Visit your Neighbors for extra energy.
Destroy {total} Army Units using Army Units.
The plan worked! We've earned a nice reward from a few grateful allies.
I have a Classified mission for you, Commander. Don't tell anyone about it. Shhhh.
We need Cocked Hats like they wore in the old days. Then we need sunflowers, because old time admirals loved to eat sunflower seeds.
Ask friends to send you items that you need.
Destroy {total} Gunboat Units using Battleship Units.
Between the hats and the sunflower seeds, you are the very model of a modern major general.
This mission is Confidential. I'd tell you what it is, but then I'd have to kill you.
This mission is all about showing a trusted ally that we know what we're doing on the battlefield. Trust inspires confidence.
Use the War Room to enter Survival Mode.
You put on an impressive exhibition. Our allies are ready to help whenever we need them. Well done!
Hey there, Chief. If you can help with a project I'm working on, there's bound to be something in it for you.
I was researching classic inventions, since I always wanted to be an inventor myself. Why should Seabolt have all the fun? Help me out?
Ask your friends to help by sending the parts you need.
That's a good start. A thermoscope is useful if you want to check out your thermos.
Now we need some chili peppers and a special compass. I'm going to invent the heck out of something soon!
There is method to my madness. Really. Get the Cannon Compasses, Chili Peppers, and Black Hearts.
Chili Peppers can be grown on a farm.
I see...the square root of the sum of a right angle equals...carry the four...interesting. You wouldn't understand. Me neither.
One more step to go, then the big payoff.
A lot of people think that Robert Telescope invented the telescope. Not true. They have military applications.
Government Structures will pay out coins.
Nice! Now we take what I've learned, and according to my calculations...inventing is tougher than it looks.
We need to stock up on portable EKG machines. Our troops have very high cholesterol, and I'm concerned.
We want to make sure our troops are healthy, since they are exposed to so much {nrare1}.
Ask your friends to send you the parts you need.
This should help our troops live longer and healthier lives.
We received a batch of tanks without any loader hatches. That's a problem.
Without loader hatches, our tanks can't load. If they can't load, they can't lock. If they can't lock, they can't fire.
Expansions give you more space for your base.
Destroy {total} Naval Units using Army Units.
Good job finding those loader hatches. An unloaded tank is like an eclair without its cream filling...just an empty dough sack.
Are watermelons in season? They better be.
We need watermelons for target practice. They make a satsifying SPLOOSH when shot.
Watermelons won't grow in your stomach if you eat the seeds.
Disaster averted. You should have your image put on a postage stamp.
We need to do some mining. I've been put in charge of this initiative, because I like to dig.
Let's get digging! Ready ORE not, here we go! Get it? Mining humor!
Complete the Air Force Training Exercise.
You have a knack for mining. You were born to work underground!
There's one thing that miners like more than anything else. Let's get it for them.
Miners love pineapples. They love crushed pineapples even more.
Keep the miners happy while they work, and they will mine more.
Canaries will alert miners to the presence of dangerous gas underground.
Not only will the canaries help the miners avoid dangerous gas, but they'll make good company.
Commander! We made a deal with a neighboring empire to import some of their overstocked Power-Ups!
Complete to earn a Nuke, Poison Gas III, and 25 Energy!!
Commander! Our new top secret Neptune-VI Unmanned Underwater Vehicles are great! Let's investigate those underwater volcanoes!
Complete to earn an Elite Army Motorcycle, Nuke II, Air Strike III
Inflict {total} Damage to Navy Units using Upgraded Air Force Units.
Commander! We've been having troubles with wannabe pirates. We just need to scare them a little.
Complete to earn an Elite Advanced Bismark (640), an Accuracy III Power-Up, and an Air Strike III Power-Up.
Destroy {total} Navy Units using Upgraded Army Units.
I've got a special mission for you, but proceed only if you're willing to get your hands dirty!
Complete to earn an Elite Centauro, Nuke III and Field Repairs III
Collect {total} times from your Government Buildings
A special unit is just waiting to be found. Go on, this is right up your alley.
An Elite Dragonfly will be yours - if you can find some real dragonflies, first. They'll take you to their mother-ship.
Well done, that Elite Dragonfly is just waiting to be taken out for a spin!
Commander, our large units are getting too conspicuous. It might be time to downsize.
Small, but deadly. This Type 94 Tank packs a mean punch. Get yours while you still can.
Well done! Big isn't always better, you know.
It's time to harness some canine power.
No hound can resist the lure of a chew toy! You could lure a Doberman Tank to your empire if you got enough.
Success! Here's some doggy love in the form of a Doberman Tank.
Want to fly a Fokker? It's Dutch.
Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Well, it is a plane actually - a Fokker, no less. Stake your claim now!
Time to ascribe a new meaning to the term "Going Dutch". Go on; try out the Fokker in battle!
I've got some good news for you, Commander. It involves sand between your toes!
We're going off the road. Forgot your sun tan lotion? No worries, just find yourself some beach umbrellas.
Nicely done, Commander. We should go off-road more often!
Who's up for a nice cuppa?
Your troops will be thirsty after a grueling Survival Mode run. A nice, refreshing cup of tea will help.
Well fought, Guv'nor! You deserve some hot scones to go with that tea.
Nobody messes with a mean kitty.
Get your hands on the Elite King Tiger Tank and you're set, Commander.
Just listen to her purr. You did good, Commander.
There's something strange going on... reminiscent of the days of old.
Sighted: a creature of mythological origins near your Empire. Do you have the right resources to investigate?
The Behemoth's a monster on the battlefield!
Our forces could do with a boost in morale. How about a 'chute demonstration?
The SEAL Leap Frogs have agreed to a parachute demonstration. Their only request? Mascots. Lots of them.
A SEAL's staying on in your Empire. Looks like you made a friend!
Is there such a thing as a counterfeit ship?
Some of our allies have reported inconsistencies with the latest class of Yamato battleships. We'll need to authenticate the design.
Excellent! The glory Yamato class has been restored.
Let's throw a party to help the Foreign Legion deal with the culture shock. We could start French...
I noticed a lack of camaraderie among our foreign officers. I think I have a solution, but you should keep an open mind, Commander.
That went quite a way in strengthening the camaraderie among the foreign officers. You did good!
We'll have to stock up on Maroon Berets if we want to keep our Turks in uniform.
The Turkish Infantry is back and they go through caps like candy! Honestly, how does anyone wear out a cap that quickly?
Nice! Maroon looks good on you. But don't bring those berets near me - they clash horribly with my hair!
Build a Strike Team HQ to instantly take out invaders.
Once we get the Strike Team HQ built we can remove invaders instantly!
Now let's assemble some Strike Teams!
Assemble an Ambush Strike Team to instantly remove an invasion.
Assemble an Ambush Strike Team to instantly remove an invasion.
Haha! Those suckers never saw it coming!
Cross prefers to organize all of the units in each depot by color and class.
To store an airplane in the Air Depot, simply click on that unit and move it over the Air Depot. Click again to store it.
Place the Air Depot on your island.
Store any airplane in the Air Depot.
Nice work! That should keep those birds from gettin' all rusty! Oh, and these parts should help with the upgrades.
You can upgrade the Air Depot to hold more airplanes.
Storing our planes into these Depots will free up valuable real estate on our islands.
Add more space to your Depot to hold more planes.
Keep buildin' those Depots and upgrading them to maximum capacity.
Commander, we've just got access to the new Treasure Vault! We can retrieve spoils of war from it.
We'll gain access to vast treasures once we build the Treasure Vault. Such rewards that make my eyes sparkle.
Place the Treasure Vault on your island.
The construction crew left us some extra Vault Keys to open the Treasure Vault doors.
Cross prefers to organize all of the ships in each depot by color and class.
To store a ship in the Naval Depot, simply click on that ship and move it over the Naval Depot. Click again to store it.
Place the Naval Depot on your island.
Store any ship in the Naval Depot.
Nice work! That should keep those ships from gettin' all rusty! Oh, and these parts should help with the upgrades.
You can upgrade the Naval Depot to hold more ships.
Storing our ships into these Depots will free up valuable real estate.
Add more space to your Depot to hold more ships.
Keep buildin' those Depots and upgrading them to maximum capacity.
Don't like leaving your tanks with the valet after combat? Park them in the Depot!
To store a unit in the Army Depot, simply click on that unit and move it over the Army Depot. Click again to store it.
Place the Army Depot on your island.
Store any army unit in the Army Depot.
Alright! We won't have to hose down those tanks as often now that they're parked snuggly in that Depot!
You can upgrade the Army Depot to hold more units.
Storing our army units into these Depots will free up valuable real estate.
Add more space to your Depot to hold more units.
Keep buildin' those Depots and upgrading them to maximum capacity.
Build the Limited Edition Unit Factory
Let's build this bad boy so we can get access to those limited edition units!
The Limited Edition Unit Factory provides access to previously L.E.-only units.
Place the Limited Edition Unit Factory on your island.
Finish building the Limited Edition Unit Factory.
Alright! Now we can start cranking out some sweet limited edition units.
Click on the L.E. Unit Factory to see which limited edition units you can produce.
A new random set of limited edition units will become available when the timer expires.
Keep buildin' those limited edition units and check your factory for new ones to appear.
The arms dealer, Lt. B.F. Dealio, is in charge of a nearby island, but he won't evacuate the villagers. We must defeat him.
Click on the Show/hide available campaigns button next to the Battle Map to select Molten Terror.
This guy doesn't seem to care about the people on his part of the islands.
Lt. Dealio has a huge cache of weapons and is putting up a fight. Why is he resisting our humanitarian aid? He needs to be stopped.
Use Power-Ups to make battles easier.
I spoke with Sergeant Cross...Lt. Dealio trained with him. Seems like he learned a few things.
We don't have much time, and there are a lot of islands to help. Do whatever it takes to get past him.
Take some Experimental Units into the fight to mix things up.
Our military intelligence shows that he has a lot more high-tech firepower than he's using against us. What's his game?
His back is up against the wall. It could be a trap, but to what end? Finish this now, Commander.
Remember to use your allies - they can provide a wealth of optional help.
He surrendered, which is easy to do after losing the battle. Let's see what he has to say for himself.
Beau LeChomp has a baby sister. She's not part of the Dark Alliance, but still...she's kind of a jerk. Stop her.
Upgrade your units at the Research Labs to make them better.
We explained that we're trying to help the people she's protecting, but she won't listen.
She's asked that we send an envoy to begin rescue operations. I don't trust her. Be ready to fight.
You can create your own Power-Ups at the Power-Up Factory.
I thought so. She's crazy. And that pet possum...it's just plain creepy.
Bella-Jeane is ranting about a "Tiki-mask guy." She won't cooperate. Take her out, and I don't mean for a good time.
Ask your friends to send you items you need to improve your units.
It's strange that she'd resist so fiercely. She must be scared. With all that lava, who could blame her?
All right, Commander. Let's finish this. I have transport ships standing by to relocate the villagers. But first, Bella-Jeane needs to be bent over my knee.
Retreating from battle allows you to keep the units you still have alive.
Fierce little polecat, isn't she? She'll scratch your eyes out.
Intel repoted that the Isle of Yanuyanu was abandoned. They were almost right. Ezekiel Grunt was left here years ago, with an automated army.
Secondary Abilities can be a difference maker in combat. Just make sure you have enough Element Z to use them.
It's a small island, but the terrain is rugged. This guy is nutty as a peanut farm. He won't go down easily.
There's no one to evacuate from his island, but Grunt controls the waterways, and we need to clear them out. He's got to go.
I guess he didn't get the memo that the Dark Alliance left this area. He's loyal, give him that.
This is it. We'll be able to continue rescue operations once you defeat Grunt at his stronghold. I'm sure you can handle it.
Build newer units or upgrade the ones you have if you find a battle to be too hard.
Lt. Dealio wants to load up several transports with Ezekiel's automated units. He's always looking for an angle.
Motu Cay is filled with people. They need to be moved soon...molten lava is heading toward the largest village.
If none of your allies is available for a battle, you can hire the mercenaries you've unlocked.
He's the guy that has been pulling the strings, intimidating and bribing the other island leaders to resist. What gives?
He doesn't look like much, does he? Kind of reminds me of Sergeant Cross. Let's see if he's an equally bad fighter.
Look at the units the enemy is bringing to battle and select units that have a bonus against them.
He doesn't give up easily. I still don't see what can be gained from getting villagers killed.
I know a way we can cut off his troops. We'll have to take out the forward battalion first. And by we, I mean you.
Visit neighbors to help replenish your energy supply when it gets low.
I keep thinking about it. There must be something they don't want outsiders to find. But what?
We have him now, Commander. Hit 'em with everything we've got and we can still save the people.
Send gifts to your friends and they could very well send you one back.
He got away? That's bad. At least he left his personal helicopter behind, which Lt. Dealio wants to reverse engineer and produce for us.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Use Military Decorations near Military Structures to receive discounts when building units.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Use Military Decorations near Military Structures to receive discounts when building units.
Fill {total} Crew Slots for Military Decorations.
Build {total} Units with a Military discount greater than 15%.
While cleaning up Mac's apartment, I found this briefcase full of Coins under his sofa. Use it to build as many Military Decorations as you can!
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Use Housing Decorations near Housing Structures to receive a bonus when you collect rent.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Use Housing Decorations near Housing Structures to receive a bonus when you collect rent.
Fill {total} Crew Slots for Housing Decorations.
Collect from {total} Dwellings with a bonus greater than 20%.
I also found this briefcase full of Coins taped to the underside of Mac's toilet tank. I Think we should use it to build more Housing Decorations!
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Use Industry Decorations to gain extra output from Ore, Oil, and Wood Structures.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Industry Decorations near Industry Structures net us extra Ore, Oil, and Wood from contracts.
Fill {total} Crew Slots for Industry Decorations.
Collect from any Industry Structure with a bonus greater than 10%.
Mac's bed was feeling a bit lumpy so I cut open the mattress and found this briefcase full of Coins. I bet he wanted you to have it.
More Industry Decorations means bigger bonuses.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu.
Collect from {total} Wood Structures with a bonus greater than 15%.
Collect from {total} Oil Structures with a bonus greater than 20%.
Collect from {total} Ore Structures with a bonus greater than 25%.
I was ripping up Mac's ratty carpet and stepped on a loose floor board. I pulled it up and discovered a map and this briefcase full of Coins.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Use Government Decorations near Government Structures to boost Staff Visits.
Check out the Decorations Tab in the Build Menu. Government Decorations will boost Staff Visits for Government structures!
Fill {total} Crew Slots for Government Decorations.
Collect from {total} Government Structures with a Staff Visits Bonus greater than 10.
I was digging holes in Mac's backyard and I found these ignition keys inside a coffee can. You can have them. He obviously doesn't want them.
People need a place of refuge.
You can find the Bird Bath in the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
Our new park is off to a great start!
Continue reconstructing the park with an Animal Garden.
You can find the Animal Garden in the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
The people love the new park expansion!
Continue reconstructing the park with a Park Gazebo.
The Park Gazebo is in the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
Continue reconstructing the park with a Park Bridge.
You can find the Park Bridge in the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
The people are flocking to the memorial to show their appreciation!
You can find the Park Rose Garden in the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
The Rose Garden is a must see for our tourists!
Build a Park Maze Garden for the children visiting our parks.
The Maze Garden can be found under the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
Now the whole family can enjoy our beautiful park!
The people would like to honor their commander with a new park.
The people are proud of their commander!
Essential mail services must be restored.
Purchase Mailboxes under the Decorations tab of the Build Menu.
The citizens will be so grateful to communicate with their loved ones on the field.
Pedestrians are scared to walk at night.
The people can walk at night and feel safe!
Let's build a Titan Lab to piece together a giant robot of our own.
The Titan Lab can be found in your inventory.
Splendid! Keep collecting Titan Plates while I determine how to actually turn this thing on.
Place the Titan Lab on your island.
Finish construction of the Titan Lab.
Click on your finished Titan Lab to start deploying your Titan mech.
Click on your finished Titan Lab to start deploying your Titan mech.
Looks like you've got the hang of the Titan, sir! Enjoy wreaking more havoc with it.
Do battle five times with your Titan
Have 20 Titan Plates in your inventory
Build a palace in your honor. Your citizens will love you all the more for it!
Let's build a Palace to glorify your reign.
Boost your citizens' productivity with a magnificent palace.
Place the Palace on your island.
Harvest {total} crops as a gift from our citizens.
Excellent! Look at how grateful the citizens are!
Let's build an Element Z Refinery!
Let's build an Element Z Refinery.
Enlist your friends to collect Element Z.
Place the Element Z Refinery on your island.
Finish construction of the Element Z Refinery.
Excellent! Our Element Z supply lines are secured.
Place and build the Surveillance Tower
We should build a Surveillance Tower to reveal the hidden units
Place Surveillance Tower on your island.
Alright, now we can see what's out there!
To reveal the hidden units on your empire, collect the required parts to run a scan
Prepare a unit scan for your Surveillance Tower.
Run a unit scan using your Surveillance Tower.
Unit scan completed, sir! Now that we know what's out there, let's go get 'em.
Expand your empire to capture units
Capture the hidden units by expanding your empire to the area where the Surveillance Tower revealed them
Congratulations! You captured a hidden unit! More units may appear in our empire so expand and capture them all.
Build the Land Weapon Center to accelerate the production of Army Units.
Place the Land Weapon Center near Barracks for a 20% military bonus and 10% contract acceleration
Place the Land Weapon Center near Barracks for a 20% military bonus
Excellent! This Center is just our first step to advanced Military productivity.
Start a contract in your Barracks. You can build any unit you need.
That's right, keep those ground units coming!
Build the Air Weapon Center to accelerate Military production.
Place the Air Weapon Center near Hangars for a 15% military bonus and 10% contract acceleration.
Place the Air Weapon Center near Hangars for a 15% military bonus.
Well done! We're ready for the Fluxatron. Brace yourself now!
Start a contract in your Hanger. You can build any unit you need.
An idle hanger is a real waste of space.
Build the Sea Weapon Center to accelerate Military production.
Place the Sea Weapon Center next to Shipyards for a 15% bonus and 10% Naval Unit contract acceleration.
Place the Sea Weapon Center next to Shipyards for a 15% bonus.
That's it, we're another step closer to setting up the Fluxatron!
Start a contract in your Shipyard. You can build any unit you need.
A large fleet is a happy fleet. Keep her growing!
Sir, the Fluxatron will help us build military units faster! But before we can do that, we have to build the Land, Sea and Air Weapon Centers.
The Air Weapon Center would be an ideal enhancement for our Air Force production. And of course, we need it to build the Fluxatron!
Well done, Commander! You have unlocked the Fluxatron!
A Sea Weapon Center will get your Naval Units in shape faster. I would advise you to build one as soon as your can, Sir.
Click on enemy units to begin battle.
Objects can be moved around the map.
Click on Edit and select the move cursor to move items on the map.
Now you can change the look of your island.
Allies can turn the tide of battle. You must learn to use them.
Your allies can make the difference between defeat and victory.
Invisible Grant Air Force Research Lab
Invisible Grant Air Unit Depot Quest
Invisible Grant Navy Unit Depot Quest
Invisible Grant Army Unit Depot Quest
Invisible Grant FOX ALCATRAZ Promo Decoration
Invisible Grant Limited Edition Unit Factory
Repair the Parliament building and build the Missile Launch Station to prevent the next attack.
Click on the parliament building to repair the damages.
Finish repairing the damaged parliament building.
Excellent! Parliament has been repaired, we built our Missile Launch Station, and the attack was averted!
Hire friends to help you repair the Parliament immediately. Each friend will speed up the repairs by one day.
Finish rebuilding the destroyed Parliament building.
Excellent! Parliament has been rebuilt and the new tax has been abolished!
Set up a Defense Force. You'll never lose those units, and can gain Dominance Points with no risk if you win fights!
Keep your Defense Force up to date with the best units you have, and they can earn you Dominance Points with no risk of losing units!
Update your World Domination Defense Force.
With maneuvers like that, Commander, you'll be top-ranked in Dominance in no time!
I've been thinking about love. You know what I love? Diamonds. And you know who gave me diamonds this year? NO ONE! So let's blow some stuff up!
Diamond rings! I want at least one for each finger! And let's dish out some destruction to everyone who didn't buy me a ring. And no, I'm not bitter.
I never had a lot of boyfriends when I was young. I think my dad scared them off. Now my motto is: love 'em or blow 'em up.
A mean, iron-pumping machine is exactly what we need!
A mean, iron-pumping machine is exactly what we need!
Those dumbbells sure are hefty but they'll take me all the way to the heavyweight championships!
An intensive diet is like war, it changes a man. Maybe a few neighbor visits will help you get through it.
Kick those carbs to the curb!
Deal {total} damage against Air Force Units.
Way to kick those carbs to the curb! For this, you deserve some serious one-on-one mirror time.
Big, big muscles deserve teeny muscle tees. Let no one tell you otherwise!
Big, big muscles deserve teeny muscle tees. Let no one tell you otherwise!
Attired as a heavyweight should be! You cut quite the intimidating figure, Commander.
Commander, we've discovered a hornet threat, and not the kind that can be eliminated with bug spray!
A Humber Hornet could be yours if you play your cards right.
There's a buzz in the air - it's the sound of a happy Hornet in your empire. Well done!
I have a military exercise for you, Commander, and it's not going to be easy!
Anyone can win battles, but do you have what it takes to be a real hero? A Commendation Medal will tell.
Looks like you've got a hero's blood in you!
You can't be everywhere at once.
Deploy Strike Teams to defend your empire from invasions while you're away on military exercises.
You did well, Commander! The Strike Teams will defend your empire in your absence.
It's time to get a little bit more aggressive.
You've reached the final stage of this exercise, Commander. Get your fighters ready!
Build Units with a Military discount greater than {total} %
Complete the Air Force Training Exercise
You proved yourself worthy yet again, Commander!
I feel a tension building in your empire... you'd better take a look.
I sense the start of a possible civil war brewing. Time to get your face on - your war face!
That war paint is actually rather flattering on you. And I've heard it does amazing things for your skin.
A civil war is the last thing we need, Commander. With the rebels gaining support, you need to take immediate action.
A more aggressive approach is in order. We must uproot the rebels before they incite the masses.
You did well, Commander! But we're not done. Pockets of rebels are cropping up yet.
The unrest seems to be sizzling down, though there is still talk of an uprising, muffled as it may be.
The last of the rebels are hiding out in the forests around your empire. Your allies might have useful intel.
Nipped in the bud! The rebel situation is contained, Commander. For now!
Is it me, or does everyone seem... angrier than usual?
Why so serious, Commander? You seem a little miffed... ALL the time.
That's right, count to ten now. Or twenty.
It looks like bad tempers are as contagious as yawns.
Oh dear, I hoped you wouldn't rub off on the citizens of your empire... They're raging all over the place.
Destroy {total} Navy Units using Air Force Units
Just goes to show, you can get anyone to calm down if you feed them.
I think I know a way we can make use of all this anger flying around...
Channel that latent rage! Empires weren't conquered on borrowed cups of sugar. Invade! Invade!
There we go! Feel better? Nothing like a good hostile takeover to warm the cockles of your heart.
A friendly port! Build the Naval Officers' Club for a 20% Military and Housing bonus.
After weeks at sea, our officers need a place to batten their hatches.
For kids with big Air Force dreams - this Kite Park offers a hefty 30% Housing bonus.
Your Kite Park is ready! How high can you fly!
Army perks! The Military March offers a 15% Military bonus and a 15% Government bonus.
I don't know, but I've been told... our troops are mighty strong and bold!
Place the Army Boxing Gym next to Military buildings for a 20% bonus.
You now have a new Army Boxing Gym. The Navy's green with envy!
Make your Titan parts more powerful!
Place and build the Titan Research Center to effectively research and upgrade Titan parts.
Excellent! You can now build more powerful Titan parts - faster and cheaper!
Build and upgrade one Titan part in the Titan Research Center.
You did it! More new and improved Titan parts await you!
Build the Bounty Center to win Liberty Bonds in combat.
We can now expand faster! Let's build the Bounty Center right away to start earning more Liberty Bonds.
Excellent! Be more aggressive and you'll soon be expanding into your allies' empires!
Activate the Bounty Center and invade!
Once the Bounty Center is activated, you'll have one hour to collect as many Liberty Bonds as you can.
Ah, the sweet taste of liberty! There's an expansion with your name on it, Commander!
We have some hungry Special Ops soldiers on our hands.
The Kommando Spezialkrafte soldiers eat only Schnitzels. Stock up, quick!
Inflict {total} Damage to Navy Units using Upgraded Infantry Units
Mmm, I'll take mine breaded with a pepper-cream sauce!
Insubordination... I will not have it! I must bring something to your attention, Commander.
I saw wrinkles in our soldiers' uniforms. What next, juice stains? I want military creases right now!
There. Not too shabby at all. You'd be 'hard pressed' to find a wrinkle in our camp now!
A surprise inspection always throws up... surprises.
Our new recruits aren't really toeing the line. Their quarters are a mess! Set them to work, Commander.
Use {total} Explosive Ammo II Power-Ups in combat
Nicely done. You got the young 'uns to clean up their act real good!
It might be time for a new ordinance. I want nothing less than military perfection among our troops.
We need a stricter law to enforce military discipline among the troops... and some tougher exercises too!
Well done, I'll eat my toes if we ever see another hair out of place around here!
Sir, we have finally developed the ability to mine ores other than {rare}! The Super Ore Mine lets you produce all four ores from a single building.
Watch your step, Commander. There's a massive hole in the ground!
A sinkhole has opened up in your Empire. We'd better fix it up before anyone gets hurt!
You've managed to secure the area, but we're not done yet.
Now that we've secured the area, we have to make sure nobody's trapped in that sinkhole.
Let's launch a search and rescue mission to make sure there aren't any citizens trapped down the sinkhole.
Nicely done. All your people are accounted for and safe!
Time to make that sinkhole a thing of the past!
Excellent! It's almost like it never happened. All's well!
Commander, there's a heat wave coming! It looks like it's going to hit our southern coasts.
We're going to have to equip our tanks with air conditioners before the heat wave hits.
Brrrr! Ah, i could just bunk out in the tanks till the heat wave passes.
I have a mission for you, but proceed only if you don't have a crippling fear of arachnids!
A Black Widow Bomber could be yours if you can lure some live ones into your web.
Inflict {total} damage using Air Force Units
Good on you! That mission wasn't for the faint of heart.
I'm trying something new. You can help, Commander!
I read that studying the hunting behavior of Kestrels can improve our pilots' flying skills considerably.
The birds of prey deserve our gratitude. Our fighter pilots have never been sharper!
Tough and rugged. A warrior's coming!
An Elite HMS Warrior could be yours... if you can prove that you're worthy of one.
Destroy {total} Naval units using upgraded Air Force units
Spartans will run screaming for mommy when they see this Warrior!
I've discovered the wreck of an aircraft carrier sub near your Empire. We might be able to rebuild it.
This sub belongs in battle. We can get it going again if we can restore its aircraft catapult. Are you ready?
Good one! This carrier sub is ready to do some serious damage!
I have news for you, Commander. But we must be discreet, this is very sensitive information.
Our allies are stocking up on nukes and we're not going to be left behind - this IS an arms race. Don't get careless, though!
Well done, Commander! I'd tell you to use it wisely but I know you just want to nuke something.
Commander, we're seeing a sudden influx of refugees and our camps are filling up far too fast. We might have to ask our citizens to help out.
While we build more camps, our citizens will have to open their doors to the refugees.
This is just a temporary solution. As I feared, our citizens weren't too happy about their house guests.
Given a chance, these refugees would probably eat right through our food reserves. Get your gloves on, we're about to go a-planting!
Time to feed the hungry. With what, you ask? Pineapples. Lots of them.
Way to go, Commander! There's an almost biblical satisfaction to this.
Our refugee camps are coming up nicely, Commander. However, I don't think we'll be able to keep this up. There are more refugees coming in as I speak.
Perhaps our allies will take in some of these refugees. It's time to hone your skills of persuasion.
You're quite the diplomat, Commander! You have some very grateful refugees on your hands.
Complete the first phase of the Super Ore Mine to mine ores other than {rare}.
Build the Super Ore Mine to mine ore other than {rare}!
Very nice, you're now ready to start mining all the metals you need.
Can I have some ore, please?
Great job setting up the building - now let's complete it and make some ore!
I see you're really getting into this. We're not done yet, though. It's time to upgrade!
Now that you're producing all this ore, let's boost our production capabilities.
Upgrade the Super Ore Mine to mine faster.
Upgrade one ore mine to level II
Upgrade one ore mine to level III
Upgrade one ore mine to level IV
Nicely done, that's a whole lot of ore coming your way!
Build the Prison Camp to earn more XP!
Complete the Prison Camp to capture prisoners via neighbor invasions and earn twice the XP payout!
Each prisoner in your camp brings you closer to a double XP payout on all actions.
Invade neighbors and imprison them in your Camp to activate the XP buffs.
Don't rest easy just yet! Keeping your prisoners behind bars will take some work.
I've heard some pretty creepy stories about our War Cemetary, Commander; stories about restless spirits and unusual sounds. Why don't we camp out there one night... unless you're scared, of course?
Accept the dare and you could find a Spectre Night Ops in your possession.
Some of those spirits took a liking to you, Commander. Expect to have some visitors over later tonight.
Alpinis in the house! Lure a squadron of this Italian mountain infantry to your Empire.
Alpinis love their Black Feather motifs. Collect enough and a unit of Italy's finest could be yours!
Mission accomplished. Alpinis in house, indeed!
I know the Easter Bunny doesn't exist. But it's that time of year again - chocolate egg time. Find me that Bunny!
Chocolate Eggs - I want lots of them! Where does that fictitious Bunny hide... in cabbage patches? Who cares? Search the farms!
Destroy {total} Army Units using upgraded Navy Units
Chocolate Easter eggs hold a certain power over me.
Commander, our coast guard has recovered a battered shipping container full of stolen Power-Ups.
We're lucky to have retrieved this cargo, but it's very fragile. You can't be too careful around nukes!
Deal {total} damage to Air Force Units using Navy Units
Way to go! Feeling Power-Up-ful today?
Sir, I have a military exercise for you. But I warn you, it will eat away at your courage!
There's an Elite Ekranoplan to be won if you succeed. You might need some liquid courage to win this Russian beauty.
This ship guzzles fuel like a thirsty sailor! Pour some of that courage into her for good measure.
Commander, my news will make you explode with excitement. All I can say is that you'll soon have the drop on your enemies.
You can move closer to the pinnacle of power with every nuke added to your arsenal.
It's yours! I won't be surprised if your enemies now try to get on your good side.
Your enemies are gunning for you Commander, and they are going to win unless you do something about it fast.
Straight from Russia with love, the Elite SU-122 Tank will make your enemies see red.
Dance the Troika, Commander. Nothing like a Russian folk dance to celebrate your win!
Commander, how enterprising do you get, when it comes to the dangerous business of war?
Play your cards right and USS Enterprise Carrier could be yours!
That was enterprising enough Commander. Well done! Your enemies are now caught between the devil and the deep sea, literally.
I have a proposition for you. My Empire is overrun with rodents. I have a pair of Fighters I'm willing to trade in exchange for some birds of prey.
Up for grabs: an Elite P-40 Warhawk and F18 Hornet. Do you have what it takes to win this mean pair?
Take to that aerial battlefield, Commander! And thanks, hawks will make my rodent problem old news.
Get your head in the game, Commander! There's a wildcat on the loose and it's wreaking havoc in our Empire.
Catch that wildcat and this Elite Super Lynx will be yours. I'll throw in a fistful of Power-Ups too!
None of those Lynxes was the real deal, but you get props for trying to pull a fast one on me, Commander.
I have some exciting news, Commander! We're bringing the world's fastest motor sport to our Empire - the air races!
The air races are here! And there's a racing veteran up for grabs if you can pull this off.
Deal {total} damage to Air Force Units using Air Force Units
Nicely played, Commander. Take your Mustang out for a spin - it's just waiting to fly!
Commander! We have a situation in our Empire that requires your immediate attention.
Some wild animals have been spotted on the borders of the Empire. Get your camouflage ready, we're going deep into the jungle to find them.
The jungles are yours to tame with the Elite Panther Tank and Rhino AFV.
I've had something on my mind lately. It starts with "Liberty" and ends with "Bond".
There's a pack of a hundred, that's right, one hundred Liberty Bonds waiting for you if you want it bad enough.
Deal {total} damage to Air Force Units using upgraded Navy Units
Ah, the sweet scent of expansions! Enjoy your Liberty Bond pack, Commander. You deserve it!
Commander, you've been looking drawn of late. I think I have something that will keep you going all night long.
Strawberries and Energy Bars will put a zing in your step, Commander. Trust me on this. All. Night. Long.
Here's a nice fat package of Energy to make your ears pop!
Commander, we're refitting our Rafale Fighters with a new integrated defensive aid suite. But we're running short on funds.
Raise the funds, collect the SPECTRA defensive aid system blueprints, test the new Rafales out in battle, and we're all set!
Nice, this class of Fighters has a real edge over the competition now!
Commander, it looks like our grant for our Future Combat Systems program may be approved. This is good news, indeed!
Once we get our Grant Approvals, we can set out Future Combat Systems program back in motion. Up first: the NLOS Cannon Artillery.
Nice work! The FCS program stays alive thanks to you, Commander.
Spotted: an enemy Crocodile in our air space! No, you read that right. There's a Hind 'Croc' Copter that needs capturing.
We need to intercept the Croc before it does any serious damage. I have a plan that involves some Crocodile Scales. Just don't ask too many questions.
You made that look like child's play! Congratulations, you get to keep the spoils of battle.
Get ready to don the gray again, Commander. We're going back to the 1860s!
Commander, you and I are going to get to the core of the Confederate Army's hits and misses.
For all your hard work, here's a HL Hunley Sub and a unit of the Confederate Infantry to add to your battalion.
I have exciting news! We're bringing our version of the Frecce Tricolori aerobatic show to our Empire!
The Tricolori Fighters have been known to pull off some spectacular maneuvers in the air. Let's see what they can do!
Deal {total} damage to Air Force Units using Air Force Units
I haven't seen dives, rolls and tail spins like that in a long time! This Fighter is always going to be entertaining.
It's time to harness the power of a small, but mean little carnivore.
There's a mighty Mongoose hanging around, just looking for some fun. Some Snake Chew Toys ought to lure it in.
Win {total} Fights in World Dominance using Land Units
Success! Here's some love in the form of a Mongoose Attack Copter.
Build the Energy Cradle to increase your maximum Energy cap!
Complete the Energy Cradle and increase the limit on your maximum Energy!
Excellent! Keep the Energy Cradle replenished with supplies and you'll be skipping about like a kid on Halloween.
You'll need Oil and {rare} to activate the Energy Cradle.
With some Oil and {rare} you can activate the Energy Cradle and boost your maximum Energy to 60.
Success! Keep reactivating the Energy Cradle to maintain your Energy boost.
I sense unrest brewing among our allies. Some of them are being accused treating POWs poorly. This situation could escalate if we're not careful.
Let's organize a convention to review the existing decree concerning the treatment of Prisoners of War.
You've got your allies together. Now let's see if you can get them to agree on something.
The evidence presented points to inhumane treatmen of POWs who labor in the Research Labs. Looks like it's inspection time.
We're going to have to inspect our Army Research Lab for evidence of inhumane POW treatment.
Deal {total} damage against Air Force units
Your Lab was clean, but some of your allies didn't emerge guilt-free. Clearly, we need to establish a new decree. Tighten those reins!
Commander, the evidence has been scrutinized. It's time to reconvene over the decree on the humane treatment of Prisoners of War.
Some of your allies are determined to make this review difficult. Stand your ground and show them who's boss!
You got your allies to sign the new POW decree. I'd tip my hat to you, Commander... if I had one.
Build a Neighborhood to accommodate several Houses in one spot.
Neatly done, Commander! Thats's one Neighborhood block in place. Time to fill her up!
You'll need to staff your Neighborhood to unlock the 5th slot.
Enjoying the community feeling? It only gets better - and higher.
Unlock slot 5 in the first Neighborhood Block
Expand to Block 2 of your Neighborhood to make more space in your Empire.
Well done, Commander. The Blocks are a-rising!
Commander, look sharp! Suspected pirates have been spotted along the coast. You must prevent them from raiding your trading ships.
There's a different kind of storm brewing at sea! It's possible pirate trouble. Send out a submarine reconnaissance team at once. Be careful!
Ahoy there, you did great job of homing in on those thieves at sea. Let them fly the Jolly Roger, you're ready to take them down.
Pirates confirmed! Commander you'll simply have to show them who's in charge.
Take the plunge and send out your naval forces. Those pilfering piratical pests are gonna be history soon.
Aye Cap'n, that's the way to teach 'em a lesson. You've now captured two pirate ships. Make sure the coast is clear before pausing to celebrate.
The pirates are out of their depth. You've made them wary but you'll have to blow them right out of the water.
Dive into this mission and complete it. Those pirates are now all at sea...literally - they have no idea what hit them.
Destroy {total} Navy Units using upgraded Navy Units
Commander, what a swashbuckling victory. You really bust those bad buccaneers. They won't be back for a while. Well done!
Commander, your troubles are soaring sky high. There appears to be an unidentified aircraft in your airspace and it sure looks hostile.
It's not alien, but the unidentified aircraft we've spotted possibly employs new battle technology. Warn your pilots to keep their distance.
You took out one engine on the enemy craft! That was some achievement considering they are using really advanced fight technology.
Your enemy has superior grade gun power in their favor. But your Air Force isn't too shabby either. Show 'em what you got!
Pursue and shoot to win. Destroying the enemy craft won't be easy; you'll have to do your best.
Oh my! Your pilots deserve medals of honor, Commander. They've caused plenty of damage to the flying battleship.
With the damage you've dealt, the enemy doesn't stand a chance. Don't get too cocky though.
Deal the final blow to the enemy craft. Pilot your Empire to victory!
Deal {total} damage to Air Force Units using Air Force Units
Enemy craft down! Congratulations. Now you can study their advanced tech and give yourself a few upgrades.
Commander, I've just received a deployment order for a secret mission, Operation M59. Before we can begin, our soldiers must undergo special training.
Get your Boot Camp Cadences ready, this is going to be a rough ride.
Good to see you got your men through that training camp, Commander. But the hard stuff is only beginning.
It's time to begin Operation M59. Be cautious though, I fear our position may already be compromised.
Abort! Abort! The mission is compromised. We're under attack!
Deal {total} damage to Army Units using Army Units
Your quick actions made all the difference, commander! Now, let's see if we can salvage Operation M59.
We have new orders, Commander. It's time to regroup and get Operation M59 underway.
An insurgent group is deploying specially modified Bombers across the Empires. We need to locate and destroy their fleets.
You did good, Commander. Chapter closed.
Trouble again Commander! An extremist group has taken hostages and is holding your Empire to ransom.
With hostage lives at stake, this is a delicate situation that requires tough action. But first, try to negotiate.
Collect {total} Mediators to use in negotiations
Destroy {total} enemy Army Units using upgraded Tanks
They now know you mean business, but you're not out of the woods yet.
The negotiations broke down and the hostage situation has escalated. It's time to bring out the big guns.
Let's show these extremists who's boss! Deploy your special forces.
That's the way to go! You've made them shake in their boots.
We managed to shake this band of extremists. I suggest you strike while you have the advantage, Commander.
They're nervous now. Let's get ourselves an unconditional surrender.
Congratulations Commander, the hostages are safe and the extremists are behind bars. You won this round with aplomb.
Mayday, Mayday! Trouble for your troops on the battlefield, Commander; their units are malfunctioning. We must send help at once.
Guns jamming, target focus on the blink and good grief, all radar equipment malfunctioning. If we don't help our troops, this battle is surely lost.
Complete the Air Force Training Exercise
There's hope on the horizon. The Engineers have finally reached the troops. This battle is far from over!
A temporary retreat is advisable commander. No, no, we're not surrendering, just getting fixed up in order to get out of this fix.
Our troops need a fighting chance. Let's get these malfunctioning units repaired and ensure they get one!
Deal {total} damage against Air Force Units
Well done! Everything is up and running and working just fine. Now that we're all fixed up, let's get back into battle and fix their wagon.
We almost lost the battle and we need to know what went wrong. Let's delve deeper and get to the bottom of this.
This is serious. We can't afford to have another incident with malfunctioning units. It's time to investigate.
You've certainly proven your mettle, Commander. You swept into action and helped your troops to victory. Congratulations!
I have a covert mission for you. We must rescue a pair of diplomats from hostile, enemy territory.
This mission is fraught with danger. The only way to approach the target is by sneaking ashore in the dead of night.
The night gave you cover, but I hope you remembered to cover your tracks!
Now that you've breached enemy lines, it's of the utmost importance that you don't lose your cover.
Scout the premises and make yourself known to your targets. Remember, time is of the essence, but so is your cover.
You've established contact with the diplomats without being discovered. Now, to get them out of there.
Careful, Commander. This rescue mission could spiral downwards fast at the slightest hitch. You must not fail.
Getting in was one thing. Getting out undetected with the diplomats is another ball game entirely. Stay on your toes, Commander!
They'll be making movies about you, Commander. If only the details of this mission could be made public\u2026
We're heading out into the future.
Dual Band Radar Imaging is all the rage now. It works particularly well with the Zumwalt Battleships.
I see you have an eye on the future, Commander. Very wise, indeed.
Place the Grand Citadel near military buildings to activate the bonus.
Success! 'Tis grand indeed, this Citadel. Go on and enjoy its fine, military benefits.
Complete the Element Z Collider to produce Element Z in your Empire!
Build the Element Z Collider to produce Element Z as easily as any other resource!
Build the Element Z Collider to produce Element Z as easily as any other resource!
Success! Keep those contracts going and you'll be deploying experimental units and Titans all the time.
Start a contract to produce Element Z in your Empire.
As easy as pie! Get those Titans into the field, already!
Place the Intelligence Bureau near military buildings to activate the bonus.
Agents of terror, beware. We are coming for you.
Place the Turkmen Assembly near industrial buildings and houses to activate the 20% bonus.
Should have taken a language course in Turkmen instead of calculus in school. It's certainly more useful!
Build La Station Militaire for a 15% industrial bonus and a 15% acceleration on military production.
Tr\u00c3\u00a8s bien! Now that it's all set up, go ahead and start channeling good old Bonaparte's stratagems.
I just won a battle in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just created my first army in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just created my first navy in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just created my first air force in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
I just defeated a villain in Empires & Allies! Here are some rewards I want to share with you.
Hello friend! Come be my neighbor in Empires and Allies and together we can build empires and defeat our enemies.
Hello friend! Come be my ally in Empires & Allies and together we can build empires and defeat our enemies.
Click here! Head on over to Empires & Allies!
Build Element Z Collider to produce Element Z. Seabolt is giving you 3 parts to get started. Accept to claim!
Commander! We noticed that you have {x} Empire Points in your account. Use them to expand your military might! Play Empire and Allies Now!
Energy Cradle is here to provide long lasting energy. Seabolt is giving you 3 parts to get started. Accept to claim!
Intelligence Bureau is here to provide you military benefits. Scarlett is giving you 3 parts to build it. Accept to claim!
Who's up for an international exchange? Scarlett is giving you 3 parts to build the Turkmen Assembly. Accept the claim!
Houses taking up too much space? Scarlett is giving you 3 parts to unlock additional block in Neighborhood. Accept the claim!
Your defense force has been defeated by {user,name}. Take revenge now!

Your defense force has been defeated by {user,masc}. Take revenge now!
